original: de ni 'di skad du 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pas bag chags rnam pa gsum yongs su bzung ba'i dbang gis nying mtshams sbyor ba rgyun mi 'chad par gyur to zhes ston to //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pas bag chags rnam pa gsum yongs su bzung ba'i dbang gis nying mtshams sbyor ba rgyun mi 'chad par gyur to zhes ston to //
translated: This is what is being taught: “In this way, the continuity of rebirth is uninterrupted due to the power of the foundation consciousness’s complete appropriation of the three kinds of habitual tendencies.”

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Establishing Knowledge-Only states:

original: gzhan yang 'khor ba'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'khor ba'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ni /
translated: “Moreover, the continuity of saṃsāra

original: bag chags rnams las gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: bag chags rnams las gyur pa yin te /
translated: is due to habitual tendencies.

original: bag chags de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bag chags de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Those habitual tendencies, in brief, are of three kinds.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa'i bag chags dang / srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa'i bag chags dang / srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: the habitual tendencies of verbal expressions, the habitual tendencies of grasping a self, and the habitual tendencies of the members of existence.”

original: sa bon pa'i rnam par shes pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sa bon pa'i rnam par shes pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That seed consciousness is also of two kinds.

original: dang po ni rnam par shes pas yongs su gzung ba'i sa bon la sa bon pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang po ni rnam par shes pas yongs su gzung ba'i sa bon la sa bon pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The first is called the seed consciousness because it is the seed that is appropriated by consciousness.

original: gnyis pa ni sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa la sa bon pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa la sa bon pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The second is called the consciousness that holds the seeds, because it holds the seeds.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis yod mod kyi 'dir ni sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa yang dag par ston te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis yod mod kyi 'dir ni sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa yang dag par ston te /
translated: Although these two kinds of consciousness exist, here the consciousness that holds the seeds is being taught.

original: lus kyi yan lag 'byung ba la gnas pa dang / sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / des yongs su gzung ba'i sa @221b bon ni bag chags rnam pa gsum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi yan lag 'byung ba la gnas pa dang / sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / des yongs su gzung ba'i sa @221b bon ni bag chags rnam pa gsum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis for the arising of the body and its members and because it holds the seeds, and because the seeds held by it are the three kinds of perfuming.

original: 'dir bag chags rnam pa gsum po de 'dir mdo tsam du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir bag chags rnam pa gsum po de 'dir mdo tsam du bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here, the three kinds of perfuming are explained in brief.

original: bag chags rnam pa gsum po de yang sgo rnam pa bzhis rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: bag chags rnam pa gsum po de yang sgo rnam pa bzhis rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
translated: These three kinds of perfuming are distinguished by four kinds of doors.

original: nges tshig rnam par bshad pa dang / ngo bo nyid bstan pa dang / 'bras bu bskyed pa'i bye brag bstan pa dang / rkyen rnam pa bzhis rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: nges tshig rnam par bshad pa dang / ngo bo nyid bstan pa dang / 'bras bu bskyed pa'i bye brag bstan pa dang / rkyen rnam pa bzhis rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: They are the explanation of the etymology, the teaching of their natures, the teaching of the differences in the results they produce, and the distinction of the four conditions.

original: de la dang po nges tshig rnam par bshad pa yid spyi dang bye brag gis bstan te /
analyzed: de la dang po nges tshig rnam par bshad pa yid spyi dang bye brag gis bstan te /
translated: The first of these is the etymological definition, which is taught in general and in particular.

original: de la bag chags rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ming ngo //
analyzed: de la bag chags rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ming ngo //
translated: The general name is “the three kinds of habitual propensities.”

original: gsum zhes bya ba ni grangs smos pa'o //
analyzed: gsum zhes bya ba ni grangs smos pa'o //
translated: The word “three” indicates the number.

original: bag chags zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa la bag chags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bag chags zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa la bag chags zhes bya'o //
translated: The word “habitual propensities” is a verbal expression.

original: brgyad pa la yod pa'i sa bon gyi bag chags cha yin pa'i phyir bag chags zhes bya ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa la yod pa'i sa bon gyi bag chags cha yin pa'i phyir bag chags zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called “habitual propensities” because it is a part of the seed-habitual propensities that exist in the eighth consciousness.

original: 'di rnam par bshad pa drug las grangs dang bcas pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnam par bshad pa drug las grangs dang bcas pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the number among the six explanations.

original: de la bye brag gi ming ni bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: de la bye brag gi ming ni bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du /
translated: The particular names are as they are found in the treatise Explanation of the Five Aggregates:

original: bag chags rnams kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bag chags rnams kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: “The habitual propensities are also, in brief, of three kinds.

original: de la mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, the verbal expression habitual propensities are as follows:

original: 'dus byas kyi chos so so tha dad pa'i nye ba'i sa bon no //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos so so tha dad pa'i nye ba'i sa bon no //
translated: They are the seeds of the individual, separate conditioned dharmas.

original: mngon par brjod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: And there are two kinds of expression:

original: don mtshon pa'i mngon par brjod pa ni don brjod pa'i sgra'i bye brag go //
analyzed: don mtshon pa'i mngon par brjod pa ni don brjod pa'i sgra'i bye brag go //
translated: The expression that indicates the meaning is the particular sound that expresses the meaning.

original: yul mtshon pa'i mngon par brjod pa ni yul khong du chud par byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: yul mtshon pa'i mngon par brjod pa ni yul khong du chud par byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The expression that indicates the object is the mind and mental activities that cause the object to be understood.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i bag chags ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i bag chags ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The latent impressions of the view of a self are as follows:

original: yang dag pa ma yin pas bdag dang bdag gir bzung ba'i sa bon no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pas bdag dang bdag gir bzung ba'i sa bon no //
translated: The seeds of the grasping of self and of “mine” through the unreal imagination.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: And there are two kinds of grasping a self:

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i bdag tu 'dzin pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i bdag tu 'dzin pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The innate grasping of a self is the grasping of self and of “mine” that is to be eliminated by the path of cultivation.

original: kun du brtags pa'i bdag tu 'dzin ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i bdag tu 'dzin ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The imagined grasping of a self is the grasping of self and of “mine” that is to be eliminated by the path of insight.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis kyis yongs su bsgos pa las mngon par 'grub pa'i sa bon gyis @222a * //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis kyis yongs su bsgos pa las mngon par 'grub pa'i sa bon gyis @222a * //
translated: The seeds that are perfumed by the two kinds of grasping a self

original: sems can rnams bdag dang gzhan zhes bye brag tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams bdag dang gzhan zhes bye brag tu byed pa'o //
translated: Sentient beings are distinguished as self and other.

original: sred pa'i yan lag gi bag chags ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sred pa'i yan lag gi bag chags ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The latent tendency of the member of craving is as follows:

original: khams gsum ba'i rnam par smin pa 'dren pa'i las kyi sa bon no //
analyzed: khams gsum ba'i rnam par smin pa 'dren pa'i las kyi sa bon no //
translated: it is the seed of karma that attracts the maturation of the three realms.

original: srid pa'i yan lag kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The member of existence is also twofold:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba ni 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba 'dren pa'i las gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba ni 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba 'dren pa'i las gang yin pa'o //
translated: it is the wholesome with-outflows that is the karma that attracts a pleasant result,

original: mi dge ba ni 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba ma yin pa 'dren pa'i las gang yin pa'o zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /🔽bag chags rnam pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid bstan bcos dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba ma yin pa 'dren pa'i las gang yin pa'o zhes bshad pa lta bu ste / bag chags rnam pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid bstan bcos dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: and it is the unwholesome that is the karma that attracts an unpleasant result.🔽The three kinds of latent tendencies should be understood as they appear in the treatises.

original: bag chags rnam pa gsum char yang bdag po'i dbang du byas nas rnam par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: bag chags rnam pa gsum char yang bdag po'i dbang du byas nas rnam par bshad pa yin te /
translated: All three kinds of latent tendencies are explained in terms of the dominant condition.

original: 'di ltar mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyi sa bon yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyi sa bon yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the seed of the latent impressions of verbal expression, and likewise, because it is the seed of the latent impressions of the members of existence.

original: de la ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang sngar bshad pa bzhin du mngon par brjod pa rnam pa gnyis kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon gang yin pa de ni mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang sngar bshad pa bzhin du mngon par brjod pa rnam pa gnyis kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon gang yin pa de ni mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags zhes bya'o //
translated: The teaching of its nature is as follows: That seed which is impregnated by the two kinds of verbal expression is called the latent impressions of verbal expression, as previously explained.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon gang yin pa de ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i bag chags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon gang yin pa de ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i bag chags zhes bya'o //
translated: That seed which is impregnated by the two kinds of grasping of a self is called the latent impressions of the grasping of a self.

original: de bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon gang yin pa de ni srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon gang yin pa de ni srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags zhes bya ste /
translated: Likewise, that seed which is impregnated by virtuous and nonvirtuous karma is called the latent impressions of the members of existence.

original: sa bon ni de ltar rnam par rtog pa yin pas sa bon kho nar zad kyi mngon du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa bon ni de ltar rnam par rtog pa yin pas sa bon kho nar zad kyi mngon du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since the seed is thus a concept, it is only a seed and not something manifest.

original: chos rnam pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid bstan na mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags ni phung po lnga'i sgo nas phyogs gcig gi sa bon ni phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: chos rnam pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid bstan na mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags ni phung po lnga'i sgo nas phyogs gcig gi sa bon ni phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: If the three natures are taught in terms of the five aggregates, then the instinct for verbal expression is the seed of one part of the five aggregates, and it is the nature of the five aggregates.

original: zag pa med pa'i sa bon gyis bskyed ba ma gtogs par thams cad kyang phung por bsdus par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sa bon gyis bskyed ba ma gtogs par thams cad kyang phung por bsdus par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all are the same in being included in the aggregates, except for what is produced by the seed of the uncontaminated.

original: skye mched dang khams kyi sgo nas kyang phyogs gcig ni skye mched bcu gnyis kyi sa bon dang / khams bco brgyad kyi sa bon gyi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: skye mched dang khams kyi sgo nas kyang phyogs gcig ni skye mched bcu gnyis kyi sa bon dang / khams bco brgyad kyi sa bon gyi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: If they are taught in terms of the sense bases and elements, then the seed of one part of the twelve sense bases and the seed of the eighteen elements is their nature.

original: zag pa med pa'i sa bon @222b ma gtogs pa ni phung po bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sa bon @222b ma gtogs pa ni phung po bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Except for the seed of the uncontaminated, they should be understood as being included in the aggregates.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i bag chags kyang /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i bag chags kyang /
translated: The instinct for the belief in a self

original: phung po lnga'i sgo nas ni 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig bsdus so //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i sgo nas ni 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig bsdus so //
translated: is included in one part of the aggregate of formations in terms of the five aggregates.

original: skye mched dang khams kyi sgo nas kyang /
analyzed: skye mched dang khams kyi sgo nas kyang /
translated: In terms of the sense bases and elements,

original: chos kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of one part of the sense base of mental objects and of the mental object constituent.

original: sred pa'i yan lag gi bag chags ni phung po lnga'i sgo nas gzugs dang 'du byed kyi phung po gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: sred pa'i yan lag gi bag chags ni phung po lnga'i sgo nas gzugs dang 'du byed kyi phung po gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The latent impressions of the member of craving are the nature of two heaps: the form heap and the compositional factor heap.

original: gzugs kyi phung po yin pa'i phyir dang / yid kyi sems pa'i las kyi sa bon ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po yin pa'i phyir dang / yid kyi sems pa'i las kyi sa bon ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are the form heap and because the seeds of the mental activity of mind are included in the compositional factor heap.

original: skye mched dang khams kyi sgo nas ni gzugs kyi skye mched dang / sgra'i skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: skye mched dang khams kyi sgo nas ni gzugs kyi skye mched dang / sgra'i skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: From the point of view of the sense bases and constituents, they are the nature of one part of the sense base of mental objects, the sense base of sound, and the mental object constituent.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs kyi ngo bo nyid bstan nas mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags ni chos brgya'i sgo nas chos brgya'i sa bon gyi ngo bo nyid kyi gzugs brnyan byed de /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs kyi ngo bo nyid bstan nas mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags ni chos brgya'i sgo nas chos brgya'i sa bon gyi ngo bo nyid kyi gzugs brnyan byed de /
translated: Having explained the nature of the Dharma classifications, the latent impressions of verbal expression are the nature of the seeds of the one hundred dharmas from the point of view of the one hundred dharmas.

original: chos brgya po de dag thams cad kyang yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽bdag tu 'dzin pa'i bag chags ni yul so sor nges pa las shes rab dang / nyon mongs pa bcu las 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos brgya po de dag thams cad kyang yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon yin pa'i phyir ro // bdag tu 'dzin pa'i bag chags ni yul so sor nges pa las shes rab dang / nyon mongs pa bcu las 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: And all of these one hundred dharmas are seeds of the perfumed.🔽The habit energy of self-habits is the nature of the view of a real self among the ten passions, because it is the habit energy of the view of a real self that is the root of all other passions.

original: srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags ni gzugs rnam pa bcu gcig las gzugs dang sgra'i chos gnyis dang / sems las byung ba'i las sems pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags ni gzugs rnam pa bcu gcig las gzugs dang sgra'i chos gnyis dang / sems las byung ba'i las sems pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The habit energy of the members of becoming is the nature of volition among the mental activities, because it is the nature of the karma of speech and mind.

original: ngag dang sems pa'i las yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngag dang sems pa'i las yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the karma of speech and mind because it generates the karma of body.

original: de la 'bras bu bskyed pa'i phyir bye brag bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu bskyed pa'i phyir bye brag bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The teaching of the distinctions in order to generate the fruit is also twofold.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las 'byung ba bzhin du spyir chos rnams las brtsams nas 'bras bu skyed par bstan pa dang / bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las bstan pa bzhin du rnam par rig pa rnam pa bcu gcig las brtsams nas /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las 'byung ba bzhin du spyir chos rnams las brtsams nas 'bras bu skyed par bstan pa dang / bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las bstan pa bzhin du rnam par rig pa rnam pa bcu gcig las brtsams nas /
translated: In general, the treatise Establishing the Existence of Representation teaches that the result is produced from representations, and the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna teaches that the result is produced from eleven representations.

original: 'bras bu bskyed pa rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu bskyed pa rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: The result is distinguished in general from representations.

original: de la spyir chos rnams las brtsams nas 'bras bu skyed par bstan @223a * //
analyzed: de la spyir chos rnams las brtsams nas 'bras bu skyed par bstan @223a * //
translated: In general, the result is taught to be produced from representations.

original: pa yang mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags ni spyir chos brgyad po dag skyed par byed de /
analyzed: pa yang mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags ni spyir chos brgyad po dag skyed par byed de /
translated: The latent impressions of verbalization produce the eight general representations.

original: de la bye brag yod pa yang chos dgu bcu rtsa bzhi po de dag gi ngo bo nyid dang / gzugs brnyan thams cad ni mngon par brjod pas bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la bye brag yod pa yang chos dgu bcu rtsa bzhi po de dag gi ngo bo nyid dang / gzugs brnyan thams cad ni mngon par brjod pas bskyed pa yin no //
translated: The specific ones are the natures of those ninety-four representations, and all images are produced by verbalization.

original: 'dus ma byas rnam pa drug gi ngo bo nyid dang / gzugs brnyan ni mi mtshungs pas ngo bo nyid rnam pa drug gi sa bon las byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnam pa drug gi ngo bo nyid dang / gzugs brnyan ni mi mtshungs pas ngo bo nyid rnam pa drug gi sa bon las byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The six kinds of unconditioned things are not the seeds of the reflection because the reflection is not the same as the six kinds of unconditioned things.

original: yongs su grub pa'i 'dus ma byas ni mi skye ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i 'dus ma byas ni mi skye ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfected unconditioned is the meaning of non-arising.

original: gzugs brnyan rnam pa drug ni mngon par brjod pa las byung ba yin te /🔽gzhan gyi dbang gi 'dus ma byas ni yang dag par na 'dus byas yin te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan rnam pa drug ni mngon par brjod pa las byung ba yin te / gzhan gyi dbang gi 'dus ma byas ni yang dag par na 'dus byas yin te /
translated: The six kinds of reflections arise from verbal expression.

original: rgyu la brten nas skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu la brten nas skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: The other-dependent unconditioned is really conditioned because it arises in dependence on causes.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In the treatise Establishing Consciousness Only, verbal expression is said to be the seeds of the six kinds of reflections.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos so tha dad pa'i nye ba'i sa bon no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos so tha dad pa'i nye ba'i sa bon no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The seeds of the various conditioned dharmas are called the seeds of the near cause.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos las rdzas su yod pa'i chos ni bdag nyid yod pas sa bon las skye zhes byar rung na mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa las bdag nyid yang dag pa med na /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos las rdzas su yod pa'i chos ni bdag nyid yod pas sa bon las skye zhes byar rung na mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa las bdag nyid yang dag pa med na /
translated: But if a nonconcurrent formation does not have a self that exists as a real entity,

original: ji ltar rgyu las byung zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu las byung zhes brjod ce na /
translated: how can it be said to arise from a cause?

original: yang dag pa'i don du na btags pa'i chos rnams kyi sa bon las mi skye ste /🔽de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las btags pa'i chos ni med pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na btags pa'i chos rnams kyi sa bon las mi skye ste / de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las btags pa'i chos ni med pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: In reality, imputed phenomena do not arise from the seeds of imputed phenomena.🔽Therefore the treatise Establishing Cognition Only states:

original: rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Imputed phenomena are like nonexistents because they are not causes and conditions.

original: btags pa'i chos rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa'i don gyis na btags pa'i chos rnams ni bskyed par bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: btags pa'i chos rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa'i don gyis na btags pa'i chos rnams ni bskyed par bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of imputed phenomena being not causes and conditions is that imputed phenomena are not produced.

original: 'on kyang brtags pa ni rdzas su yod pa'i rjes su btags pa'i sa bon zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'on kyang brtags pa ni rdzas su yod pa'i rjes su btags pa'i sa bon zhes bshad de /
translated: However, imputations are explained as seeds that are imputed in dependence on substantially existent phenomena.

original: rgyu rkyen las skyes pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: rgyu rkyen las skyes pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las /
translated: In the treatise Establishing Mere Representation,

original: ming dang rgyu mtshan dang rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags rnam pa gsum zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ming dang rgyu mtshan dang rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags rnam pa gsum zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: three types of predispositions are taught: names, causal processes, and conceptualization.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags kyis ni bdag dang gzhan gyi lus kyi chos brgya'i bye brag tha dad pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags kyis ni bdag dang gzhan gyi lus kyi chos brgya'i bye brag tha dad pa skyed par byed do //
translated: The predispositions of the view of self give rise to the one hundred different attributes of one’s own and others’ bodies.

original: srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyis ni chos @223b brgya'i bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i las skyed par byed de /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyis ni chos @223b brgya'i bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i las skyed par byed de /
translated: The predispositions of the branches of existence give rise to the one hundred different attributes of the actions that lead to happy and unfortunate rebirths.

original: sngar bstan pa'i 'dus ma byas dang btags pa'i chos ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i 'dus ma byas dang btags pa'i chos ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The unconditioned phenomena and imputed phenomena taught above should be understood as before.

original: de la rnam par rig pa rnam pa bcu gcig las brtsams nas 'bras bu bskyed pa rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos theg pa chen po bstan pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: de la rnam par rig pa rnam pa bcu gcig las brtsams nas 'bras bu bskyed pa rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos theg pa chen po bstan pa las ji skad du /
translated: In the treatise Teaching the Great Vehicle, the results that are produced from the eleven types of representations are distinguished as follows:

original: de la lus dang / lus can dang / za ba po'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang / des nye bar spyad par bya ba'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang / de la nye bar spyad par bya ba'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: de la lus dang / lus can dang / za ba po'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang / des nye bar spyad par bya ba'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang / de la nye bar spyad par bya ba'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: The consciousness of the body, the embodied being, and the experiencer, the consciousness of what is to be experienced by that , the consciousness of the experience of that ,

original: dus kyi rnam par rig pa dang / grangs kyi rnam par rig pa dang / yul gyi rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang / tha snyad kyi rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus kyi rnam par rig pa dang / grangs kyi rnam par rig pa dang / yul gyi rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang / tha snyad kyi rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the consciousness of time, the consciousness of number, the consciousness of place, and the consciousness of conventional usage, because they arise from the seeds of the latent impressions of verbal expression.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rnam par rig pa'i bye brag gang yin pa de ni bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rnam par rig pa'i bye brag gang yin pa de ni bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinction between the consciousness of self and the consciousness of other arises from the seeds of the latent impressions of the view of self.

original: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de ni srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de ni srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The consciousness of happy and bad rebirths, death, transmigration, and birth arises from the seed of the instinct for the branch of cyclic existence.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is taught in the same text at length.

original: de la rkyen bzhis rnam par dbye ba yang mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags ni rgyu'i rkyen yang dag pa yin la bag chags gzhan gnyis ni bdag po'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: de la rkyen bzhis rnam par dbye ba yang mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags ni rgyu'i rkyen yang dag pa yin la bag chags gzhan gnyis ni bdag po'i rkyen yin te /
translated: The four conditions are also distinguished in this way: The instinct for verbalization is the causal condition. The other two instincts are the dominant condition.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang / dus kyi rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang / dus kyi rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise, the Establishment of Cognition Only, says:🔽The seed that is established from the impregnation of the two verbalizations acts as the individual causal condition of conditioned phenomena.

original: mngon par brjod pa gnyis kyis yongs su bsgos pa las grub pa'i sa bon gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi so so'i rgyu rkyen byed do zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang de nyid las /
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa gnyis kyis yongs su bsgos pa las grub pa'i sa bon gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi so so'i rgyu rkyen byed do zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang de nyid las /
translated: And the same text says:

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags ni 'bras bu bye brag tha dad pa rnams la bdag po'i rkyen byed par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags ni 'bras bu bye brag tha dad pa rnams la bdag po'i rkyen byed par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The latent tendencies of self-habits and of the members of existence are to be known as the dominant conditions for the various specific results.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos bam po brgyad pa'i 'grel pa las bstan pa @224a * //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos bam po brgyad pa'i 'grel pa las bstan pa @224a * //
translated: This is taught in the Vrtti on the eight-chapter treatise proving perception-only.

original: bzhin no // sa bon pa'i rnam par shes pa de nyid bstan pa la rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: bzhin no // sa bon pa'i rnam par shes pa de nyid bstan pa la rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: That seed consciousness itself is taught in two aspects:

original: sems can gyi phung po las brtsams nas lus kyi yan lag 'byung ba bstan pa dang / der zhes bya ba man chad kyis sa bon pa'i rnam par shes pa las brtsams nas skye ba lan pa'i bye brag rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi phung po las brtsams nas lus kyi yan lag 'byung ba bstan pa dang / der zhes bya ba man chad kyis sa bon pa'i rnam par shes pa las brtsams nas skye ba lan pa'i bye brag rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: The first is the teaching of the arising of the body members, beginning with the aggregates of sentient beings, and the second is the extensive differentiation of the various kinds of birth, beginning with “therein.”

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: de la 'gro ba drug ces bya ba ni 'og nas mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: de la 'gro ba drug ces bya ba ni 'og nas mdo las ji skad du /
translated: Therein, the “six destinies” are as the Sutra says below:

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / lha dang / lha ma yin dang / mi zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //🔽'gro ba drug po 'di yang so so'i gzhung gis bshad pa mi mthun pas thams cad yod par smra ba dag ni 'gro ba lnga kho na'o zhes rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / lha dang / lha ma yin dang / mi zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o // 'gro ba drug po 'di yang so so'i gzhung gis bshad pa mi mthun pas thams cad yod par smra ba dag ni 'gro ba lnga kho na'o zhes rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: Hell beings, animals, ghosts, gods, demigods and humans.🔽The six types of reincarnating beings are not explained in the same way in the individual texts.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
translated: The Vaibhasikas of Kasmir posit that there are five reincarnating beings because the great treatise on differentiation states:

original: mdo sde las ji skad du 'gro ba lnga zhes gsungs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mdo sde las ji skad du 'gro ba lnga zhes gsungs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The sutras state that there are five reincarnating beings:

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / lha dang mi'o zhes bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / lha dang mi'o zhes bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: hell beings, animals, ghosts, gods and humans.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las sde pa gzhan kha cig lha ma yin ni 'gro ba drug pa'o zhes rnam par 'jog ste /🔽de dag de skad du smra bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las sde pa gzhan kha cig lha ma yin ni 'gro ba drug pa'o zhes rnam par 'jog ste / de dag de skad du smra bar mi bya ste /
translated: Other schools posit that demigods are the sixth reincarnating being.

original: mdo sde las ni 'gro ba ni lnga kho na'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mdo sde las ni 'gro ba ni lnga kho na'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: They should not speak in that way because the sutras state that there are five reincarnating beings.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is extensively taught in that text.

original: gal te de lta na lha ma yin 'gro ba gang gis bsdus she na smras pa /
analyzed: gal te de lta na lha ma yin 'gro ba gang gis bsdus she na smras pa /
translated: If that is so, then in which realm are the demigods included?

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las rnam pa gnyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las rnam pa gnyis 'byung ste /
translated: The great treatise on differentiation mentions two possibilities:

original: kha cig ni lha'i 'gro bas bsdus so zhes bshad de /
analyzed: kha cig ni lha'i 'gro bas bsdus so zhes bshad de /
translated: some say they are included in the god realm.

original: dpyad pa dag gi yang dag pa'i don las ni yi dags kyi 'gro bas bsdus so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dpyad pa dag gi yang dag pa'i don las ni yi dags kyi 'gro bas bsdus so zhes bshad do //
translated: But the treatise on proper expression explains that they are included in the realm of ghosts.

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las kyang phal cher bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las kyang phal cher bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: The treatise on proper reasoning and the treatise on the levels mostly agree with the great treatise on differentiation.

original: mdo sde pa dag kyang 'gro ba lnga kho na'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: mdo sde pa dag kyang 'gro ba lnga kho na'o zhes zer te /
translated: Sautrantikas say there are only five realms.🔽Therefore the treatise establishing reality declares:

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa las las ni rnam pa drug go 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa las las ni rnam pa drug go 'di lta ste /
translated: Karma is of six types:

original: 'gro ba lnga po dag gi las dang ma nges ba'i las so zhes 'byung @224b pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga po dag gi las dang ma nges ba'i las so zhes 'byung @224b pa yin no //
translated: the karma of the five realms and indeterminate karma.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na /
translated: Here, when applied to the teaching of the Mahayana,🔽some say there are only five,

original: la lar ni lnga kho na'o zhes gsungs te 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo dang dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa'i mdo la sogs pa las bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: la lar ni lnga kho na'o zhes gsungs te 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo dang dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa'i mdo la sogs pa las bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: as taught in the sutra of the noble Buddha-bhumi, the sutra taught by Vimalakirti, and so forth.

original: gal te de lta na lha ma yin 'gro ba gang gis bsdus she na smras pa /
analyzed: gal te de lta na lha ma yin 'gro ba gang gis bsdus she na smras pa /
translated: If that is so, then in which realm are the asuras included?🔽The commentary to the noble Buddha-bhumi says,

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las lha ma yin rnams kyi ris kyi rnam pa ni nges pa med de /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las lha ma yin rnams kyi ris kyi rnam pa ni nges pa med de /
translated: “The type of realm of the asuras is not fixed.

original: res 'ga' ni lha dang / res 'ga' ni yi dags dang / res 'ga' ni dud 'gro'i 'gro bas bsdus par gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni lha dang / res 'ga' ni yi dags dang / res 'ga' ni dud 'gro'i 'gro bas bsdus par gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: Sometimes they are included in the realm of the gods, sometimes in the realm of hungry ghosts, and sometimes in the realm of animals.

original: 'dir nges par ma bstan to zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir nges par ma bstan to zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, they are not definitely taught here.”

original: la lar ni drug go zhes gsungs te /🔽mdo sde 'di nyid dang sangs rgyas phal po che la sogs pa las /
analyzed: la lar ni drug go zhes gsungs te / mdo sde 'di nyid dang sangs rgyas phal po che la sogs pa las /
translated: Some say there are six,

original: ji skad bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: as taught in this sutra and in the Flower Ornament Sutra.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang sbyar na sngar gzhag pa ni yang dag pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang sbyar na sngar gzhag pa ni yang dag pa'i don yin te /
translated: If this is applied to the Levels of Yogic Deeds, the former position is correct.

original: de'i phyir de las lha ma yin rnams kyang lha'i 'gro bas bsdus pa kho nar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las lha ma yin rnams kyang lha'i 'gro bas bsdus pa kho nar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the demigods should be viewed as included in the class of gods.

original: 'on kyang de dag ni sgyu can 'drid pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa sgyu g-yo'i shas che ba yin te /🔽de bas na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag ni sgyu can 'drid pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa sgyu g-yo'i shas che ba yin te / de bas na 'di lta ste /
translated: However, they are deceitful and deceptive, and their deceitfulness is predominant.🔽Therefore, they are not vessels for the virtuous Dharmas,

original: lha rnams bzhin du dkar po'i chos rnams kyi snod du ma gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: lha rnams bzhin du dkar po'i chos rnams kyi snod du ma gyur pa yin te /
translated: just as the gods are not.🔽Therefore, in some sutras, they are taught as a separate realm.

original: de'i phyir ched 'ga' mdo gzhan dag las 'gro ba tha dad pa'i bstan pas bstan to zhes 'byung bas yang dag par na lha'i 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ched 'ga' mdo gzhan dag las 'gro ba tha dad pa'i bstan pas bstan to zhes 'byung bas yang dag par na lha'i 'gro ba yin no //
translated: However, in reality, they are included in the class of gods.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las /
translated: Moreover, that same text says:

original: de ltar 'jig rten gnas pa chags na /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten gnas pa chags na /
translated: When the world is formed in this way,

original: 'gro ba lnga po sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / dud 'gro rnams dang / yi dags rnams dang / lha rnams dang / mi rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga po sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / dud 'gro rnams dang / yi dags rnams dang / lha rnams dang / mi rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The five types of reincarnating beings arise: hell beings, animals, ghosts, gods and humans.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang sbyar na ni drug tu gzhag pa yang dag pa'i don yin par ston te /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang sbyar na ni drug tu gzhag pa yang dag pa'i don yin par ston te /
translated: If one correlates this with the commentary on the perfection of wisdom, it teaches that the six types of reincarnating beings are the correct meaning.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las /
translated: Therefore, that text itself says:

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka las 'gro ba drug gi sems can yod par gsungs pas don gyis dgongs pa rnams brtags na 'gro ba drug yod do //🔽gzhan yang dge ba dang mi dge ba rnam par dbye bas kyang 'gro ba drug yod de /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka las 'gro ba drug gi sems can yod par gsungs pas don gyis dgongs pa rnams brtags na 'gro ba drug yod do // gzhan yang dge ba dang mi dge ba rnam par dbye bas kyang 'gro ba drug yod de /
translated: Since the Mahāyāna sūtra the Dharma of Puṇḍarīka says that the six types of reincarnating beings exist, if one analyzes the intended meaning, the six types of reincarnating beings exist.

original: dge ba la yang @225a * //
analyzed: dge ba la yang @225a * //
translated: Moreover, the six types of reincarnating beings exist because virtue and nonvirtue are differentiated.🔽Because virtue

original: rab dang / 'bring dang tha ma yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab dang / 'bring dang tha ma yod pa'i phyir /
translated: has the best, middling, and least,

original: bde 'gro gsum po lha dang mi dang lha ma yin yod /
analyzed: bde 'gro gsum po lha dang mi dang lha ma yin yod /
translated: there are the three happy realms of gods, humans, and demigods.

original: mi dge ba yang rab dang 'bring dang tha ma yod par sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro'i 'gro ba yod do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba yang rab dang 'bring dang tha ma yod par sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro'i 'gro ba yod do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: and it is said that the hells, hungry ghosts, and animals exist.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is taught extensively in that same text.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gro ba lnga kho na'o zhes gsal bar gsungs pa med de /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gro ba lnga kho na'o zhes gsal bar gsungs pa med de /
translated: Moreover, the Bhagavān did not clearly state that there are only five types of reincarnating beings.

original: 'gro ba lnga yod par bshad pa ni thams cad yod par smra ba dag 'gro ba lnga yod do zhes bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga yod par bshad pa ni thams cad yod par smra ba dag 'gro ba lnga yod do zhes bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The explanation that there are five types of reincarnating beings is like the teaching that there are five types of reincarnating beings by the Sarvāstivādins.

original: gzhan yang 'gro ba ni drug yod pa yin par rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'gro ba ni drug yod pa yin par rigs te /
translated: Moreover, it is logical that there are six types of reincarnating beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽ngan song gsum ni gcig tu sdig pa byas pa'i gnas yin pas gang gis dge ba ni cher byas la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / ngan song gsum ni gcig tu sdig pa byas pa'i gnas yin pas gang gis dge ba ni cher byas la /
translated: Why is that?🔽The three lower rebirths are the abodes of those who commit only nonvirtue.

original: sdig pa chung du byas pa gang yin pa de ni lha ma yin zhes bya bas skye gnas tha dad pa'i rigs te /
analyzed: sdig pa chung du byas pa gang yin pa de ni lha ma yin zhes bya bas skye gnas tha dad pa'i rigs te /
translated: Those who commit much virtue and little nonvirtue are born as demigods.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba drug ces brjod par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba drug ces brjod par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, they should be called the six kinds of reincarnating beings.

original: gshin rje 'gro ba gang gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: gshin rje 'gro ba gang gis bsdus she na /
translated: In what reincarnating being are the Yama gods included?

original: smras pa bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
analyzed: smras pa bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
translated: The Great Exegesis declares:

original: yi dags kyi 'gro bas bsdus so zhes bshad de /
analyzed: yi dags kyi 'gro bas bsdus so zhes bshad de /
translated: They are included in the reincarnating being of hungry ghosts.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las bstan bcos gdags pa byas pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las bstan bcos gdags pa byas pa las /
translated: Therefore, the Treatise on Designation composed in that text declares:🔽Just as the name of the king of this present world of hungry ghosts is Yama.

original: ji ltar da ltar gyi yi dags kyi 'jig rten 'di'i rgyal po'i ming gshin rje zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bshad do zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang de nyid las /
analyzed: ji ltar da ltar gyi yi dags kyi 'jig rten 'di'i rgyal po'i ming gshin rje zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bshad do zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang de nyid las /
translated: Also, that text declares:

original: 'dzam bu'i gling 'di'i 'og dpag tshad lnga brgya 'das pa na gshin rje'i khams yod de de ni yi dags thams cad kyi gnas kyi rtsa ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling 'di'i 'og dpag tshad lnga brgya 'das pa na gshin rje'i khams yod de de ni yi dags thams cad kyi gnas kyi rtsa ba yin te /
translated: Five hundred yojanas below this Rose-Apple Land is the realm of Yama, which is the root of the abodes of all hungry ghosts.

original: de las gyes nas gzhan na gnas pa yang yod do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las gyes nas gzhan na gnas pa yang yod do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Some hungry ghosts live elsewhere, having migrated from there.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro bas bsdus par bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro bas bsdus par bshad de /
translated: The Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra explains that it is included in the realm of hell beings.

original: de'i phyir de las sems can gang yang rung ba zhig bdag por 'gyur ba'i las kun nas nyon mongs ba can gyis sems can dmyal ba rnams na gshin rje'i rgyal por skye bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las sems can gang yang rung ba zhig bdag por 'gyur ba'i las kun nas nyon mongs ba can gyis sems can dmyal ba rnams na gshin rje'i rgyal por skye bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore it says, “Any sentient being who is born as the king of the hells due to the karma of affliction that makes him a lord of sentient beings.”

original: de la sgo nga dang / mngal dang drod gsher dang / rdzus te skye ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la sgo nga dang / mngal dang drod gsher dang / rdzus te skye ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of birth: from eggs, from wombs, from warmth and moisture, and spontaneously.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: The Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra says,

original: sgo nga las skye ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: sgo nga las skye ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: “What is birth from an egg?

original: @225b sems can gang dag sgo nga'i sbubs mngon par brtol nas 'byung ba rnams yin te /
analyzed: @225b sems can gang dag sgo nga'i sbubs mngon par brtol nas 'byung ba rnams yin te /
translated: It is the birth of sentient beings who emerge from the shell of an egg.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: ngang pa dang / khrung khrung dang / rma bya dang / ne tso dang / ri skegs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngang pa dang / khrung khrung dang / rma bya dang / ne tso dang / ri skegs la sogs pa'o //
translated: geese, cranes, peacocks, parrots, myna birds, and so on.”

original: mngal las skye ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: mngal las skye ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mode of birth of the womb?

original: sems can gang dag sha mos kun nas g-yogs shing sha mo brtol nas 'byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: sems can gang dag sha mos kun nas g-yogs shing sha mo brtol nas 'byung ba rnams te /
translated: It is the mode of birth of those sentient beings who are enveloped in a membrane and who emerge by breaking through the membrane.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are they?

original: glang po che dang / rta dang / ba lang dang / bong bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: glang po che dang / rta dang / ba lang dang / bong bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are elephants, horses, cattle, donkeys, etc.

original: drod gsher las skye ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: drod gsher las skye ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mode of birth of moisture?

original: sems can gang dag drod gsher gang yang rung ba la brten nas skye ba rnams te /
analyzed: sems can gang dag drod gsher gang yang rung ba la brten nas skye ba rnams te /
translated: It is the mode of birth of those sentient beings who are born from the condensation of heat and moisture.🔽What are they?

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: srin bu dang / grog spur dang / phye ma leb dang / shing srin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: srin bu dang / grog spur dang / phye ma leb dang / shing srin la sogs pa'o //
translated: insects, ants, bees, worms, etc.

original: rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na /🔽sems can gang dag las kyi dbang gis skye mched drug tshang bar skye ba'am /
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na / sems can gang dag las kyi dbang gis skye mched drug tshang bar skye ba'am /
translated: What is the mode of birth of apparition?

original: skye mched drug las gang yang rung ba ma tshang ba rnams te /
analyzed: skye mched drug las gang yang rung ba ma tshang ba rnams te /
translated: It is the mode of birth of those sentient beings who are born complete and fully endowed with all their major and minor parts, lacking nothing,🔽either in the hells, or in the heavens, or in the intermediate existence.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are they?

original: sems can dmyal ba pa rnams dang / lha rnams dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / mi rnams las kha cig go zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa rnams dang / lha rnams dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / mi rnams las kha cig go zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Some are hell-beings, some are gods, some are animals, some are hungry ghosts, and some are humans.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos gzhung bstan pa dang / mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang / yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang / bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos gzhung bstan pa dang / mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang / yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang / bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation should be understood according to the treatise Exposition of the Stages of the Bodhisattva, the treatise Abhidharma-kosa, correct reasoning, and the Great Exegesis.

original: sngar 'gro ba drug bshad zin na /
analyzed: sngar 'gro ba drug bshad zin na /
translated: If the six destinies have already been explained,

original: ci'i phyir yang skye ba rnam pa bzhi bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang skye ba rnam pa bzhi bstan zhe na /
translated: why are four kinds of birth taught?

original: smras pa / mdzod kyi bstan bcos las /
analyzed: smras pa / mdzod kyi bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise Abhidharma-kosa states:

original: bstan bcos gdags pa byas pa las 'di skad du /
analyzed: bstan bcos gdags pa byas pa las 'di skad du /
translated: In the treatise called Presentation of the Stages, it is said:

original: skye ba rnam pa bzhis ni 'di skad du 'gro ba lnga bsdus kyi /
analyzed: skye ba rnam pa bzhis ni 'di skad du 'gro ba lnga bsdus kyi /
translated: The five destinies are included in the four kinds of birth,

original: 'gro ba lngas ni skye ba rnam pa bzhi bsdus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba lngas ni skye ba rnam pa bzhi bsdus pa ma yin no //
translated: but the four kinds of birth are not included in the five destinies.

original: gang dag ma bsdus she na /
analyzed: gang dag ma bsdus she na /
translated: What is not included?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: srid pa bar ma dag go zhes bstan to zhes 'byung bas rigs pa des na lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba drug gi skye ba ril ma bsdus pas de'i phyir sgo nga la sogs pa'i skye ba bzhi po dag yang dag par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma dag go zhes bstan to zhes 'byung bas rigs pa des na lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba drug gi skye ba ril ma bsdus pas de'i phyir sgo nga la sogs pa'i skye ba bzhi po dag yang dag par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the four types of birth from wombs, eggs, moisture, and from a transformation are taught.

original: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir yang 'gro ba drug bstan zhe na /🔽smras pa / @226a * //
analyzed: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir yang 'gro ba drug bstan zhe na / smras pa / @226a * //
translated: If that is so, why are the six types of existence taught?

original: dge ba dang sdig pa skyes pa len pa'i bye brag rab tu bstan pa'i phyir 'gro ba drug tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang sdig pa skyes pa len pa'i bye brag rab tu bstan pa'i phyir 'gro ba drug tu bstan pa'o //
translated: They are taught in order to show the differences in the taking of virtuous and nonvirtuous births.

original: gal te de lta na ni ci'i phyir khams ma bstan zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni ci'i phyir khams ma bstan zhe na smras pa /
translated: If that is so, why are the eighteen elements not taught?

original: khams ni sems can ma yin par yang gtogs pas de'i phyir 'dir ma bstan to //
analyzed: khams ni sems can ma yin par yang gtogs pas de'i phyir 'dir ma bstan to //
translated: The elements are not living beings, so they are not taught here.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las kyang don 'di dang mthun par bshad de /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las kyang don 'di dang mthun par bshad de /
translated: The master Paramartha’s commentary on the Mahāyānasaṃgraha explains this point in the same way.

original: 'gro ba drug dang / skye ba rnam pa bzhi'i don ni mtshan nyid bstan pa gzhan dag las bshad pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba drug dang / skye ba rnam pa bzhi'i don ni mtshan nyid bstan pa gzhan dag las bshad pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the six destinies and the four kinds of birth should be understood as explained in other treatises.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: The explanation of the words of the sutra is twofold.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:

original: 'gro ba drug gi 'khor ba 'di nas sems can gang dang gang dag ces bya bas ni lus spangs pa rnams bstan to //
analyzed: 'gro ba drug gi 'khor ba 'di nas sems can gang dang gang dag ces bya bas ni lus spangs pa rnams bstan to //
translated: From “in this cycle of six destinies, whatever sentient beings” it shows the abandonment of the body.

original: sems can gyi ris de dang de dag tu gtogs pa zhes bya bas ni lus len pa rnam par 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi ris de dang de dag tu gtogs pa zhes bya bas ni lus len pa rnam par 'byed pa yin no //
translated: From “included in this or that class of sentient beings” it distinguishes the taking up of the body.

original: lus len pa de yang ris rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lus len pa de yang ris rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The taking up of the body is twofold:

original: 'gro ba drug gi lus dang / skye ba rnam pa bzhi'i lus so zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'gro ba drug gi lus dang / skye ba rnam pa bzhi'i lus so zhes zer te /
translated: the body of the six destinies and the body of the four kinds of birth.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na lus kyi yan lag skye zhing 'byung bar ni bshad ma thag pa'i ris rnam pa gnyis kyang gtogs bar bstan to //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na lus kyi yan lag skye zhing 'byung bar ni bshad ma thag pa'i ris rnam pa gnyis kyang gtogs bar bstan to //
translated: According to this explanation, the arising and origination of the body includes the two kinds of classes just mentioned.

original: kha cig na re lus len pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni skye ba rnam pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: kha cig na re lus len pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni skye ba rnam pa bzhi yin no //
translated: Some say: All those who take up bodies are of four types of birth.

original: sems can gyi ris de dang de dag tu gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi ris de dang de dag tu gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: Those who are included in this or that class of sentient beings is the brief presentation.

original: sgo nga las skyes pa'i skye gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skye ba rnam pa bzhi rnam par phye nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sgo nga las skyes pa'i skye gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skye ba rnam pa bzhi rnam par phye nas bstan pa ste /
translated: The detailed presentation is the four types of birth, such as birth from an egg.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon rdo rje drang srong gi 'grel ba las /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon rdo rje drang srong gi 'grel ba las /
translated: Therefore Master Vajrarṣi’s commentary states:

original: sgo nga'i skye ba'i skye gnas la sogs pa ni skye ba len pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: sgo nga'i skye ba'i skye gnas la sogs pa ni skye ba len pa'i bye brag go //
translated: The birth processes of birth from an egg and so on are specific types of birth.

original: gzugs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rags pa dang phra ba'i bye brag go zhes 'byung ngo zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzugs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rags pa dang phra ba'i bye brag go zhes 'byung ngo zhes zer te /
translated: The term form realm and so on refers to the specific types of coarse and subtle bodies.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na lus kyi yan lag skye zhing 'byung ba zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na lus kyi yan lag skye zhing 'byung ba zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: When applied to this explanation, the statement about the arising and origination of body parts

original: skye ba rnam pa bzhi las brtsams nas bstan pa yin no /🔽// / bam po nyi shu pa /
analyzed: skye ba rnam pa bzhi las brtsams nas bstan pa yin no /🔽// / bam po nyi shu pa /
translated: is taught in terms of the four types of birth.🔽The four types of birth

original: der dang po kho na sa bon thams cad pa'i sems dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par smin cing phan tshun 'dus pa rgyas shing 'phel ba dang / @226b yangs par gyur nas zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni /
analyzed: der dang po kho na sa bon thams cad pa'i sems dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par smin cing phan tshun 'dus pa rgyas shing 'phel ba dang / @226b yangs par gyur nas zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni /
translated: In this regard, the first is the mind that is the seed of everything, and the consciousness that is the ripening of the seed, and the mutual aggregation of the seed and the ripening.

original: gnyis pa sa bon rnam par shes pa las brtsams nas skye ba len pa'i bye brag rgya cher rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: gnyis pa sa bon rnam par shes pa las brtsams nas skye ba len pa'i bye brag rgya cher rnam par 'byed do //
translated: The second is the extensive differentiation of the process of taking rebirth, beginning with the seed consciousness.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: skye ba len pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag bstan pa dang / sa bon rnam par shes pa len pa gnyis la brten par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba len pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag bstan pa dang / sa bon rnam par shes pa len pa gnyis la brten par bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching on the specific states of taking rebirth, and the teaching on the basis of taking rebirth, which is the seed consciousness.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du bstan to //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du bstan to // 'di lta ste /
translated: This is also taught in three parts:

original: sa bon pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yongs su smin pa bstan pa dang / phan tshun 'dus pa bstan pa dang / rgyas shing 'phel ba dang / yangs bar gyur pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yongs su smin pa bstan pa dang / phan tshun 'dus pa bstan pa dang / rgyas shing 'phel ba dang / yangs bar gyur pa bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching on the ripening of the seed consciousness, the teaching on mutual aggregation, and the teaching on the expansion and growth of the seed consciousness.

original: der dang po kho nar sa bon thams cad pa'i sems dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par smin zhes bya bas ni sa bon pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yongs su smin pa bstan te /
analyzed: der dang po kho nar sa bon thams cad pa'i sems dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par smin zhes bya bas ni sa bon pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yongs su smin pa bstan te /
translated: The first is the mind that contains all seeds and the second is the consciousness that is the ripening of the seeds.

original: 'gro ba de dag tu skye ba len pa'i gnas skabs su dang po kho nar skyes pa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba na /
analyzed: 'gro ba de dag tu skye ba len pa'i gnas skabs su dang po kho nar skyes pa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba na /
translated: When one is born in those realms, the mind that contains all seeds ripens at the very beginning of the rebirth process.

original: sa bon thams cad pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sems yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sems yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The first is the mind that contains all seeds and the second is the consciousness that is the ripening of the seeds.🔽When one is born in those realms, the mind that contains all seeds ripens at the very beginning of the rebirth process.🔽The first is the mind that contains all seeds and the second is the consciousness that is the ripening of the seeds.🔽When one is born in those realms, the mind that contains all seeds ripens at the very beginning of the rebirth process.🔽The first is the mind that contains all seeds and the second is the consciousness that is the ripening of the seeds.🔽When one is born in those realms, the mind that contains all seeds ripens at the very beginning of the rebirth process.

original: dang po nying mtshams sbyor ba na sa bon pa'i rnam par shes pa yongs su smin pa las mer mer bo mngon par 'grub pa ni nying mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dang po nying mtshams sbyor ba na sa bon pa'i rnam par shes pa yongs su smin pa las mer mer bo mngon par 'grub pa ni nying mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The first is the mind that contains all seeds and the second is the consciousness that is the ripening of the seeds.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /🔽de la pha ma gnyis chags par gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las / de la pha ma gnyis chags par gyur te /
translated: When one is born in those realms, the mind that contains all seeds ripens at the very beginning of the rebirth process.🔽The first is the mind that contains all seeds and the second is the consciousness that is the ripening of the seeds.🔽When one is born in those realms, the mind that contains all seeds ripens at the very beginning of the rebirth process.🔽The first is the mind that contains all seeds and the second is the consciousness that is the ripening of the seeds.

original: 'dod chags drag po'i skabs su bab pa na mjug kho nar khu ba'i skabs 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags drag po'i skabs su bab pa na mjug kho nar khu ba'i skabs 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is born in those realms, the mind that contains all seeds ripens at the very beginning of the rebirth process.🔽The first is the mind that contains all seeds and the second is the consciousness that is the ripening of the seeds.🔽When one is born in those realms, the mind that contains all seeds ripens at the very beginning of the rebirth process.

original: de'i rjes la gnyi ga las khu ba dang khrag gi thigs pa gnyis gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la gnyi ga las khu ba dang khrag gi thigs pa gnyis gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, without doubt, two drops will emerge, one from each of them.

original: de gnyi ga'i khu ba dang / khrag gi thigs pa de gnyis ma'i skye gnas su 'dres par 'gyur nas /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i khu ba dang / khrag gi thigs pa de gnyis ma'i skye gnas su 'dres par 'gyur nas /
translated: Those two drops of semen and blood will mix in the mother’s womb.

original: dper na 'o ma bskol ba grangs pa'i spris ma bzhin du spris ma lta bur chags nas 'dus shing 'dug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na 'o ma bskol ba grangs pa'i spris ma bzhin du spris ma lta bur chags nas 'dus shing 'dug par 'gyur te /
translated: They will congeal and remain there like a skin that forms on the top of boiled milk when it cools.

original: der sa bon thams cad rnam par smin par bsdus pa lus lan par byed pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der sa bon thams cad rnam par smin par bsdus pa lus lan par byed pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The consciousness that is the appropriator of the body, which is the collection of all the seeds that have matured, will enter there.

original: ji ltar 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug ce na /
translated: How does it enter?

original: khu ba dang / khrag 'dus nas spris ma lta bur gyur pa de dang lhan cig tu ste /🔽phyin ci log tu dmigs pa bar ma do'i srid pa @227a * //
analyzed: khu ba dang / khrag 'dus nas spris ma lta bur gyur pa de dang lhan cig tu ste / phyin ci log tu dmigs pa bar ma do'i srid pa @227a * //
translated: It enters together with the congealed mixture of semen and blood.

original: de 'gags par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de 'gags par 'gyur la /
translated: The intermediate existence, which is the mistaken perception of that mixture, will cease.

original: de 'gags pa de dang dus gcig tu rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa de'i mthus de las gzhan pa dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po cha phra ba dang / 'dres pa de dang mthun pa'i khu ba dang khrag 'dus pa dbang po dang bcas pa gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'gags pa de dang dus gcig tu rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa de'i mthus de las gzhan pa dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po cha phra ba dang / 'dres pa de dang mthun pa'i khu ba dang khrag 'dus pa dbang po dang bcas pa gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: At the same time as that cessation, due to the power of that consciousness that contains all the seeds, another subtle and mixed part of the great elements of the sense faculties arises from that consciousness, together with semen and blood that are in conformity with it.

original: de'i dus skabs su rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa ni nying mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i dus skabs su rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa ni nying mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: At that time, the transformation of consciousness is called “linking up.”

original: de ni mer mer po'i dus yin no //🔽mer mer po de'i dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po de dag kyang lus kyi dbang bo dang lhan cig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni mer mer po'i dus yin no // mer mer po de'i dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po de dag kyang lus kyi dbang bo dang lhan cig 'byung ngo //
translated: That is the time of the kalala.🔽The great elements of the sense faculties of that kalala arise together with the body faculty.

original: dbang po'i rten gyi 'byung ba chen po rnams dang / dbang po 'byung ba chen po de dag nyid dang / lus kyi dbang po yang lhan cig tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i rten gyi 'byung ba chen po rnams dang / dbang po 'byung ba chen po de dag nyid dang / lus kyi dbang po yang lhan cig tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The great elements that are the basis of the sense faculties, those great elements of the sense faculties themselves, and the body faculty arise together.

original: de nas dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po de dag rgyur byas nas mig gi dbang po la sogs pa rim gyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po de dag rgyur byas nas mig gi dbang po la sogs pa rim gyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having used those great elements of the sense faculties as a cause, the eye sense faculty and so on are gradually established.

original: dbang po'i rten gyi 'byung ba chen po de dag rgyur byas nas rim gyis dbang po'i rten rnams kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i rten gyi 'byung ba chen po de dag rgyur byas nas rim gyis dbang po'i rten rnams kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having used those great elements that are the basis of the sense faculties as a cause, the bases of the sense faculties are also gradually established.🔽The sense faculties and their bases are established from the elements and the entire body is obtained.

original: dbang po rnams dang de dag gi rten rnams 'byung ba las lus thams cad 'grub cing thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang de nyid las /
analyzed: dbang po rnams dang de dag gi rten rnams 'byung ba las lus thams cad 'grub cing thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang de nyid las /
translated: Also that text says:

original: mer mer po'i phyogs gang du rnam par shes pa zhugs par gyur pa de ni de'i tshe de'i snying gi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: mer mer po'i phyogs gang du rnam par shes pa zhugs par gyur pa de ni de'i tshe de'i snying gi phyogs yin no //
translated: The side of the embryo that is the side of consciousness is the side of the heart.

original: de ltar rnam par shes pa de ni phyogs gang nas 'chi 'pho ba'i phyogs de nyid du thog ma kho nar 'jug go zhes bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes pa de ni phyogs gang nas 'chi 'pho ba'i phyogs de nyid du thog ma kho nar 'jug go zhes bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: Thus consciousness first enters the side from which it will depart at death.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las kha cig na re /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las kha cig na re /
translated: The treatise Kṣaṇabhanghbhāṣya says:

original: khu ba dang khrag nyid dbang po'i rten du mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te 'di ltar sngar dbang po med de bar ma do'i srid pa dang lhan cig 'gags nas yang srid pa phyi ma'i dbang po bar chad med par nying mtshams sbyor bas so zhe'o //
analyzed: khu ba dang khrag nyid dbang po'i rten du mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te 'di ltar sngar dbang po med de bar ma do'i srid pa dang lhan cig 'gags nas yang srid pa phyi ma'i dbang po bar chad med par nying mtshams sbyor bas so zhe'o //
translated: The semen and blood of the parents are established as the basis of the faculties, because the faculties do not exist previously, since the intermediate existence ceases simultaneously with the next birth, and the faculties of the next birth are established without interruption.

original: slob dpon gzhan kha cig ni 'byung ba chen po gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: slob dpon gzhan kha cig ni 'byung ba chen po gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Some other masters say that the great elements arise from other great elements,

original: ji ltar las dang / lus la brten nas srog chags gzhan skye ba bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar las dang / lus la brten nas srog chags gzhan skye ba bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: just as other insects are born in dependence on the body and karma.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni /
translated: The Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra teaches

original: slob dpon snga ma'i 'dod pa ltar ston to //
analyzed: slob dpon snga ma'i 'dod pa ltar ston to //
translated: in accordance with the assertion of the former masters.

original: bstan @227b bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i las ni bshad pa phyi ma yang dag pa'i don yin par ston te /
analyzed: bstan @227b bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i las ni bshad pa phyi ma yang dag pa'i don yin par ston te /
translated: The treatise Correct Logical Analysis teaches that the latter explanation is the correct meaning,

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: as it is extensively taught in that treatise.

original: de la phan tshun 'dus pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la bshad pa gnyis yod de /🔽kha cig na re dang po skye ba len pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de la phan tshun 'dus pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la bshad pa gnyis yod de / kha cig na re dang po skye ba len pa'i tshe /
translated: Mutual contact means that there are two explanations.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa'i phan tshun 'dus par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa'i phan tshun 'dus par gyur pa yin te /
translated: Some say: When first taking birth, consciousness and the other faculties, the great elements and so on, mutually contact each other.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Therefore the Yogācāra Levels states:

original: rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad de'i mthus /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad de'i mthus /
translated: Consciousness is the seed and through its power

original: de las gzhan pa dbang bo'i 'byung ba cha phra ba dang / de dang mthun pa'i khu ba dang khrag 'dus pa dbang po dang bcas pa gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dbang bo'i 'byung ba cha phra ba dang / de dang mthun pa'i khu ba dang khrag 'dus pa dbang po dang bcas pa gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: the other faculties arise, such as the subtle great elements and the blood and semen that are compatible with them and possess faculties.

original: kha cig na re rnam par shes pa dang / mer mer po phan tshun 'dus pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re rnam par shes pa dang / mer mer po phan tshun 'dus pa yin te /
translated: Some say: Consciousness and the kalala embryo mutually contact each other.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
translated: Therefore the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna says:

original: ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa dang / mer mer po phan tshun 'dus par gyur nas zhes bya ba yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa dang / mer mer po phan tshun 'dus par gyur nas zhes bya ba yin no zhe'o //
translated: and the consciousness in the mother’s womb, and the mutual union of the kalala, etc.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: The master Niḥsvabhāva­vajrānī’s commentary explains:

original: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa dmar po dang / dkar po de dag dang / grub pa dang bde ba gcig tu gyur ces bshad de /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa dmar po dang / dkar po de dag dang / grub pa dang bde ba gcig tu gyur ces bshad de /
translated: “The red and white karmic ripening consciousnesses become one with the established bliss.”

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las kyang don 'di dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las kyang don 'di dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: The commentary composed by the master Vasubandhu also appears to agree with this meaning.

original: de la rgyas shing 'phel ba dang yangs par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: de la rgyas shing 'phel ba dang yangs par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: “It grows, increases, and expands” has two explanations.

original: kha cig ni snga ma'i phan tshun 'dus pa'i mthus mer mer po la sogs pa rim gyis 'phel bar gyur pa na /
