analyzed: kha cig ni snga ma'i phan tshun 'dus pa'i mthus mer mer po la sogs pa rim gyis 'phel bar gyur pa na /
translated: Some say that through the power of the mutual union of the previous [two], the kalala, etc., gradually increase,

original: dbang po'i 'byung ba la sogs pa sa bon rgyas shing 'phel ba dang yangs par gyur pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'byung ba la sogs pa sa bon rgyas shing 'phel ba dang yangs par gyur pa'o zhe'o //
translated: and the seeds of the elements of the sense organs grow, increase, and expand.

original: kha cig ni 'dus pa'i dbang gis ming dang / gzugs rim gyis rgyas shing 'phel ba dang / yangs par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'dus pa'i dbang gis ming dang / gzugs rim gyis rgyas shing 'phel ba dang / yangs par gyur pa ste /
translated: Some say: Name and form gradually increase and expand through the power of the assembly and become extensive.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Thus the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra says:

original: mer mer po de yang yar skye ba'i tshe ni ming dang gzugs gnyis kyang de gnyi ga ches rgya cher 'gyur bas mtshungs snyam du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mer mer po de yang yar skye ba'i tshe ni ming dang gzugs gnyis kyang de gnyi ga ches rgya cher 'gyur bas mtshungs snyam du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: When the kalala is born, both name and form are born and increase greatly.

original: skye ba de yang lus yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur gyi bar du skye bar bya'o //🔽de @228a * //
analyzed: skye ba de yang lus yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur gyi bar du skye bar bya'o // de @228a * //
translated: That birth continues until the body is complete.

original: la sa'i khams rgyur byas pa'i gzugs skye zhing ches rgya che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la sa'i khams rgyur byas pa'i gzugs skye zhing ches rgya che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Form derived from the primary elements of earth is born and increases greatly.

original: chu'i khams ni de nyid sdud par byed do //
analyzed: chu'i khams ni de nyid sdud par byed do //
translated: The water element causes it to congeal.

original: me'i khams ni de nyid smin par byed de /🔽'dzag par mi 'gyur ba'i tshul bstan par byed do //
analyzed: me'i khams ni de nyid smin par byed de / 'dzag par mi 'gyur ba'i tshul bstan par byed do //
translated: The fire element ripens it.🔽The wind element causes it to expand.

original: rlung gi khams ni yan lag rnam par 'byed cing gnas par byed do zhes 'byung ngo zhe'o //
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni yan lag rnam par 'byed cing gnas par byed do zhes 'byung ngo zhe'o //
translated: The space element is taught to be the nonobstruction of that.

original: de dag gi gnas skabs rnam par gzhag pa de yang gnas skabs rnam par gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gi gnas skabs rnam par gzhag pa de yang gnas skabs rnam par gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: The stages of development of the embryo are also of two kinds:

original: mngal na gnas pa'i dus brgyad dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi dus brgyad do //
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa'i dus brgyad dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi dus brgyad do //
translated: eight stages of development in the womb and eight stages of general characteristics.

original: de la mngal na gnas pa'i dus brgyad ni 'di lta ste mer mer po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la mngal na gnas pa'i dus brgyad ni 'di lta ste mer mer po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The eight stages of development in the womb are kalala, arbuda, peśin, ghana, praśākhā, mahāpāda, dāruṇa, and harita.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
translated: Therefore, the Abhidharma treatise entitled the Compendium of Various Dharmas states:

original: de'i 'og tu dbang po rnams rim gyis skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dbang po rnams rim gyis skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: After that, the faculties gradually arise.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las ji skad du /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las ji skad du /
translated: As it says in the dependent origination:

original: thog ma nyid du mer mer 'gyur //
analyzed: thog ma nyid du mer mer 'gyur //
translated: First, there is kalala.

original: de yi 'og tu nur nur 'gyur //🔽nur nur po las nar nar 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi 'og tu nur nur 'gyur // nur nur po las nar nar 'gyur //
translated: After that, there is arbuda.🔽From arbuda, there is peśin.

original: nar nar po las gor gor 'gyur //
analyzed: nar nar po las gor gor 'gyur //
translated: From peśin, there is ghana.

original: gor gor po las rkang lag 'gyu //
analyzed: gor gor po las rkang lag 'gyu //
translated: From ghana, there are the limbs.

original: skra spu sen mo la sogs 'byung //
analyzed: skra spu sen mo la sogs 'byung //
translated: Hair, body hair, nails, and so on arise.

original: dbang po gzugs can rnams dang ni //
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can rnams dang ni //
translated: The physical faculties

original: mtshan rnams mthar gyis 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan rnams mthar gyis 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: and the secondary signs gradually arise.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This is what is said.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las mngal na gnas pa de la yang dus rnam pa brgyad yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las mngal na gnas pa de la yang dus rnam pa brgyad yod de /
translated: Moreover, the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra says that the embryo in the womb has eight stages.

original: dus rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na /🔽mer mer po'i dus dang / nur nur po'i dus dang / ltar ltar po'i dus dang / mkhrang gyur pa'i dus dang / rkang lag 'gyu ba'i dus dang / skra dang / ba sbu dang / sen mo 'byung ba'i dus dang / dbang po dod pa'i dus dang /
analyzed: dus rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na / mer mer po'i dus dang / nur nur po'i dus dang / ltar ltar po'i dus dang / mkhrang gyur pa'i dus dang / rkang lag 'gyu ba'i dus dang / skra dang / ba sbu dang / sen mo 'byung ba'i dus dang / dbang po dod pa'i dus dang /
translated: What are the eight stages?

original: mtshan dod pa'i dus so //
analyzed: mtshan dod pa'i dus so //
translated: The stage of kalala, the stage of arbuda, the stage of peśin, the stage of ghana, the stage of praśākhā, the stage of hair and body hair and nails, the stage of the development of the faculties, and the stage of the development of secondary sex characteristics.

original: de la spris ma lta bus g-yogs la /🔽nang rlan te mer mer 'dug pa ni mer mer po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la spris ma lta bus g-yogs la / nang rlan te mer mer 'dug pa ni mer mer po zhes bya'o //
translated: The kalala stage is like a lump of semen and blood.

original: phyi nang bcas par spris ma lta bur gyur te /🔽zho lta bur 'dug la shar ma gyur pa ni nur nur po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nang bcas par spris ma lta bur gyur te / zho lta bur 'dug la shar ma gyur pa ni nur nur po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is covered by a membrane and is soft and moist inside, like a blister.🔽This is called the kalala stage.🔽The arbuda stage is like a lump of thick milk.

original: shar ni gyur la sla ba ni ltar ltar po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shar ni gyur la sla ba ni ltar ltar po zhes bya'o //
translated: The peśin stage is like fresh butter.🔽The ghana stage is like fresh cheese.🔽The praśākhā stage is when the four limbs and the head appear.

original: ska bar gyur te mnam du bzod pa ni mkhrang gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ska bar gyur te mnam du bzod pa ni mkhrang gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: The stage of hardness is when the embryo is solid and cannot be bent.

original: de nyid las sha lhag lta bur gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid las sha lhag lta bur gyur te /
translated: The stage of the lump is when the embryo is like a lump.

original: yan @228b lag dang nying lag gi mtshan ma byung ba ni rkang lag 'gyus pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yan @228b lag dang nying lag gi mtshan ma byung ba ni rkang lag 'gyus pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The stage of the limbs and digits is when the signs of the limbs and digits appear.

original: de skra dang ba sbu dang / sen mo byung ba ni de nyid kyi dus yin no //🔽de nas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams mngon par 'grub pa ni dbang po dod pa'i dus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de skra dang ba sbu dang / sen mo byung ba ni de nyid kyi dus yin no // de nas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams mngon par 'grub pa ni dbang po dod pa'i dus zhes bya'o //
translated: The stage of hair and body hair and nails is when the hair of the head, body hair, and nails appear.🔽The stage of the faculties is when the eye and other faculties are formed.

original: de nas de'i gnas gsal bar gyur pa ni mtshan dod pa'i dus zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nas de'i gnas gsal bar gyur pa ni mtshan dod pa'i dus zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The stage of the sex organs is when the male and female organs become distinct.

original: mer mer po la sogs pa dus de dag ji srid kyis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: mer mer po la sogs pa dus de dag ji srid kyis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How long does it take for the embryo to complete these stages?

original: smras pa / bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las mngal na gnas pa de yang /
analyzed: smras pa / bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las mngal na gnas pa de yang /
translated: The Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra says,

original: zhag bdun phrag sum cu rtsa brgyad kyis mngal du yan lag dang / nyid lag thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhag bdun phrag sum cu rtsa brgyad kyis mngal du yan lag dang / nyid lag thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The embryo in the womb will have all the limbs and digits after thirty-eight weeks.

original: de nas zhag bzhi lon na btsa' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas zhag bzhi lon na btsa' bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, after four days, it is born.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Bhagavån has said in the Descent into the Womb Sûtra:

original: de ni zla ba dgu'am /
analyzed: de ni zla ba dgu'am /
translated: After nine months

original: de las 'das na shin tu rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las 'das na shin tu rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: or a little more, it is fully developed.

original: zla ba brgyad kyis ni rdzogs pa yin mod kyi shin tu rdzogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zla ba brgyad kyis ni rdzogs pa yin mod kyi shin tu rdzogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is fully developed after eight months, but not fully matured.

original: zla ba drug gam bdun gyis ni rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zla ba drug gam bdun gyis ni rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not fully developed after six or seven months,

original: yan lag ma tshang bar yang 'gyur ro zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yan lag ma tshang bar yang 'gyur ro zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: and it is born with incomplete faculties.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos rnam par dgrol ba'i lam bstan pa dang / mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos rnam par dgrol ba'i lam bstan pa dang / mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation should be understood according to the explanation in the Sûtra on Entering the Womb and the treatise called the Path of Purification.

original: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi dus brgyad ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i bstan bcos las /🔽ji skad du /
analyzed: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi dus brgyad ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i bstan bcos las / ji skad du /
translated: The eight general characteristics are explained in the Yogâcārabhūmi:

original: dus brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: dus brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight periods?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mngal na gnas pa'i dus dang / btsas pa'i dus dang / byis pa'i dus dang / gzhon nu'i dus dang / lang tsho'i dus dang / dar la bab pa'i dus dang / rgas pa'i dus dang / 'khogs pa'i dus so //
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa'i dus dang / btsas pa'i dus dang / byis pa'i dus dang / gzhon nu'i dus dang / lang tsho'i dus dang / dar la bab pa'i dus dang / rgas pa'i dus dang / 'khogs pa'i dus so //
translated: the period of embryonic states, the period of birth, the period of childhood, the period of youth, the period of adulthood, the period of middle age, the period of old age, and the period of senility.

original: de la mngal na gnas pa'i dus ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la mngal na gnas pa'i dus ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The period of embryonic states is as follows:

original: mer mer po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mer mer po la sogs pa'o //
translated: the embryonic states of kalala, etc.

original: btsas pa'i dus ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: btsas pa'i dus ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The period of birth is as follows:

original: de yan chad ni 'gogs pa'i dus man chad do //
analyzed: de yan chad ni 'gogs pa'i dus man chad do //
translated: from that time on until the time of death.

original: byis pa'i dus ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byis pa'i dus ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The period of childhood is as follows:

original: 'gro ba dang / rtse mi nus pa man chad do //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / rtse mi nus pa man chad do //
translated: from the time one can walk and play until the time one is able to do so.

original: gzhon nu'i dus ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhon nu'i dus ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The period of youth is as follows:

original: de nus pa yin no //
analyzed: de nus pa yin no //
translated: from the time one is able to do so.

original: lang tsho'i dus ni 'di lta @229a * //
analyzed: lang tsho'i dus ni 'di lta @229a * //
translated: The period of adulthood is as follows:

original: ste ; 'dod pa spyod pa nus nas lo sum cu man chad do //
analyzed: ste ; 'dod pa spyod pa nus nas lo sum cu man chad do //
translated: from the time one is able to enjoy sexual intercourse until the time one is thirty years old.

original: dar la bab pa'i dus ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dar la bab pa'i dus ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The period of middle age is as follows:

original: lo lnga bcu man chad do //
analyzed: lo lnga bcu man chad do //
translated: from the time one is thirty until the time one is fifty.

original: rgas pa'i dus ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgas pa'i dus ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The period of old age is as follows:

original: lo bdun cu man chad do //
analyzed: lo bdun cu man chad do //
translated: from the time one is fifty until the time one is seventy.🔽The period of senility is as follows:🔽from the time one is seventy until the time of death.

original: de yan chad ni 'khogs pa'i dus so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yan chad ni 'khogs pa'i dus so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: From that point on, it is the period of old age.

original: len pa rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa sa bon pa'i rnam par shes pa len pa rnam pa gnyis la brten par ston to //
analyzed: len pa rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa sa bon pa'i rnam par shes pa len pa rnam pa gnyis la brten par ston to //
translated: The second kind of consciousness is the appropriating consciousness, which is the support for the two kinds of seeds.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This consciousness is also divided into three parts:

original: grangs smos pa dang / grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa dang / khams la brten nas rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: grangs smos pa dang / grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa dang / khams la brten nas rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: the enumeration of the kinds of consciousness, the listing of the names in the same order, and the analysis based on the realms.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /🔽de yan chad du dbang po la sogs pa rnam par shes pa la brten nas skye zhing 'phel bar bstan nas /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste / de yan chad du dbang po la sogs pa rnam par shes pa la brten nas skye zhing 'phel bar bstan nas /
translated: This is the first part.🔽From the beginning of this chapter up to this point, the root text has explained how the faculties and so on arise and increase in dependence on consciousness.

original: 'di man chad rnam par shes pa dbang po gzugs can la sogs pa la brten pa ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'di man chad rnam par shes pa dbang po gzugs can la sogs pa la brten pa ston par mdzad do //
translated: From here on, it will explain how consciousness is supported by the material faculties and so on.

original: dbang po gzugs can rten dang bcas pa len pa dang / mtshan ma dang / ming dang rnam par rtog pa la tha snyad du 'dogs pa'i spros pa'i bag chags len pa la brten to zhes bya ba ni gnyis ba grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can rten dang bcas pa len pa dang / mtshan ma dang / ming dang rnam par rtog pa la tha snyad du 'dogs pa'i spros pa'i bag chags len pa la brten to zhes bya ba ni gnyis ba grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the second, which is named according to number.

original: skye ba len pa'i gnas skabs su rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pas len pa rnam pa gnyis la /
analyzed: skye ba len pa'i gnas skabs su rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pas len pa rnam pa gnyis la /
translated: In the situation of taking up birth, the two kinds of taking up are due to the fruitional consciousness.

original: yul du dmigs par byed de /
analyzed: yul du dmigs par byed de /
translated: It takes up the object in two ways.

original: dang po ni dbang po lnga dang / de dag gi gnas su gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya la yang dag par brten pa len pa dang / gnyis pa ni mtshan ma dang / ming dang rnam par rtog pa'i chos gsum gyi bag chags la yul du dmigs pa len par byed do //🔽zag pa med pa'i sa bon ni ma gtogs te /
analyzed: dang po ni dbang po lnga dang / de dag gi gnas su gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya la yang dag par brten pa len pa dang / gnyis pa ni mtshan ma dang / ming dang rnam par rtog pa'i chos gsum gyi bag chags la yul du dmigs pa len par byed do // zag pa med pa'i sa bon ni ma gtogs te /
translated: The first is taking up the five sense faculties and their supports, which are based on form, sound, smell, taste, and touch. The second is taking up the object of the habitual tendencies of the three phenomena of signs, names, and conceptualization.

original: dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The seeds of the uncontaminated are not included because they are not objects.

original: len pa 'di dag kyang dmigs par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: len pa 'di dag kyang dmigs par bya ba yin te /
translated: These appropriators are also the objects of the two kinds of grasping.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las mdor bsdu na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las mdor bsdu na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug ste /
translated: Therefore, the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra says, “In brief, the storehouse consciousness evolves with two kinds of objects:

original: nang gi len pa rnam par rig pa'i phyir dang / phyi rol gyi snod kyi rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi len pa rnam par rig pa'i phyir dang / phyi rol gyi snod kyi rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it perceives internal appropriators and because it perceives the external world in its gross aspects.

original: de la nang gi len pa rnam par rig @229b pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la nang gi len pa rnam par rig @229b pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The internal appropriators are of two kinds:

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags dang / rten dang dbang po'i gzugs so //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags dang / rten dang dbang po'i gzugs so //
translated: the habitual propensities of attachment to the imagined reality and the form of the support and its organs.

original: de yang gzugs can gyi khams na'o //
analyzed: de yang gzugs can gyi khams na'o //
translated: The first is in the realm of form.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa ni bag chags len pa kho nar zad do //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa ni bag chags len pa kho nar zad do //
translated: The second is only the propensities of the appropriator.

original: de la phyi rol gyi snod kyi rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi snod kyi rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The external world in its gross aspects is the object of the storehouse consciousness because it is the cause of the evolution of the world in its gross aspects.

original: brten pa'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pa'i phyir dang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nang gi len pa rnam par rig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brten pa'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pa'i phyir dang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nang gi len pa rnam par rig pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the support and because it is the objective condition of the other consciousnesses and because it is the objective condition of the consciousness that perceives the physical cosmos,

original: dus thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad pa snod kyi 'jig rten gyi mtshan nyid rnam par rig pa ste /
analyzed: dus thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad pa snod kyi 'jig rten gyi mtshan nyid rnam par rig pa ste /
translated: the consciousness that perceives the physical cosmos is the objective condition of the consciousness that perceives the internal appropriator, the foundation consciousness.

original: dper na mar me 'bar ba na /
analyzed: dper na mar me 'bar ba na /
translated: For example, when a lamp is lit,

original: snying po dang snum gyi rgyus ni nang 'jug par 'gyur la /
analyzed: snying po dang snum gyi rgyus ni nang 'jug par 'gyur la /
translated: its wick and oil are the cause of its inner illumination,🔽and its flame and light are the cause of its outer illumination.

original: phyi rol du ni 'od 'byung bar byed pa bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nang gi len pa dmigs pa dang / phyi rol gyi snod kyi mtshan nyid la dmigs nas 'byung ba'i tshul yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phyi rol du ni 'od 'byung bar byed pa bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nang gi len pa dmigs pa dang / phyi rol gyi snod kyi mtshan nyid la dmigs nas 'byung ba'i tshul yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In the same way, the foundation consciousness is the objective condition of the consciousness that perceives the internal appropriator and the objective condition of the consciousness that perceives the external physical cosmos.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: The treatise Demonstration of Consciousness Only says,

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The objective realm of the foundation consciousness is threefold.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten dang zag pa dang bcas pa sa bon dang dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus so //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten dang zag pa dang bcas pa sa bon dang dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus so //
translated: The world as container and the body with its seeds and faculties, which is associated with the outflows.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi mthu'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid skye ba na nang gi gyur pa ni sa bon dang dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus lta bur snang la /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi mthu'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid skye ba na nang gi gyur pa ni sa bon dang dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus lta bur snang la /
translated: When the consciousness of the ground of all arises by the power of its causes and conditions, the internal transformation appears as the body with its seeds and faculties.

original: phyi rol gyi gyur pa ni snod lta bur rung ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gyur pa ni snod lta bur rung ste /
translated: The external transformation appears as the world as container.

original: gyur par snang ba de nyid rang gi dmigs pa'i rnam par byed de /
analyzed: gyur par snang ba de nyid rang gi dmigs pa'i rnam par byed de /
translated: That transformation appears as the form of its own objective reference.

original: phan tshun ltos nas skye ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: phan tshun ltos nas skye ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because it arises in dependence on each other.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is taught extensively in the same text.

original: 'dir len pa zhes gsungs pa'i don ni yongs su 'dzin pa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir len pa zhes gsungs pa'i don ni yongs su 'dzin pa la bya ste /
translated: Here the term appropriated refers to that which is thoroughly taken up.

original: dbang po lnga dang de dag gi rten yongs su bzungs nas mi 'jig cing rang gi rten du byed pas yongs su 'dzin pa'i sa bon ni bdag nyid la yod pa dang rten zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang de dag gi rten yongs su bzungs nas mi 'jig cing rang gi rten du byed pas yongs su 'dzin pa'i sa bon ni bdag nyid la yod pa dang rten zhes bya'o //
translated: The seeds of the appropriated aggregates are called the self and the support because they are not destroyed and they act as the support for the five faculties and their basis.

original: len pa zhes bya ba yang 'di yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ni /🔽khams @230a * //
analyzed: len pa zhes bya ba yang 'di yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ni / khams @230a * //
translated: The Abhidharmakośa states:

original: bco brgyad las dgu ni ma zin pa'o //
analyzed: bco brgyad las dgu ni ma zin pa'o //
translated: From the eighteen elements, nine are not appropriated.

original: gzhan ni rnam pa gnyis so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam pa gnyis so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The others are of two types.

original: de ni don gcig la brten nas zin pa'i don bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni don gcig la brten nas zin pa'i don bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: This explains the meaning of appropriated in dependence on a single meaning.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las zin pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las zin pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: Therefore, what is the meaning of the term possessed?🔽The Abhidharmakośa declares:

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos kyis yongs su bzung nas gnas su gyur pa ni zin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos kyis yongs su bzung nas gnas su gyur pa ni zin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is held by the mind and mental factors and becomes a basis is called possessed.

original: phan pa dang gnod pa phan tshun rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba nas rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: phan pa dang gnod pa phan tshun rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba nas rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because it is mutually related to benefit and harm.

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa las slob dpon gsum gyis bshad pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa las slob dpon gsum gyis bshad pa 'byung ste /
translated: The treatise Correct Logical Analysis explains the three masters’ assertions.

original: dang po ni mdzod kyi bstan bcos las bshad pa dang mthun pas bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa'i 'grel pa las /🔽gal te de lta na gzugs la sogs pa ni gcig tu ma zin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dang po ni mdzod kyi bstan bcos las bshad pa dang mthun pas bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa'i 'grel pa las / gal te de lta na gzugs la sogs pa ni gcig tu ma zin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The commentary on the treatise called Rational System of Exposition states:

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams de dag la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / dbang po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams de dag la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / dbang po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is so, then form and so on are not exclusively one because they are the focal object of minds and mental factors and they are not the nature of the sense faculties.

original: de lta ma yin na gzugs la sogs pa ni dbang po dang bral bar mi 'gyur la /🔽bral na ni ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzugs la sogs pa ni dbang po dang bral bar mi 'gyur la / bral na ni ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, form and so on would not be free from the sense faculties.

original: sems la sogs pas brten par bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do zhe'o //
analyzed: sems la sogs pas brten par bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do zhe'o //
translated: If they were free, they would not be objects of the mind and so on because they would be free from being supported by the mind and so on.

original: gnyis pa ni bye brag tu smra ba dag na re /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bye brag tu smra ba dag na re /
translated: The second is the assertion of the Vaibhāṣikas.

original: gal te gzugs kyi chos rnams la gnod cing zhig par gyur na ni sdug bsngal skyed par byed la de las bzlog pa las ni bde ba skyed par byed de /
analyzed: gal te gzugs kyi chos rnams la gnod cing zhig par gyur na ni sdug bsngal skyed par byed la de las bzlog pa las ni bde ba skyed par byed de /
translated: If the phenomena of form are harmed and destroyed, they generate suffering and if they are the opposite of that, they generate pleasure.

original: rang gi lus kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa de ni zin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi lus kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa de ni zin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is included in one’s own body is called “appropriated.”

original: gsum pa ni slob dpon gzhan kha cig na re /
analyzed: gsum pa ni slob dpon gzhan kha cig na re /
translated: Some other masters say:

original: sems can rnams rang gi bdag nyid yod par 'dzin cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams rang gi bdag nyid yod par 'dzin cing /
translated: Sentient beings grasp their own self as existing,

original: dus thams cad du thabs kyis yongs su bsrung ba gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba nas rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dus thams cad du thabs kyis yongs su bsrung ba gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba nas rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
translated: and it is always protected by skillful means.

original: gal te de lta na mdo las gsungs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na mdo las gsungs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then it would contradict the sūtra,

original: mdo las ni gnas 'dir rnam par shes pas sbas pa dang / rnam par shes pas rjes su bsdus pa gang yin pa de ni len pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las ni gnas 'dir rnam par shes pas sbas pa dang / rnam par shes pas rjes su bsdus pa gang yin pa de ni len pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: because the sūtra states: “In this context, that which is hidden by consciousness and subsumed by consciousness is called grasping.”

original: de ltar gsungs pa yod kyang 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: de ltar gsungs pa yod kyang 'gal ba med de /
translated: Even though it is stated that way, there is no contradiction,

original: @230b len pa dang bcas pa'i chos ni mdor bsdu na ni rnam pa gnyis yod pas so //
analyzed: @230b len pa dang bcas pa'i chos ni mdor bsdu na ni rnam pa gnyis yod pas so //
translated: because the phenomena that possess grasping are, in brief, of two types.

original: de la dang po ni len pa dang bcas shing 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang bcas pa'i bdag nyid yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa la yang len pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la dang po ni len pa dang bcas shing 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang bcas pa'i bdag nyid yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa la yang len pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The first is the apprehension of the self as existent, which is associated with the view of the transitory collection and with appropriation.

original: gal te yongs su dag pa'i shes pa skyes na ni de yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yongs su dag pa'i shes pa skyes na ni de yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the knowledge of purification arises, then it is abandoned.

original: gnyis pa ni sdug bsngal dang bde bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur nas mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du rjes su 'jug cing mi spong ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sdug bsngal dang bde bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur nas mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du rjes su 'jug cing mi spong ba ste /
translated: The second is the apprehension of the self as existent, which is associated with the view of the transitory collection but not with appropriation, and which is not abandoned until the attainment of nirvana, since it is the cause of the generation of suffering and happiness.

original: 'di ni mdo dang bstan bcos dag las so so nas don re re la brten te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mdo dang bstan bcos dag las so so nas don re re la brten te bstan pa'o //
translated: In the sutras and the treatises, each of these two is taught in dependence on a different meaning.

original: de la mdo las ni len pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang bcas pas bdag nyid yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa la dgongs nas len pa dang bcas pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la mdo las ni len pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang bcas pas bdag nyid yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa la dgongs nas len pa dang bcas pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the sutras, the Buddha had in mind the apprehension of the self as existent, which is associated with the view of the transitory collection and with appropriation, when he said, “associated with appropriation.”

original: bstan bcos las ni rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
translated: In the treatises, it is explained in three ways.

original: slob dpon dang po ni gnas su 'dzin pa la dgongs nas so //
analyzed: slob dpon dang po ni gnas su 'dzin pa la dgongs nas so //
translated: The first master had in mind the apprehension of the self as the basis of action when he said, “associated with appropriation.”

original: slob dpon bar ma ni sdug bsngal dang bde ba bskyed pa la dgongs nas so //
analyzed: slob dpon bar ma ni sdug bsngal dang bde ba bskyed pa la dgongs nas so //
translated: The middle teacher says that it is intended to refer to the production of suffering and pleasure.

original: slob dpon tha ma ni bdag nyid du 'dzin pa la dgongs nas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon tha ma ni bdag nyid du 'dzin pa la dgongs nas bstan pa yin te /
translated: The last teacher says that it is intended to refer to the grasping of self.

original: thams cad kyang bstan bcos dang rjes su mthun no //
analyzed: thams cad kyang bstan bcos dang rjes su mthun no //
translated: All of them are in agreement with the treatises.

original: de yang rang gi lus kyi bsdus pa gang yin pa ni len pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rang gi lus kyi bsdus pa gang yin pa ni len pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, that which is included in one's own body is called appropriation.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal dang / bde ba bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal dang / bde ba bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don nyid de /
translated: This is the meaning of the statement that it is the cause of the production of suffering and pleasure.

original: slob dpon gnyis pa de ni sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba bskyed pa kho na la der 'dod do //
analyzed: slob dpon gnyis pa de ni sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba bskyed pa kho na la der 'dod do //
translated: The second teacher asserts that it is just the production of suffering and pleasure.

original: slob dpon dang po dang tha ma gnyis ni don gzhan yang blangs nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon dang po dang tha ma gnyis ni don gzhan yang blangs nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The first and last teachers assert that it is also something else.

original: mdo sde dang bstan bcos de dag gi bshad pa yang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: mdo sde dang bstan bcos de dag gi bshad pa yang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: The explanations of those sutras and treatises are, in brief, of four kinds.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: They are explained in detail in that same text.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na /
translated: Here, in the context of the Mahayana teachings,

original: bshad pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gsum yod do //
analyzed: bshad pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gsum yod do //
translated: there are three different explanations.

original: kha cig ni sdug bsngal dang bde ba bskyed pa kho na las brtsams nas len pa zhes ston te /
analyzed: kha cig ni sdug bsngal dang bde ba bskyed pa kho na las brtsams nas len pa zhes ston te /
translated: Some explain appropriation in terms of the generation of pleasure and pain alone.🔽Thus the Abhidharmasamuccaya states,

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos mngon pa kun las btus pa las khams gzugs can lnga dang / bzhi'i phyogs gcig ni zin pa zhes bya'o zhes @231a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos mngon pa kun las btus pa las khams gzugs can lnga dang / bzhi'i phyogs gcig ni zin pa zhes bya'o zhes @231a * //
translated: The five physical elements and one part of the fourth are called appropriated.

original: 'byung ste / sgra ma bstan pas sdug bsngal dang bde ba bskyed pa las brtsams nas len pa zhes bstan par rig par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'byung ste / sgra ma bstan pas sdug bsngal dang bde ba bskyed pa las brtsams nas len pa zhes bstan par rig par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Since sound is not mentioned, it should be understood that appropriation is explained in terms of the generation of pleasure and pain.

original: kha cig ni rang gi ngo bor gzung ba la len pa zhes bya'o zhes ston te /
analyzed: kha cig ni rang gi ngo bor gzung ba la len pa zhes bya'o zhes ston te /
translated: Some explain that appropriation refers to the apprehension of the intrinsic reality of form and so on.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Thus the Yogācārabhūmi states:🔽If there were no foundation consciousness, the apprehension of the sense bases would not be observed.

original: gal te kun gzhi med na gnas len pa mi dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang de nyid las lnga ni len pa'o //
analyzed: gal te kun gzhi med na gnas len pa mi dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang de nyid las lnga ni len pa'o //
translated: Also, that text states: The five are appropriation.

original: lnga ni len pa dang len pa ma yin pa'o //🔽gzhan ni gcig tu len pa ma yin pa'o zhes bshad pas so zhes zer te 'di la sogs pa'i bstan pa la brten nas rang gi ngo bor gzung ba la len pa zhes ston te /
analyzed: lnga ni len pa dang len pa ma yin pa'o // gzhan ni gcig tu len pa ma yin pa'o zhes bshad pas so zhes zer te 'di la sogs pa'i bstan pa la brten nas rang gi ngo bor gzung ba la len pa zhes ston te /
translated: The other five are both appropriators and appropriated.🔽The other four are only appropriated.🔽Some say: The term appropriator is used for that which is grasped as an intrinsic reality, based on such teachings as:

original: kha cig ni don gnyi ga la brten nas len pa ston te /
analyzed: kha cig ni don gnyi ga la brten nas len pa ston te /
translated: Some say: The term appropriator is used for both objects and consciousness, based on the Yogācārabhūmi, which states:

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du de la rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang / mi gnas pas zin pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa de yang gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du de la rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang / mi gnas pas zin pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa de yang gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What is form conjoined with consciousness that is and is not a basis of consciousness?🔽It is that which is mixed with consciousness and is the same as consciousness in terms of its benefits and harm.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa dang 'dres pa grub pa dang / bde ba gcig pa'i don gyis 'jug pa gang yin pa dang / gzhan yang 'dis rten byas nas tshor ba skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa dang 'dres pa grub pa dang / bde ba gcig pa'i don gyis 'jug pa gang yin pa dang / gzhan yang 'dis rten byas nas tshor ba skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is also that which is the basis for the arising of feeling.

original: de las bzlog pa ni zin pa ma yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba dang gzhan yang de nyid las zin pa'i chos ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni zin pa ma yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba dang gzhan yang de nyid las zin pa'i chos ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, that same text says, Conjoined phenomena are as follows:

original: gzugs can gyi chos rnams dang / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis yongs su bzung bas de dag la brten nas /
analyzed: gzugs can gyi chos rnams dang / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis yongs su bzung bas de dag la brten nas /
translated: those phenomena that have form, and those that are conjoined with mind and mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug cing 'grub pa dang / bde ba'i dngos po gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug cing 'grub pa dang / bde ba'i dngos po gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: They are conjoined because mind and mental factors engage and are established in dependence on them, and they are the basis for the single entity of pleasure.

original: de la grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa ni sems dang sems las byung bas yongs su gzung ba'i dbang gis gzugs de dag rgyun mi 'chang cing 'jig pa dang / 'dul par mi 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa ni sems dang sems las byung bas yongs su gzung ba'i dbang gis gzugs de dag rgyun mi 'chang cing 'jig pa dang / 'dul par mi 'gyur pa ste /
translated: In that regard, the single entity of establishment and pleasure is that those forms are not interrupted and do not perish, and are not subdued, by the power of being conjoined with mind and mental factors.

original: des na zin pa'i gzugs rnams la /
analyzed: des na zin pa'i gzugs rnams la /
translated: Therefore, in regard to conjoined form,

original: res 'ga' ni gnod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gnod par 'gyur la /
translated: sometimes it is harmful,

original: res 'ga' ni phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and sometimes it is beneficial.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba de dag kyang de dag gi rjes su phan gnod du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba de dag kyang de dag gi rjes su phan gnod du 'gyur ro //
translated: Those mind and mental factors are also beneficial or harmful to them.

original: de las bzlog pa ni zin pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o zhes @231b bstan pa lta bu'o zhe'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni zin pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o zhes @231b bstan pa lta bu'o zhe'o //
translated: The opposite of that is called not appropriated.

original: mdo 'di las len pa zhes gsungs pa ni don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dbang po'i gnas la bdag nyid kyi gnas su 'dzin pa dang / sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: mdo 'di las len pa zhes gsungs pa ni don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dbang po'i gnas la bdag nyid kyi gnas su 'dzin pa dang / sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: In this sutra, appropriation has two meanings: the appropriator is the foundation consciousness, which holds the sense faculties and their supports as its own; and the appropriator is the foundation consciousness, which holds the seeds.

original: zhib tu ni bstan bcos rnams las bshad pa bzhin no //🔽de la gzugs can gyi khams na ni len pa gnyi ga dang ldan la /
analyzed: zhib tu ni bstan bcos rnams las bshad pa bzhin no // de la gzugs can gyi khams na ni len pa gnyi ga dang ldan la /
translated: This is explained in detail in the treatises.🔽In the form realm, both kinds of appropriation exist.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni rnam pa gnyi ga dang mi ldan no zhes bya ba ni gsum pa khams la brten nas rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni rnam pa gnyi ga dang mi ldan no zhes bya ba ni gsum pa khams la brten nas rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: In the formless realm, neither kind of appropriation exists. This is the third analysis based on realm.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di dang sbyar na theg pa chen po'i gzhung gi gzugs med pa'i khams na mig dang rna ba la sogs pa gzugs can gyi khams bcu med par bzhed kyi dge 'dun phal chen pa'i sde pa dag ltar na gzugs can bcu dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga tshang bar yod par 'dod pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di dang sbyar na theg pa chen po'i gzhung gi gzugs med pa'i khams na mig dang rna ba la sogs pa gzugs can gyi khams bcu med par bzhed kyi dge 'dun phal chen pa'i sde pa dag ltar na gzugs can bcu dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga tshang bar yod par 'dod pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: When applied to the words of this sutra, it is asserted that the ten physical elements such as the eyes and ears do not exist in the formless realm in the scriptures of the Mahayana, but it is not like the assertion of the Mahāsāṃghika school that the ten physical elements and the five collections of consciousness are complete.

original: sngon gyi las bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: sngon gyi las bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Sutra Teaching Past Deeds of the Buddha states:🔽The gods of the formless realm have gathered in the retinue.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi lha rnams 'khor 'dus par 'ongs so zhes gsungs pa dang / dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo las /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi lha rnams 'khor 'dus par 'ongs so zhes gsungs pa dang / dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo las /
translated: The Sutra of the White Lotus of the Excellent Dharma states:

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i dri snom mo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i dri snom mo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: They smell the scent of the peak of existence.

original: 'di skad gsungs pa 'di dag ni thams cad kyang chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad gsungs pa 'di dag ni thams cad kyang chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: All of these are subsumed by the phenomena base.

original: blo gros yangs pa rnam par shes pa de ni len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa rnam par shes pa de ni len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: O Viśālamati, that consciousness is also called appropriating consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because this consciousness follows the body and takes it up.

original: rnam par shes pa 'di lus kyi rjes su 'brang zhing yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa len pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di lus kyi rjes su 'brang zhing yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa len pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the second consciousness, the appropriating consciousness.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa 'di'i dbang gis lus kyi rjes su 'brang zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa 'di'i dbang gis lus kyi rjes su 'brang zhing /
translated: In this way, because of the power of this consciousness, the body is taken up and follows.

original: dbang po gzugs can blangs nas 'jig par mi byed pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'di la len pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can blangs nas 'jig par mi byed pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'di la len pa gsungs so //
translated: Because it takes up the material sense-faculties and does not allow them to perish, this consciousness is called appropriating.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni don rnam pa gnyis kyis len pa rnam par bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni don rnam pa gnyis kyis len pa rnam par bshad de /
translated: In the treatise Compendium of the Great Vehicle, the appropriating consciousness is explained in terms of two meanings:

original: dbang po gzugs can dag ma zhig par nye bar bzung ba'i phyir dang / rang gi bdag nyid nye bar bzung nas skye ba len pa'i phyir ro zhes rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin na //
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can dag ma zhig par nye bar bzung ba'i phyir dang / rang gi bdag nyid nye bar bzung nas skye ba len pa'i phyir ro zhes rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin na //
translated: because it takes up the material sense-faculties without allowing them to perish and because it takes up one’s own nature and appropriates birth.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub @232a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub @232a * //
translated: In the treatise Proof of Consciousness Only,

original: pa las ni don rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: pa las ni don rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: The Abhidharmasamuccaya states:

original: de'i phyir de nyid las chos rnams kyi sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang / dbang po gzugs can gyi gnas yongs su 'dzin pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor bar yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las chos rnams kyi sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang / dbang po gzugs can gyi gnas yongs su 'dzin pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor bar yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it holds the seeds of all entities, it holds the physical sense faculties, and it holds the link to rebirth,

original: rnam par shes pa 'di len pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di len pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: this consciousness is called appropriating.

original: 'di ni bstan bcos rnam pa gnyis las bstan pa'i len pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni bstan bcos rnam pa gnyis las bstan pa'i len pa nyid do //
translated: This is the appropriating consciousness taught in the two treatises.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called the foundation consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because consciousness is the support of the body, it appropriates and conceals it, and it has the same purpose as the body, which is pleasure.

original: rnam par shes pa ni lus sdud cing len pa dang / sbed par byed pa grub pa dang / bde ba'i don gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gsum pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni lus sdud cing len pa dang / sbed par byed pa grub pa dang / bde ba'i don gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gsum pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the third explanation of the foundation consciousness.

original: kun gzhi zhes bya ba la don rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: kun gzhi zhes bya ba la don rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: The term foundation has three meanings.

original: sbed par byed pa dang / sba bar bya ba dang / sbas pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sbed par byed pa dang / sba bar bya ba dang / sbas pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: the concealer, the concealed, and the apprehender of the concealed.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Establishing Representational Cognition states:

original: rnam par shes pa 'di sbed pa dang / sba bar bya ba dang / sbas pa 'dzin pa'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dag dang / phan tshun rkyen byed pa'i phyir dang / sems can rnams nang gi bdag tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di sbed pa dang / sba bar bya ba dang / sbas pa 'dzin pa'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dag dang / phan tshun rkyen byed pa'i phyir dang / sems can rnams nang gi bdag tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because this consciousness has the meaning of the concealer, the concealed, and the apprehender of the concealed, because the afflictions and each other are its conditions, and because sentient beings grasp an inner self.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las kyang don rnam pa gsum gyis ston te /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las kyang don rnam pa gsum gyis ston te /
translated: The treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna also teaches this with three meanings.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'di kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'di kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Therefore, that same text says, “Why is this consciousness called the foundation consciousness?”

original: skye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi chos thams cad 'dir 'bras bu'i dngos por sbed pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang rnam par shes pa 'di dag la rgyu'i dngos po'i sbyor ba'i phyir dang / yang na sems can rnams rnam par shes pa 'di la rang gi bdag nyid du sbyor ba'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi chos thams cad 'dir 'bras bu'i dngos por sbed pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang rnam par shes pa 'di dag la rgyu'i dngos po'i sbyor ba'i phyir dang / yang na sems can rnams rnam par shes pa 'di la rang gi bdag nyid du sbyor ba'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because all phenomena that are the side of affliction that is to be abandoned are hidden here as the thing that is the result, and also because these consciousnesses are applied as the thing that is the cause, or because sentient beings are applied to these consciousnesses as their own nature, it is called foundation consciousness.

original: sbed pa'i don rnam pa gsum tha dad par 'gyur ba yang dang po sbed par byed pa ni 'bras bu rgyu la sbas pas rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i sa bon gyis snang ba'i rnam par shes pa bdun bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: sbed pa'i don rnam pa gsum tha dad par 'gyur ba yang dang po sbed par byed pa ni 'bras bu rgyu la sbas pas rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i sa bon gyis snang ba'i rnam par shes pa bdun bskyed pa ste /
translated: The three different meanings of hidden are as follows: The first is that the result is hidden in the cause, because the appearance of consciousness that is generated by seeds existing in consciousness is generated by the seven consciousnesses.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa'i rgyu las gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa'i rgyu las gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the result of affliction is not separate from the cause that generates it.

original: gnyis pa sba bar bya @232b ba ni rgyu sa bon 'bras bu la sbas pas yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon snang ba'i rnam par shes pa sgo bar byed pa la sbas pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa sba bar bya @232b ba ni rgyu sa bon 'bras bu la sbas pas yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon snang ba'i rnam par shes pa sgo bar byed pa la sbas pa ste /
translated: The second, “concealed,” means that the cause, the seed, is concealed in the result, so the seed that is the appearance of consciousness is concealed in the concealer.

original: rgyu'i ngo bor mngon par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i ngo bor mngon par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established as the nature of the cause.

original: gsum pa bdag tu 'dzin pas sbed pa'i don ni yul yongs su 'dzin cing sbed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa bdag tu 'dzin pas sbed pa'i don ni yul yongs su 'dzin cing sbed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The third, “concealed by grasping at self,” means that it conceals and grasps the object.

original: mdo 'di ni bstan bcos rnams dang mi mthun te /
analyzed: mdo 'di ni bstan bcos rnams dang mi mthun te /
translated: This sūtra is not in agreement with the treatises.

original: rnam par shes pa 'di dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus de dag gnas su sdud pas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus de dag gnas su sdud pas /
translated: This consciousness is concealed in the body together with the sense faculties because it gathers the body together with the sense faculties.

original: sbed pa de dag dang / rten gyi lus su grub pa dang / bde ba gcig pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sbed pa de dag dang / rten gyi lus su grub pa dang / bde ba gcig pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is established as the body that is the support and because it is the single basis of pleasure.

original: 'di ni snang ba'i rnam par shes pa 'di rten las sbas pas de'i phyir sbed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni snang ba'i rnam par shes pa 'di rten las sbas pas de'i phyir sbed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is because this appearance consciousness is concealed from the support. Therefore it is called “concealed.”

original: 'di yang sbed ba'i nang na don gyi phyogs gcig yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang sbed ba'i nang na don gyi phyogs gcig yin te /
translated: This is also one aspect of the meaning of “concealed.”

original: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las lus de dag las mngon par zhen pa'i phyir dang / bdag nyid gcig tu mthun pa'i phyir zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las lus de dag las mngon par zhen pa'i phyir dang / bdag nyid gcig tu mthun pa'i phyir zhes gsungs te /
translated: Because of strong attachment to those bodies and because of the sameness of the self,🔽there is the conception of “I.”

original: de la mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni sdud pa dang sbed pa yin la /
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni sdud pa dang sbed pa yin la /
translated: Here, “strong attachment” means to gather and conceal.

original: bdag nyid gcig tu mthun pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig tu mthun pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i don to //
translated: “Sameness of the self” means the same status and happiness.

original: sems zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: sems zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called “mind.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par shes pa 'di'i dbang gis /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di'i dbang gis /
translated: Because of the power of this consciousness,🔽forms, sounds, smells, tastes, tangible objects, and so forth are accumulated and increase.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya la sogs pa kun du bsags pa dang / 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni bzhi pa sems kyi don rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya la sogs pa kun du bsags pa dang / 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni bzhi pa sems kyi don rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the meaning of “mind,” the fourth topic.

original: 'di yang don rnam pa mang po dang ldan te /
analyzed: 'di yang don rnam pa mang po dang ldan te /
translated: This [mind] also has many meanings.

original: dang po ni bsags pa brtsams pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dang po ni bsags pa brtsams pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The first is called “the beginning of accumulation.”

original: chos rnams kyi sa bon bsags nas chos rnams 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi sa bon bsags nas chos rnams 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it accumulates the seeds of phenomena and causes phenomena to arise.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du /
translated: As the treatise Establishing a Foundation for Knowledge says:

original: gnyis pa bsags pa la don rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: gnyis pa bsags pa la don rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: The second, accumulation, has two meanings:🔽because it fully accumulates the seeds of phenomena.

original: chos rnams kyis sa bon rab tu bsags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
analyzed: chos rnams kyis sa bon rab tu bsags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
translated: And as the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna says:

original: chos rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon rnams kun du bsags pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon rnams kun du bsags pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: because it fully accumulates the seeds that are infused by various phenomena.

original: gnyis pa ni phyi rol gyi yul drug po dag kun du bsags pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽gsum @233a * //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni phyi rol gyi yul drug po dag kun du bsags pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir ro // gsum @233a * //
translated: The second is because it accumulates and increases the six external objects.

original: pa ni sdud pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pa ni sdud pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The third is called “gathering”

original: dmigs par bya ba'i yul rnam pa sna tshogs sdud pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i yul rnam pa sna tshogs sdud pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it gathers the various objects that are to be observed.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / phung po lnga'i rab tu byed pa las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / phung po lnga'i rab tu byed pa las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: as in the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning and in the Analysis of the Five Skandhas.

original: 'dir mdo sde 'di dang sbyar na /
analyzed: 'dir mdo sde 'di dang sbyar na /
translated: Here, the sutra is applied to the two kinds of objects.

original: don gnyis pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: don gnyis pa las brtsams nas /
translated: The second point is explained in the line,

original: de'i phyir sems zhes gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems zhes gsungs pa yin no /
translated: “Therefore, it is called mind.”

original: 'di yang don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan te /
analyzed: 'di yang don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan te /
translated: This also has two meanings:

original: kun du bsags pa dang 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun du bsags pa dang 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: it accumulates and it increases.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i dbang gis yul yongs su tshol bas kun du bsags pa dang 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i dbang gis yul yongs su tshol bas kun du bsags pa dang 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it accumulates and increases through seeking objects by means of form and so on.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las ni ming rnam pa bdun 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las ni ming rnam pa bdun 'byung ste /
translated: In the treatise Establishing Knowledge-Only, seven kinds of names are given.

original: mdo 'di las bstan pa'i ming bzhi la yang gsum gyis bsnan na'o //
analyzed: mdo 'di las bstan pa'i ming bzhi la yang gsum gyis bsnan na'o //
translated: The four kinds of names taught in this sutra are included in these seven.🔽What are the three additional names? The treatise says:

original: ming gsum po de yang gang zhe na bstan bcos de nyid las ji skad du shes bya'i gnas zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: ming gsum po de yang gang zhe na bstan bcos de nyid las ji skad du shes bya'i gnas zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is called the basis of what is known.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi gnas byed pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi gnas byed pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because it is the basis of all afflicted and pure phenomena.

original: 'di ni bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: 'di ni bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ji skad du /
translated: This is as stated in the treatise Compendium of the Great Vehicle:

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsung rab rnam pa bcu bstan pa las /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsung rab rnam pa bcu bstan pa las /
translated: Among the teachings on the ten distinctive features of the scriptures,

original: dang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya'o //
translated: it is the first.

original: gnas kyi khyad par gyi khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsung zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi khyad par gyi khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsung zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is taught that the scriptures are distinctive in terms of their basis.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary composed by the master Vasubandhu,

original: shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir shes bya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir shes bya zhes bya'o //
translated: it states: “Because it is to be known, it is called the knowable.

original: de yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, it is as follows:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams te ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams te ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The phenomena of affliction and purification have three natures.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i don to zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i don to zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The term basis means cause.”

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang /
translated: In the commentary composed by the master Niḥsvabhāva,🔽it states:

original: shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir shes bya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir shes bya zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the knowable because it is what is to be known.

original: gnas ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnas ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The basis is as follows:

original: brtan pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: brtan pa'i gnas te /
translated: It is the basis of the stable.

original: sgras ni rten par byed pa nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba 'dus byas kyi chos rnams gzung gi /'dus ma byas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgras ni rten par byed pa nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba 'dus byas kyi chos rnams gzung gi /'dus ma byas ni ma yin te /
translated: The term “basis” refers to the afflicted and pure conditioned phenomena that are supported, but not to the unconditioned because

original: de la gnas pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is meaningless to say that the unconditioned is based on the basis.

original: gnas ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gnas ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: The basis is the storehouse consciousness itself,

original: de dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang de dag 'dren par byed pa'i phyir ci rigs par @233b bya'o zhes 'byung ste /🔽de la slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang de dag 'dren par byed pa'i phyir ci rigs par @233b bya'o zhes 'byung ste / de la slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: because it is the cause of those and because it is the leader of those, as is appropriate.

original: ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum char kun gyi gnas byed par ston to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum char kun gyi gnas byed par ston to //
translated: In this regard, Master Vasubandhu teaches that the storehouse consciousness is the basis of all three natures.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med ni gzhan gyi dbang kho na'i ngo bo nyid dang gnas byed kyi /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med ni gzhan gyi dbang kho na'i ngo bo nyid dang gnas byed kyi /
translated: Master Nirākāravādin teaches that the basis is the dependent nature alone.

original: kun brtags dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi gnas ni mi byed do zhes ston to //
analyzed: kun brtags dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi gnas ni mi byed do zhes ston to //
translated: The reality of the imagined and the perfected are not the basis.

original: de la de dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i char gtogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gi gnas byed pas so //
analyzed: de la de dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i char gtogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gi gnas byed pas so //
translated: Therein, the phrase “because they are its causes” means that the other-dependent is the basis of the afflicted class because it is the cause of the imagined.

original: de dag 'dren pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba'i char gtogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gi gnas byed pas so //
analyzed: de dag 'dren pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba'i char gtogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gi gnas byed pas so //
translated: The phrase “because they are its effects” means that the other-dependent is the basis of the purified class because it is the effect of the perfected.

original: ni'i phyir bstan bcos 'di gnyis mi mthun par gyur ce na /
analyzed: ni'i phyir bstan bcos 'di gnyis mi mthun par gyur ce na /
translated: Why are these two treatises in disagreement?

original: smras pa / slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis spyi'i gnas las brtsams pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum spyir bstan to //🔽ngo bo nyid med na ni nye bar gyur pa'i gnas las brtsams pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smras pa / slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis spyi'i gnas las brtsams pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum spyir bstan to // ngo bo nyid med na ni nye bar gyur pa'i gnas las brtsams pa'i phyir /
translated: We respond: The master Vasubandhu taught the three natures in a general way because he was discussing the general basis.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo kho na dang sbyar nas bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo kho na dang sbyar nas bstan te /
translated: Since the perfected nature is not a basis, he taught it in a specific way, applying it only to the other-dependent nature, because he was discussing the specific basis.

original: so so nas don re re smos pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: so so nas don re re smos pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since each of the three natures is mentioned in a specific sense, there is no disagreement.

original: yang na rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called the fruitional consciousness.🔽

original: 'khor na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu rab tu 'dren pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'khor na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu rab tu 'dren pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Or it is called the “maturation consciousness” because it is the leader in producing the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma in its stream.

original: de la rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba yang don rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba yang don rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: Maturation has three meanings:

original: dang po ni rnam par gyur nas rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang po ni rnam par gyur nas rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The first is called maturation because it matures after transformation.

original: gnyis pa ni dus tha dad pa na rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dus tha dad pa na rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The second is called maturation because it matures at a different time.

original: gsum pa ni ris tha dad pa rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni ris tha dad pa rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The third is called maturation because it matures in a different class.

original: de yang rgyu ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin la 'bras bu ni lung du mi ston pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de yang rgyu ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin la 'bras bu ni lung du mi ston pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called maturation because its cause is virtuous or nonvirtuous and its result is neutral.

original: rnam pa gsum las 'dir ni gsum pa'i sa tha dad pa bzung ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum las 'dir ni gsum pa'i sa tha dad pa bzung ste /
translated: From among the three, here the third is taken as the basis.

original: snga ma gnyis ni spyi'i ming yin pas rnam par smin pa gzhan du yang gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma gnyis ni spyi'i ming yin pas rnam par smin pa gzhan du yang gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first two are general terms, because they also include other fruitions.

original: yang na dri ma med pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: yang na dri ma med pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: Or it is called stainless consciousness.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung @234a * //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung @234a * //
translated: Because it is the basis of the extremely pure, uncontaminated phenomena.

original: ste ; 'di ni gya nom par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs su me long lta bu'i ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyi bdag nyid la dri ma med pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ste ; 'di ni gya nom par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs su me long lta bu'i ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyi bdag nyid la dri ma med pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called stainless consciousness, which is the nature of mind concomitant with mirrorlike wisdom at the stage of manifest, perfect buddhahood.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes dang / ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa zag pa med pa'i lam gyi chos kyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan bkod pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes dang / ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa zag pa med pa'i lam gyi chos kyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan bkod pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: And as the Tathāgataguṇajñānācintyāvatāramudrā-sūtra says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dri med rnam shes ni //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dri med rnam shes ni //
translated: The stainless consciousness of the Tathāgata

original: shin tu dag cing zag med dbyings yin pas //
analyzed: shin tu dag cing zag med dbyings yin pas //
translated: is extremely pure and the realm free of contaminants.

original: sgrib pa thams cad las ni rnam par dgrol //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad las ni rnam par dgrol //
translated: It is liberated from all obscurations

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes mtshungs par ldan //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes mtshungs par ldan // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and is endowed with mirror-like wisdom.

original: rgya cher rnam par bshad pa ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i 'grel ba las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o /
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par bshad pa ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i 'grel ba las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o /
translated: The extensive explanation should be understood according to the treatise Proof of Consciousness Only.

original: // / bam po nyi shu gcig pa /
analyzed: // / bam po nyi shu gcig pa /

original: blo gros yangs pa len pa'i rnam par shes pas gnas dang / rnam par gzhag pa byas pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa tshogs drug po dag 'jug pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa len pa'i rnam par shes pas gnas dang / rnam par gzhag pa byas pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa tshogs drug po dag 'jug pa 'di lta ste /
translated: O Viśālamati, the six collections of consciousness engage in objects because the appropriating consciousness creates the foundation and establishes the categories.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa rnam par shes pa rnams lhan cig 'jug pa'i bye brag ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa rnam par shes pa rnams lhan cig 'jug pa'i bye brag ston par mdzad do //
translated: From here on, the second part is taught, which is the specific explanation of the simultaneous engagement of the consciousnesses.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: This is also taught in three parts:

original: don dang dpe dang / dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: don dang dpe dang / dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //
translated: the meaning, the example, and the application of the example to the meaning.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The first is divided into two parts:

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag dang lhan cig 'jug pa bstan pa dang / blo gros yangs pa gal te zhes bya ba man chad kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa lnga po dag dang / lhan cig 'jug pa'i mang nyung bstan pa'o //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag dang lhan cig 'jug pa bstan pa dang / blo gros yangs pa gal te zhes bya ba man chad kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa lnga po dag dang / lhan cig 'jug pa'i mang nyung bstan pa'o //
translated: the explanation of the simultaneous engagement of the appropriating consciousness with the six collections of consciousnesses, and the explanation of the greater and lesser engagement of the mental consciousness with the five sense consciousnesses, from “Bhaiṣajya-rāja, if you think…”

original: de yang dang po ni rtsa ba yan lag la ltos nas lhan cig 'jug pa rnam par 'byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang dang po ni rtsa ba yan lag la ltos nas lhan cig 'jug pa rnam par 'byed pa yin la /
translated: The first is the differentiation of simultaneous engagement in dependence on root and branch.

original: phyi ma ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa lnga po dag la ltos nas lan cig 'jug pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa lnga po dag la ltos nas lan cig 'jug pa bstan pa yin no //
