translated: The latter is taught in terms of the five mental consciousnesses, which occur only once.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa las ni don dang po las brtsams nas lhan cig 'jug pa ston to //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa las ni don dang po las brtsams nas lhan cig 'jug pa ston to //
translated: The Yogācārabhūmi and other treatises teach the simultaneous occurrence of the first type of mental consciousness.

original: @234b 'dir nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi lhan cig 'jug pa bstan pa'i rigs pa las ma bstan pa ni /
analyzed: @234b 'dir nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi lhan cig 'jug pa bstan pa'i rigs pa las ma bstan pa ni /
translated: The second type of mental consciousness, the afflicted mind, is not mentioned in the verse, although it should be.

original: dang po dang tha ma smos pas yid kyi shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir mdor bsdus nas ma bstan te /🔽de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa las /
analyzed: dang po dang tha ma smos pas yid kyi shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir mdor bsdus nas ma bstan te / de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa las /
translated: It is not mentioned because it is included in the first and last terms, and it is summarized in the term “mental consciousness.”

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyang bsdus nas cig car lhan cig 'jug pa ston pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyang bsdus nas cig car lhan cig 'jug pa ston pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Yogācārabhūmi and other treatises teach that the afflicted mind occurs simultaneously with the first type of mental consciousness.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: The first type of mental consciousness is taught in two ways:

original: lhan cig 'jug pa mdor bstan pa dang / gal gyi dbang du mdzad nas bzlas te bshad pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig 'jug pa mdor bstan pa dang / gal gyi dbang du mdzad nas bzlas te bshad pa'o //
translated: a brief presentation and a detailed explanation of the terms.

original: 'di ni dang po mdor bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po mdor bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the brief presentation.

original: 'di ltar len pa'i rnam par shes pas gnas byas pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gong nas gong du 'phel bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar len pa'i rnam par shes pas gnas byas pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gong nas gong du 'phel bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, because the appropriating consciousness serves as the foundation, the six collections of consciousness, such as the eye consciousness, increase and expand.

original: de la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig dang / gzugs kyis rkyen byas nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ste /🔽mig gi rnam par shas pa dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa dus mtshungs pa spyod yul mtshungs pa /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig dang / gzugs kyis rkyen byas nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ste / mig gi rnam par shas pa dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa dus mtshungs pa spyod yul mtshungs pa /
translated: In this regard, the eye consciousness arises conditioned by the eye and form.🔽The mental consciousness that is simultaneous with the eye consciousness, that has the same object, and that is conceptual also ceases.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'gag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa gal gyi rjes su bzlas te bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'gag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa gal gyi rjes su bzlas te bshad pa'o //
translated: The rest is explained by repeating the second line of verse.

original: 'di rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is divided into two parts.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa gdon mi za bar yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'jug par bstan pa dang / gzhan rnam par shes pa bzhi po dag yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa gdon mi za bar yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'jug par bstan pa dang / gzhan rnam par shes pa bzhi po dag yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig par bstan pa'o //
translated: The eye consciousness definitely operates simultaneously with the mental consciousness, and the other four consciousnesses operate simultaneously with the mental consciousness.🔽This is the first.

original: 'di ni dang po ste de la zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos rigs pa'i sgo dang sbyar na don rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste de la zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos rigs pa'i sgo dang sbyar na don rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: In the treatise, the word “here” is connected with the word “reason” and has two meanings.

original: brjod pa gleng bslang ba'i don dang / rnam par bsal nas yongs su bzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: brjod pa gleng bslang ba'i don dang / rnam par bsal nas yongs su bzung ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the introduction of the topic and the meaning of the selection after the analysis.

original: gong du rnam par shes pa lhan cig 'jug pa zhes mdor gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: gong du rnam par shes pa lhan cig 'jug pa zhes mdor gsungs mod kyi /
translated: Although the simultaneous operation of consciousness was mentioned in brief above,

original: da dung lnga po dag ni gdon mi za bar yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten pa yin la /
analyzed: da dung lnga po dag ni gdon mi za bar yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten pa yin la /
translated: the five definitely depend on the mental consciousness,

original: yid ni lnga po dag la brten pa ma yin par rnam par ma phye bas 'dir don de lta bu dag gis gleng bslang ba'i ched du de la zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: yid ni lnga po dag la brten pa ma yin par rnam par ma phye bas 'dir don de lta bu dag gis gleng bslang ba'i ched du de la zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: but the mental consciousness does not depend on the five. Since this was not analyzed, in order to introduce this topic here, the word “here” is used.

original: gzhan yang lhan cig 'jug pa bshad na don mang du yod pa @235a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang lhan cig 'jug pa bshad na don mang du yod pa @235a * //
translated: Moreover, if it is explained that they function together, there are many meanings.

original: las cig car rdzogs par ma bshad de /
analyzed: las cig car rdzogs par ma bshad de /
translated: But it is not explained that they are completed simultaneously.

original: don gzhan rnam par bsal nas don 'di yongs su gsung ba'i phyir yang de la zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: don gzhan rnam par bsal nas don 'di yongs su gsung ba'i phyir yang de la zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Because it is said that this meaning is completely taught after excluding other meanings, it is said “in that regard.”

original: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig ces bya ba ni mig rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig ces bya ba ni mig rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The so-called “eye with consciousness” is twofold:

original: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig ni bstan pa mtshungs pa'i mig ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig ni bstan pa mtshungs pa'i mig ces bya'o //
translated: The eye with consciousness is called the “eye of the same demonstration.”

original: rnam par shes pa med pa'i mig ni de dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med pa'i mig ni de dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The eye without consciousness is called the “eye of the same kind.”

original: de dang mtshungs pa las rnam par phye ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa las rnam par phye ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig ces bya'o //
translated: That which is distinguished from the eye of the same kind is called the “eye with consciousness.”

original: bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa de yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa de yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: The eye of the same demonstration and the eye of the same kind are explained differently in the teachings.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba dag ni khams bco brgyad las brtsams nas bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i don ston pas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba dag ni khams bco brgyad las brtsams nas bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i don ston pas 'di lta ste /
translated: Sarvastivadins assert that the eighteen elements are the basis of reliance, the meaning of which is indicated by the term basis of reliance.🔽

original: khams bco brgyad las las kyi nus pa dang bcas pa ni bsten pa mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad las las kyi nus pa dang bcas pa ni bsten pa mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Sarvastivadins assert that the eighteen elements are the basis of the term similar to that which is possessed and that the term similar to that which is possessed is taught to be the meaning of the term basis of the term similar to that which is possessed.🔽They say: That which possesses the potency of karma is called similar to that which is possessed.

original: las kyi nus pa med pa ni de dang mtshungs pa zhes bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: las kyi nus pa med pa ni de dang mtshungs pa zhes bya'o zhes zer te /
translated: That which does not possess the potency of karma is called similar to that.

original: de'i phyir mdzod kyi bstan bcos las du ni bsten pa mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdzod kyi bstan bcos las du ni bsten pa mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore the treatise Abhidharmakota states:

original: du ni de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How many are similar to that which is possessed?🔽How many are similar to that?

original: tshig le'ur byas pa las /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa las /
translated: The Verses of Vasubandhu say:

original: chos ni rten bcas gzhan rnam gnyis //
analyzed: chos ni rten bcas gzhan rnam gnyis //
translated: One element is possessed and the others are twofold.

original: rang gi las ni mi byed de //
analyzed: rang gi las ni mi byed de //
translated: They do not perform their own function.

original: zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The Autocommentary states:

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las chos kyi khams gcig ni bsten pa mtshungs po kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las chos kyi khams gcig ni bsten pa mtshungs po kho na yin te /
translated: One element is similar to that which is possessed alone.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: That is to say,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi 'dres pa'i sems so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi 'dres pa'i sems so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: it is the uncontaminated mind of aryas.

original: chos kyi khams thams cad ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las kyang chos gang yang dus gsum gyis ma bsdus pa med de /
analyzed: chos kyi khams thams cad ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las kyang chos gang yang dus gsum gyis ma bsdus pa med de /
translated: The great treatise on differentiation explains:🔽There is no phenomenon not included in the three times because all phenomena are objects of mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
translated: However, the seventeen elements are not objects of mental consciousness.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khams bcu bdun po dag yid kyi rnam par shes pas dmigs pa thams cad kyang bsten pa mtshungs pa yin la /
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no // khams bcu bdun po dag yid kyi rnam par shes pas dmigs pa thams cad kyang bsten pa mtshungs pa yin la /
translated: This is extensively explained in the treatise itself.

original: de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa ni med do zhe na /
translated: All objects of mental consciousness are concomitant with mental consciousness, but mental consciousness is not concomitant with any other.

original: smras pa / khams bcu bdun po dag yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten nas @235b bsten pa mi mtshungs par rnam par gzhag pa ma yin gyi so so'i dbang po dang / yul tha dad pa phun tshun ltos pa la brten nas bstan pa yin no //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa / khams bcu bdun po dag yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten nas @235b bsten pa mi mtshungs par rnam par gzhag pa ma yin gyi so so'i dbang po dang / yul tha dad pa phun tshun ltos pa la brten nas bstan pa yin no // 'di lta ste /
translated: The seventeen elements are not established as not being concomitant with mental consciousness in dependence on mental consciousness, but they are taught to be concomitant in dependence on the specific faculties and objects that mutually rely on each other.

original: mig ni gzugs la ltos la /
analyzed: mig ni gzugs la ltos la /
translated: For example, the eye is concomitant with form.

original: gzugs ni mig la ltos pa nas lus ni reg bya la ltos la /
analyzed: gzugs ni mig la ltos pa nas lus ni reg bya la ltos la /
translated: Form depends on the eye up to the body depends on tactility.

original: reg bya ni lus la ltos pa'i bar du'o //🔽gal te de lta na yid kyi khams ni chos kyi khams 'ba' zhig la ltos nas bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i 'gyur ba'i don ni gzhan khams bcu bdun po dag la dmigs pa dag ni bsten pa mtshungs pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /🔽don de lta yin mod kyi /
analyzed: reg bya ni lus la ltos pa'i bar du'o // gal te de lta na yid kyi khams ni chos kyi khams 'ba' zhig la ltos nas bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i 'gyur ba'i don ni gzhan khams bcu bdun po dag la dmigs pa dag ni bsten pa mtshungs pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na / don de lta yin mod kyi /
translated: Tactility depends on the body.🔽If that is so, then the mental element would be homogeneous since it depends on the phenomena element alone, and the establishment of its homogeneity would be meaningless.

original: 'on kyang yid kyi khams yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ni chos thams cad khong du chud cing togs  par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang yid kyi khams yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ni chos thams cad khong du chud cing togs  par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: That meaning is so, but still the mental element and the mental consciousness element are established as homogeneous since they depend on their own activity.

original: rang gi byed pa la brten nas brten pa mtshungs par rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: rang gi byed pa la brten nas brten pa mtshungs par rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Since they comprehend and understand all phenomena, they are established as homogeneous since they depend on their own activity.

original: ji ltar mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dag la mthong ba la sogs pa'i nus pa yod pa nges par de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa mi gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dag la mthong ba la sogs pa'i nus pa yod pa nges par de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa mi gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Just as the eye faculty and so on are ascertained to have the power to see and so on, they are not posited as homogeneous or partially homogeneous.

original: slob dpon gzhan kha cig ni chos kyi khams kyis chos thams cad bsdus pas khams bcu bdun po dag kyang chos zhes bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: slob dpon gzhan kha cig ni chos kyi khams kyis chos thams cad bsdus pas khams bcu bdun po dag kyang chos zhes bya'o zhes zer te /
translated: Some other masters say: Since the element of mental objects includes all phenomena, the seventeen elements are also called mental objects.

original: des de skad du smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: des de skad du smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: But that is not what should be said.

original: chos kyi ming du spyir 'dra yang chos kyi khams tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi ming du spyir 'dra yang chos kyi khams tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: Although the names of phenomena are generally similar, the element of mental objects is distinct.

original: des na sngar bstan pa nyid shin tu rigs pa dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: des na sngar bstan pa nyid shin tu rigs pa dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: Therefore the earlier explanation is most reasonable.

original: 'di ltar khams bcu bdun po gzhan dag la yang bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa yod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar khams bcu bdun po gzhan dag la yang bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa yod de /
translated: The other seventeen elements also have homogeneous and partially homogeneous states.

original: bsten pa mtshungs pa dang de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bsten pa mtshungs pa dang de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are homogeneous and partially homogeneous states?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: rang gi las la gnas shing rang gi las byed pa ni bsten pa mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi las la gnas shing rang gi las byed pa ni bsten pa mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The eye that is engaged in its own activity and is engaged in its own object field is said to be engaged in its own activity.

original: rang gi las mi byed pa ni de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi las mi byed pa ni de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The eye that is not engaged in its own activity is said to be not engaged in its own activity.🔽The eye element sees,

original: de la mig gi khams kyis mthong ba'am /
analyzed: de la mig gi khams kyis mthong ba'am /
translated: or it sees, or it will see, or it is obstructed from seeing, or it is not obstructed from seeing.🔽The eye that is engaged in its own activity is said to be engaged in its own activity.

original: lta ba'am / lta bar 'gyur ba ni bsten pa mtshungs pa'i mig ces bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba'am / lta bar 'gyur ba ni bsten pa mtshungs pa'i mig ces bya'o //
translated: The eye that is not engaged in its own activity is said to be not engaged in its own activity.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi khams kyi bar du re re la yang rang gi khams la rang gi las rgya cher rnam par bshad @236a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi khams kyi bar du re re la yang rang gi khams la rang gi las rgya cher rnam par bshad @236a * //
translated: The same should be extensively explained for each element up to the mind element.

original: par bya'o // kha che'i bye brag tu smra ba dag ni de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i mig ni rnam pa bzhi kho na ste /🔽gzugs rnams ma mthong bar 'gags pa'am /
analyzed: par bya'o // kha che'i bye brag tu smra ba dag ni de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i mig ni rnam pa bzhi kho na ste / gzugs rnams ma mthong bar 'gags pa'am /
translated: Kashmiri Vaibhasikas assert that the eye that is engaged in its own activity is of four types:🔽the eye that has not seen form,

original: 'gag par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'gag par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: the eye that is ceasing without seeing form,🔽the eye that is obstructed from seeing form,

original: mi skye ba'i chos can no zhes ston to //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos can no zhes ston to //
translated: and the eye that is not obstructed from seeing form.

original: nub phyogs pa'i slob dpon kha cig ni rnam pa lnga'o zhes 'chad de /
analyzed: nub phyogs pa'i slob dpon kha cig ni rnam pa lnga'o zhes 'chad de /
translated: Some masters of the west explain that there are five types,

original: mi skye ba'i chos can la rnam pa gnyis su phye na /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos can la rnam pa gnyis su phye na /
translated: because the eye that is obstructed from seeing form is divided into two.

original: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa dang rtogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa med par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa dang rtogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa med par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: and the understanding of the realm of consciousness and the understanding of the realm of non-consciousness.

original: lus kyi khams kyi bar du yang rig par bya'o //🔽de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni mi skye ba'i chos can kho na'o zhe'o //
analyzed: lus kyi khams kyi bar du yang rig par bya'o // de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni mi skye ba'i chos can kho na'o zhe'o //
translated: The same should be understood up to the realm of touch.🔽The realm of form that is similar to the realm of eye-consciousness is only the realm of form that is not born.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyang mig gis mthong ba'am lta bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni bsten pa mtshungs pa'i gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyang mig gis mthong ba'am lta bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni bsten pa mtshungs pa'i gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: The realm of form that is similar to the realm of eye-consciousness is the realm of form that is seen by the eye or will be seen.

original: de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i gzugs ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i gzugs ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The realm of form that is similar to the realm of eye-consciousness is of four kinds:

original: yid kyi khams kyi bar du yang so so'i dbang po la ltos nas rang gi las byed mi byed pa la bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa bstan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi khams kyi bar du yang so so'i dbang po la ltos nas rang gi las byed mi byed pa la bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa bstan par shes par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood up to the realm of mind.

original: gal te mig gi dngos po gcig la dmigs na yang bsten pa mtshungs pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: gal te mig gi dngos po gcig la dmigs na yang bsten pa mtshungs pa zhes bya la /
translated: If the eye focuses on one thing, it is called similar to the realm of eye-consciousness.

original: gzhan thams cad la dmigs na yang bsten pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan thams cad la dmigs na yang bsten pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When it is directed to all other objects, it is called “having a similar support.

original: de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: ” The eye sense faculty that is the support of the first is also the support of the second.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi khams kyi bar du rgya cher bshad pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi khams kyi bar du rgya cher bshad pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The same should be understood for the other sense faculties up to the mind sense faculty.

original: bstan bcos sems sna tshogs bstan pa las kyang de skad du ston to //
analyzed: bstan bcos sems sna tshogs bstan pa las kyang de skad du ston to //
translated: The treatise Teaching the Classifications of Minds also explains this.

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las na rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las na rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: The Great Exegesis explains three types of eye sense faculty:

original: slob dpon dang po'i bshad pa ni mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba dang mthun no //🔽kha cig ni 'di skad du gzugs rnams lta ba'i mig kyang sems can bdag nyid la ni bsten pa mtshungs pa'i mig ces bya la /
analyzed: slob dpon dang po'i bshad pa ni mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba dang mthun no // kha cig ni 'di skad du gzugs rnams lta ba'i mig kyang sems can bdag nyid la ni bsten pa mtshungs pa'i mig ces bya la /
translated: The first master’s explanation accords with the Treasury of Abhidharma.🔽Some say: The eye that sees forms in one’s own continuum is called “the eye that has a similar support.

original: sems can gzhan dag la ni de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i mig ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag la ni de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i mig ces bya'o //
translated: ” The eye that sees forms in the continuum of another is called “the eye that has a dissimilar support.”

original: gzugs rnams mi lta ba'i mig kyang sems can bdag nyid la ni de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i mig ces bya la /🔽sems @236b can gzhan dag la yang de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i mig ces bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnams mi lta ba'i mig kyang sems can bdag nyid la ni de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i mig ces bya la / sems @236b can gzhan dag la yang de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i mig ces bya'o zhe'o //
translated: The eye that does not see forms is the eye that is equal to the self of sentient beings.🔽The eye that is equal to the self of sentient beings is also the eye that is equal to the self of other sentient beings.

original: yang kha cig ni 'di skad du gzugs rnams lta ba'i mig kyang sems can bdag nyid la ni bsten pa mtshungs pa'i mig ces bya la /🔽sems can gzhan dag la ni bsten pa mtshungs pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: yang kha cig ni 'di skad du gzugs rnams lta ba'i mig kyang sems can bdag nyid la ni bsten pa mtshungs pa'i mig ces bya la / sems can gzhan dag la ni bsten pa mtshungs pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Some say: The eye that sees forms is the eye that is equal to the self of sentient beings.🔽It is not equal to the self of other sentient beings.

original: de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not equal to the self of other sentient beings.

original: gzugs rnams la mi lta ba'i mig kyang sems can bdag nyid la de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i mig ces bya la /🔽sems can gzhan dag la ni bsten pa mtshungs pa'i mig kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: gzugs rnams la mi lta ba'i mig kyang sems can bdag nyid la de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i mig ces bya la / sems can gzhan dag la ni bsten pa mtshungs pa'i mig kyang ma yin la /
translated: The eye that does not see forms is the eye that is equal to the self of sentient beings.🔽It is not the eye that is equal to the self of other sentient beings.

original: de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa yang ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa yang ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: It is not the eye that is equal to the self of other sentient beings.

original: de de skad du smra bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de de skad du smra bar mi bya ste /
translated: You should not say that.

original: ji ltar mig dang bcas pa bzhin du bsten pa mtshungs pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar mig dang bcas pa bzhin du bsten pa mtshungs pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not the same as relying on someone with eyes.

original: de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa yang ma yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa yang ma yin par 'gyur la /
translated: It is not similar support like that of the eyes and it is not similar support of that.

original: de 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be stated thus:

original: bshad pa rnam pa gsum las bshad pa dang po ni rigs pa dang mthun pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bshad pa rnam pa gsum las bshad pa dang po ni rigs pa dang mthun pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: From among the three explanations, the first explanation is logical.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is extensively taught in the Abhidharmakośa.

original: gzhan yang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las mig ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir /🔽rgyun gcig la brten nas bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa rnam par gzhag pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las mig ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir / rgyun gcig la brten nas bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa rnam par gzhag pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, the treatise on the Abhidharmakośa explains:🔽Because the eyes are not shared, similar support and the similar support of that are posited in dependence on a single continuum.

original: gzugs ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rgyun mang po la brten nas bsten pa mtshungs pa dang de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rgyun mang po la brten nas bsten pa mtshungs pa dang de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: Because form is not shared, similar support and the similar support of that are posited in dependence on many continua.

original: gzugs kyi khams la ji lta ba bzhin du sgra dang dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i khams la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams la ji lta ba bzhin du sgra dang dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i khams la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the elements of sound, smell, taste and touch as it does to the element of form.🔽If sound were like form, then the three elements of smell, taste and touch would not be grasped by the sense faculties, because they are not shared.🔽The three elements of smell, taste and touch are grasped by the sense faculties, because they are not shared.🔽The three elements of smell, taste and touch are grasped by the sense faculties, because they are not shared.🔽The three elements of smell, taste and touch are grasped by the sense faculties, because they are not shared.

original: sgra ni gzugs ji lta ba bzhin du rung na dri dang ro dang reg bya gsum ni dbang po dang phrad par gyur pa na gdod len pas thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir gcig len gyi gzhan ni ma yin pas mig la sogs pa bzhin du bshad pa🔽ni rigs kyi gzugs ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bshad pa ni mi rigs so zhe na /🔽de lta bu'i rigs pa yod kyang thun mong ba'i don yang yod de /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: bstan bcos sems sna tshogs bstan pa las kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos sems sna tshogs bstan pa las kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: The treatise Teaching the Mind also says:

original: mig gis gzugs la lta ba ni cha dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: mig gis gzugs la lta ba ni cha dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: When the eye sees forms, it is with a part.

original: gzugs la mi lta ba ni gzhan gyi cha dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la mi lta ba ni gzhan gyi cha dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: When it does not see forms, it is with another part.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la mig gis lta ba ni cha dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la mig gis lta ba ni cha dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: Thus, when the eye sees forms, it is with a part.

original: mi lta ba ni gzhan gyi cha dang bcas pa yin pas so //
analyzed: mi lta ba ni gzhan gyi cha dang bcas pa yin pas so //
translated: When it does not see forms, it is with another part.

original: de la bye brag ni gal te mig gcig gi cha dang bcas pa yin na gzhan thams cad kyang cha dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: de la bye brag ni gal te mig gcig gi cha dang bcas pa yin na gzhan thams cad kyang cha dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: In this regard, if one part of the eye sees, all the other parts also see.

original: gal te gcig gzhan gyi cha dang bcas pa yin na gzhan thams cad kyang gzhan gyi cha dang bcas pa gzugs la lta ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te gcig gzhan gyi cha dang bcas pa yin na gzhan thams cad kyang gzhan gyi cha dang bcas pa gzugs la lta ba yin no //
translated: If one part does not see, all the other parts also do not see.

original: lta ba cha dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi ma yin te /
analyzed: lta ba cha dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi ma yin te /
translated: That which sees with a part is not the other parts, such as the ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Sound, smell, taste, and touch are also like that.

original: don dam par ni mig bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni mig bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: But ultimately, they are like the eye.

original: kun rdzob kyi grangs ni gzugs bzhin du bshad par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi grangs ni gzugs bzhin du bshad par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The conventional is like the form base.🔽The great treatise on differentiation states:

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni 'di ltar sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i khams kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni 'di ltar sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i khams kyang de bzhin te /
translated: The sound, smell, taste, and tangible-object elements are also like that,

original: bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are similar in terms of the basis of reliance, the basis of reliance of that, and the aspect.

original: don 'di yang na kha cig so so rang gi lus la yod pa'i dri dang ro dang reg bya ba snam pa dang myang ba dang bye brag phyed par bya ba'i phyir de dag de skad du bshad de /
analyzed: don 'di yang na kha cig so so rang gi lus la yod pa'i dri dang ro dang reg bya ba snam pa dang myang ba dang bye brag phyed par bya ba'i phyir de dag de skad du bshad de /
translated: Or, some say that smell, taste, and tangible objects that exist in one’s own body are explained in that way in order to distinguish them from those that are smelled, tasted, and touched.

original: dri dang ro dang / reg bya'i khams kyang kun rdzob kyi dbang du na ni gzugs kyi khams bzhin du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: dri dang ro dang / reg bya'i khams kyang kun rdzob kyi dbang du na ni gzugs kyi khams bzhin du bshad par bya ste /
translated: The smell, taste, and tangible-object elements are like the form element in terms of the conventional,

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa rnams 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa rnams 'di skad du /
translated: because worldly beings say:

original: ji ltar khyod kyis dri gang bsnams pa de ni bdag cag gis kyang bsnams so //🔽khyod kyis ro gang myangs pa de ni bdag cag gis kyang myangs so //
analyzed: ji ltar khyod kyis dri gang bsnams pa de ni bdag cag gis kyang bsnams so // khyod kyis ro gang myangs pa de ni bdag cag gis kyang myangs so //
translated: Just as you smell a smell, we also smell that smell.🔽Just as you taste a taste, we also taste that taste.

original: khyod kyis reg bya gang bye brag phyed pa de ni bdag cag gis kyang bye brag phyed do zhes zer bas so //
analyzed: khyod kyis reg bya gang bye brag phyed pa de ni bdag cag gis kyang bye brag phyed do zhes zer bas so //
translated: Just as you feel a tangible object, we also feel that tangible object.

original: don dam pa'i dbang du byas na dri dang ro dang / reg bya'i khams ni mig gi khams bzhin du bshad @237b par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i dbang du byas na dri dang ro dang / reg bya'i khams ni mig gi khams bzhin du bshad @237b par bya ste /
translated: In terms of the ultimate, the elements of smell, taste, and tactility should be explained like the element of the eye.

original: 'di ltar sems can gcig gis gang bsnams pa'i dri'i khams gzhan gyis bsnam par mi nus pa dang / sems can gcig gis gang myangs pa'i ro'i khams gzhan gyis myang bar mi nus pa dang / sems can gcig gis bye brag phyed pa'i reg bya'i khams gzhan gyis bye brag phyed par mi nus pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can gcig gis gang bsnams pa'i dri'i khams gzhan gyis bsnam par mi nus pa dang / sems can gcig gis gang myangs pa'i ro'i khams gzhan gyis myang bar mi nus pa dang / sems can gcig gis bye brag phyed pa'i reg bya'i khams gzhan gyis bye brag phyed par mi nus pas so //
translated: This is because another sentient being cannot smell the element of smell that one sentient being smells, another sentient being cannot taste the element of taste that one sentient being tastes, and another sentient being cannot feel the element of tactility that one sentient being feels.

original: reg bya'i khams gcig la sems can gnyis kyi lus phyogs so so nas 'dug pas thun mong du reg par gyur pa de don dam par gzugs kyi khams bzhin du bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: reg bya'i khams gcig la sems can gnyis kyi lus phyogs so so nas 'dug pas thun mong du reg par gyur pa de don dam par gzugs kyi khams bzhin du bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na smras pa /
translated: Don't you explain the single tangible object element to be ultimate, since the bodies of two sentient beings are situated in different directions and they come to have contact in common?

original: 'di ltar reg bya'i khams rdul phra rab tsam mang po gcig tu bsdus pa la lus gnyis reg par gyur pa so so nas phyogs gcig thob pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar reg bya'i khams rdul phra rab tsam mang po gcig tu bsdus pa la lus gnyis reg par gyur pa so so nas phyogs gcig thob pa yin gyi /
translated: It is said that many subtle particles of the tangible object element are gathered into one and the two bodies come to have contact, each obtaining a part.

original: thun mong du thog pa med pa'i phyir don dam par mig gi khams bzhin du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: thun mong du thog pa med pa'i phyir don dam par mig gi khams bzhin du bshad par bya ste /
translated: But since they do not obtain it in common, it should be explained to be ultimate, like the eye element.

original: dri dang ro'i khams gnyis kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dri dang ro'i khams gnyis kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The two elements of smell and taste should be understood in the same way.

original: gzhan kha cig ni pha rol dang sems can ma yin pa rnams kyi dri dang reg bya bsnam pa dang / myang ba dang / bye brag phyed pa spyad zin pa dang / yongs su spyad pa'i dus gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob kyi dbang du byas nas gzugs kyi khams bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan kha cig ni pha rol dang sems can ma yin pa rnams kyi dri dang reg bya bsnam pa dang / myang ba dang / bye brag phyed pa spyad zin pa dang / yongs su spyad pa'i dus gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob kyi dbang du byas nas gzugs kyi khams bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: They are explained as the form element from the perspective of the conventional truth.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa rnams thun mong du thob pa yin no zhes zer ba'i phyir ni don dam pa'i dbang du byas nas mig gi khams bzhin du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa rnams thun mong du thob pa yin no zhes zer ba'i phyir ni don dam pa'i dbang du byas nas mig gi khams bzhin du bshad par bya ste /
translated: They are explained as the form element from the perspective of the ultimate truth, like the eye element, because they are obtained in common by the world.

original: gcig gis yongs su spyad pa gzhan gyis mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gis yongs su spyad pa gzhan gyis mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who enjoys them is not seen by another.

original: yongs su spyad zin pa'i dri dang / ro dang reg bya'i khams gang yin pa de ni don dam pa la brten nas gzugs kyi khams bzhin du bshad na mi rung ba med de /
analyzed: yongs su spyad zin pa'i dri dang / ro dang reg bya'i khams gang yin pa de ni don dam pa la brten nas gzugs kyi khams bzhin du bshad na mi rung ba med de /
translated: The elements of odor, taste and tactility that are enjoyed are not suitable to be explained as the form element from the perspective of the ultimate truth.

original: don de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: ma 'ongs pa na yod pa dang / da ltar gyi dus su 'jug cing mang po la sogs pas thun mong du thob pa'i don gyi phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na yod pa dang / da ltar gyi dus su 'jug cing mang po la sogs pas thun mong du thob pa'i don gyi phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because it exists in the future, and because it is obtained in common by many, etc.

original: de la don snga ma dang sbyar na ni 'di skad du dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khams ni kun rdzob kyi don la brten nas ni gzugs kyi khams bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de la don snga ma dang sbyar na ni 'di skad du dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khams ni kun rdzob kyi don la brten nas ni gzugs kyi khams bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: If one applies the first meaning, one should say: the elements of smell, taste, and touch are to be explained like the element of form, in dependence on the conventional meaning.

original: don dam pa'i don la brten nas ni mig gi khams bzhin du bshad par @238a * //🔽bya'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i don la brten nas ni mig gi khams bzhin du bshad par @238a * // bya'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: In dependence on the ultimate meaning, they are to be explained like the element of eye.

original: don phyi ma dang sbyar na ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: don phyi ma dang sbyar na ni 'di skad du /
translated: If one applies the second meaning, one should say:

original: dri dang ro dang / reg bya'i khams yongs su spyad zin pa gang yin pa dang / yongs su spyad pa'i dus gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob kyi don la brten nas gzugs kyi khams bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dri dang ro dang / reg bya'i khams yongs su spyad zin pa gang yin pa dang / yongs su spyad pa'i dus gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob kyi don la brten nas gzugs kyi khams bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: the elements of smell, taste, and touch that have been used up, and the time when they are used, are to be explained like the element of form, in dependence on the conventional meaning.

original: don dam pa'i don la brten nas ni mig gi khams bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i don la brten nas ni mig gi khams bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: In dependence on the ultimate meaning, they are to be explained like the element of eye.

original: yongs su ma spyad pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa'i don la brten nas gzugs kyi khams bzhin du bshad par bya'o zhes bshad na yang 'di mi rung ba med do zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su ma spyad pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa'i don la brten nas gzugs kyi khams bzhin du bshad par bya'o zhes bshad na yang 'di mi rung ba med do zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the term “not fully engaged” should be explained in the same way as the meaning of the term “form realm,” based on the ultimate meaning.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos kun las kyang de skad bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos kun las kyang de skad bstan to //
translated: Therefore, this is how it is taught in all the treatises.

original: gzugs kyi khams ji lta ba bzhin du sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ji lta ba bzhin du sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as the form realm is explained, so too are the realms of sound, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: 'di ltar dri dang ro dang reg bya ni thun mong du dmigs pa'i phyir dang / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa ni skye ba dang / mi skye ba'i chos can gyi phyir yid kyi khams bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dri dang ro dang reg bya ni thun mong du dmigs pa'i phyir dang / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa ni skye ba dang / mi skye ba'i chos can gyi phyir yid kyi khams bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: Smell, taste, and tactility are explained in the same way as the form realm because they are commonly observed, they are the similar supports of the six consciousnesses beginning with the eye consciousness, and they are the similar supports of the mind element.

original: da ni bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i nges pa'i tshig bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i nges pa'i tshig bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the etymologies of “similar support” and “similarly supported” will be explained.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos ni don rnam pa gsum mo zhes bshad de /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos ni don rnam pa gsum mo zhes bshad de /
translated: The treatise of the Abhidharmakośa has three topics.🔽Therefore, the same text states:

original: de'i phyir de nyid las bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is similar contact? What is the meaning of similar contact?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum phan tshun 'dus shing 'dres par gyur pa'i phyir cha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum phan tshun 'dus shing 'dres par gyur pa'i phyir cha zhes bya'o //
translated: The three—the faculty, the object, and the consciousness—are mutually combined and mixed, and therefore it is called “part.”

original: yang na cha zhes bya ba ni las byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na cha zhes bya ba ni las byed pa'o //
translated: Or, “part” means “function.”

original: gzhan yang cha zhes bya ba ni reg bya mtshungs par skyes pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang cha zhes bya ba ni reg bya mtshungs par skyes pa las /
translated: Moreover, “part” means that contact arises equally.

original: cha 'di yod pa'i phyir bsten pa mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: cha 'di yod pa'i phyir bsten pa mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because this part exists, it is called “similar contact.”

original: 'di las bzlog pa ni de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di las bzlog pa ni de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The opposite of this is called “dissimilar contact.”

original: bsten pa mtshungs pa ma yin pa de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / rnam pa mi mtshungs pas de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bsten pa mtshungs pa ma yin pa de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / rnam pa mi mtshungs pas de'i bsten pa mtshungs pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Dissimilar contact is called “similar contact” because it is dissimilar in aspect.

original: yang dag pa'i rigs pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rigs pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: Correct reasoning also explains in agreement with this.🔽The treatise Teaching the Aggregates explains:

original: bstan bcos sems sna @238b tshogs bstan pa las cha dang bcas pa las gzhan gyi cha dang bcas pa la don ci yod ce na /
analyzed: bstan bcos sems sna @238b tshogs bstan pa las cha dang bcas pa las gzhan gyi cha dang bcas pa la don ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the meaning of “possessing a part” other than “possessing a whole”?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / cha dang bcas pa'i dus rdzogs pa ni cha dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / cha dang bcas pa'i dus rdzogs pa ni cha dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The time when a part possesses a whole is called “possessing a part.”

original: mig gi khams rnam pa gnyis po las dang bcas pa dang / las med pa de dag las kyi cha dang bcas pa zhig gam /
analyzed: mig gi khams rnam pa gnyis po las dang bcas pa dang / las med pa de dag las kyi cha dang bcas pa zhig gam /
translated: From among the two types of eye element, that which possesses action and that which does not possess action, does it possess the part of action?

original: 'on te las kyi med pa'i cha dang bcas pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'on te las kyi med pa'i cha dang bcas pa zhig ce na /
translated: Or does it possess the part that is not action?🔽It is said:

original: cha dang bcas pa de las med pa yang yod /
analyzed: cha dang bcas pa de las med pa yang yod /
translated: There is that which possesses a part that is not action.

original: las kyi cha dang bcas pa yang yod /🔽cha dang bcas pa cha gnyi ga dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: las kyi cha dang bcas pa yang yod / cha dang bcas pa cha gnyi ga dang ldan zhing /
translated: There is that which possesses the part of action.🔽There is that which possesses a part that possesses both parts.

original: cha dang bcas par phan tshun bsten pa yod par 'chad pa yang yod do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: cha dang bcas par phan tshun bsten pa yod par 'chad pa yang yod do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: There is that which possesses a part that mutually relies on a part.

original: mdo sde pa dag ji ltar 'dod pa ni da dung gzhung yang dag pa nyid mthong ste /
analyzed: mdo sde pa dag ji ltar 'dod pa ni da dung gzhung yang dag pa nyid mthong ste /
translated: The Sautrāntikas say: We have not yet seen the correct treatise.

original: theg pa chen po pa dag dang mthun par 'dod par bshad pa dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po pa dag dang mthun par 'dod par bshad pa dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction with the explanation that they are asserted to be in accord with the Mahāyāna.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na bstan bcos rnams so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na bstan bcos rnams so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: If this is applied to the Mahāyāna teaching, the explanations in the treatises are not in accord.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i phung po lnga'i rab tu byed pa las ni nang gi skye mched lnga la brten nas bsten pa mtshungs pa'i don ston te /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i phung po lnga'i rab tu byed pa las ni nang gi skye mched lnga la brten nas bsten pa mtshungs pa'i don ston te /
translated: Vasubandhu’s Discussion of the Five Skandhas teaches that the meaning of similar reliance is based on the five internal sense bases.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las bsten pa mtshungs pa du zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las bsten pa mtshungs pa du zhe na /
translated: Therefore that text says, “How many are similar reliance?

original: nang gi gzugs can lnga ste rang gi rnam par shes pa dag yul thun mong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi gzugs can lnga ste rang gi rnam par shes pa dag yul thun mong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The five internal physical sense bases because their consciousnesses have a common object.”

original: de dang mtshungs pa du zhe na /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa du zhe na /
translated: How many are similar to that?

original: de dag nyid rang gi rnam par shes pas stong pa ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid rang gi rnam par shes pas stong pa ste /
translated: Those same five internal physical sense bases are empty of their own consciousnesses.

original: rang gi rigs pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rang gi rigs pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because they are similar to their own type.”

original: de la bsten pa mtshungs pa ni yul mtshungs pa nyid kyi don gyi phyir bsten pa mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsten pa mtshungs pa ni yul mtshungs pa nyid kyi don gyi phyir bsten pa mtshungs pa'o //
translated: Similar reliance means that the object is the same.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa kun las btus pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las kyang phung po lnga'i rab tu byed pa las bstan pa dang don mthun par 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa kun las btus pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las kyang phung po lnga'i rab tu byed pa las bstan pa dang don mthun par 'byung ste /
translated: The Abhidharmasamuccaya and the Abhidharmasamuccayabhāṣya explain the five aggregates in a way that is consistent with the explanation in the Compendium of Abhidharma.

original: de'i phyir chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las ji ltar na bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las ji ltar na bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the Compendium of Abhidharma says, “How are they similar reliance and similar to that?🔽How many are similar reliance and similar to that?

original: bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa ni du zhig / ci'i phyir bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de dang mtshungs par rtag ce na /
analyzed: bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa ni du zhig / ci'i phyir bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de dang mtshungs par rtag ce na /
translated: For what purpose are similar reliance and similar to that investigated?

original: rnam par shes pa dang ma bral zhing de dang @239a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ma bral zhing de dang @239a * //
translated: They are similar reliance and similar to that because they are not separate from consciousness and they are similar to that because they are similar to the form aggregate.

original: 'dra ba'i dbang po yul la rgyun du 'byung ba'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral zhing rang dang 'dra ba rgyun du 'byung ba'i phyir yang bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de dang mtshungs par blta'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i dbang po yul la rgyun du 'byung ba'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral zhing rang dang 'dra ba rgyun du 'byung ba'i phyir yang bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de dang mtshungs par blta'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because the similar sense faculty arises continuously in relation to the object and because it arises continuously as similar to itself, it is similar in terms of support.

original: de la dang po bstan pha mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la dang po bstan pha mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: The first is similar in terms of support.

original: dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gnyi ga 'dra zhing yul rnams la /
analyzed: dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gnyi ga 'dra zhing yul rnams la /
translated: Both the sense faculty and consciousness are similar and arise continuously in relation to objects.

original: rgyun du skye ba'i phyir dbang po dang rnam par shes pa 'dra bar 'jug pa'i don la bsten pa mtshungs pa'i zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rgyun du skye ba'i phyir dbang po dang rnam par shes pa 'dra bar 'jug pa'i don la bsten pa mtshungs pa'i zhes bshad do //
translated: The meaning of similar engagement of the sense faculty and consciousness is explained as similar in terms of support.

original: gnyis pa ni de dang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni de dang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: The second is similar to that.

original: dbang po rnams rnam par shes pa dang bral zhing rang 'dra ba'i rnam pa rgyun du skye ba'i phyir dbang po rnam par shes pa dang phrad par ma gyur kyang rang gi bdag nyid dbang po dang 'dra ba'i rnam pa rgyun du skye zhing dbang po dang 'dra
analyzed: dbang po rnams rnam par shes pa dang bral zhing rang 'dra ba'i rnam pa rgyun du skye ba'i phyir dbang po rnam par shes pa dang phrad par ma gyur kyang rang gi bdag nyid dbang po dang 'dra ba'i rnam pa rgyun du skye zhing dbang po dang 'dra
translated: Even though they are not in contact with the consciousnesses, they are generated in a continuum that is similar to the faculties, since they are similar to the faculties in their own nature.

original: ba'i don la de dang mtshungs pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: ba'i don la de dang mtshungs pa zhes bshad de /
translated: They are similar to the faculties in their object, and they are explained as being similar to them.

original: de yang gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / gzugs can gyi khams dang / skye mched lnga'i phyogs gcig ni bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / gzugs can gyi khams dang / skye mched lnga'i phyogs gcig ni bsten pa mtshungs pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Also, one part of the form aggregate, one part of the five elements with form, and one part of the five sense bases are similar to the faculties and are similar to them.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang nang gi skyed mched lnga la brten nas ston to //🔽de'i phyir de nyid las khams bco brgyad po de dag las du ni mtshungs pa yin /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang nang gi skyed mched lnga la brten nas ston to // de'i phyir de nyid las khams bco brgyad po de dag las du ni mtshungs pa yin /
translated: The Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra also teaches that the five internal sense bases are similar to the faculties.🔽Therefore that text says,

original: du ni de dang mtshungs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni de dang mtshungs pa yin zhe na /
translated: “From among the eighteen elements, how many are similar and how many are similar to them?”

original: smras pa / mig gi khams rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa ni mtshungs pa yin no /
analyzed: smras pa / mig gi khams rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa ni mtshungs pa yin no /
translated: He says: The eye element is homogeneous when it is associated with consciousness.

original: de las gzhan pa ni de dag dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni de dag dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: The others are homogeneous when they are not associated with consciousness.

original: mig gi khams la ji lta ba bzhin du lus kyi khams kyi bar du yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gi khams la ji lta ba bzhin du lus kyi khams kyi bar du yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true for the body element.

original: mtshungs pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa gang yin pa de ni dbang pos zin pa'i nang gis khams rnams las bsam pa yin gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi dag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa gang yin pa de ni dbang pos zin pa'i nang gis khams rnams las bsam pa yin gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi dag la ni ma yin no //
translated: The homogeneous and the similar are considered to be the internal elements that are conjoined with faculties, not the external elements such as form.

original: chos kyi khams dmigs pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi khams ngang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi khams dmigs pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi khams ngang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The element of mental objects that has an object should be viewed as being similar to the elements of consciousness.

original: dmigs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: That which has no object is similar to form and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i rna ba la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i rna ba la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the ear and so on when they are associated with consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam @239b rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba na gdon mi za bar rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dus gcig tu rjes su 'jug🔽cing yul gcig la dmigs par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam @239b rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba na gdon mi za bar rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dus gcig tu rjes su 'jug cing yul gcig la dmigs par bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase “that which occurs together with the ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses” indicates that when the ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses arise, the conceptual mind consciousness necessarily occurs simultaneously with them and has the same object.

original: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / sgra dang dri dang / ro dang reg bya dag gis rkyen byas nas /🔽rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / sgra dang dri dang / ro dang reg bya dag gis rkyen byas nas / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye ste /
translated: The phrase “having taken as its object the sound, smell, taste, and tangible-object that are the conditions for the arising of the ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses” indicates that the mind consciousness has the same object as the ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa dus mtshungs pa /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa dus mtshungs pa /
translated: The phrase “that which occurs together with the ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses” indicates that when the ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses arise, the conceptual mind consciousness necessarily occurs simultaneously with them and has the same object.

original: spyod yul mtshungs pa rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yang 'jug go zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gzhan rnam par shes pa bzhi po dag yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: spyod yul mtshungs pa rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yang 'jug go zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gzhan rnam par shes pa bzhi po dag yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig par bshad pa ste /
translated: The second is the entry of the conceptual mental consciousness, which is the four other consciousnesses that are explained as being simultaneous with the mental consciousness.

original: gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as above.

original: blo gros yangs pa gal te de'i tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig kho na 'jug na ni /🔽de'i dus su rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang gcig kho na mig gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug ces bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam pa lnga po dag lhan cig
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa gal te de'i tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig kho na 'jug na ni / de'i dus su rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang gcig kho na mig gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug ces bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam pa lnga po dag lhan cig
translated: Bhaiṣajya-rāja, if at that time only one eye consciousness were to engage,🔽then at that time the conceptual mental consciousness would also engage in just one eye consciousness.

original: 'jug pa'i mang nyung rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i mang nyung rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
translated: From here on, the second part is the explanation of the differentiation of the many and few simultaneous engagements of the five types of mental consciousness.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bsten te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bsten te /
translated: This is also explained in two parts.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa bstan pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi 'am lnga dang lhan cig 'jug pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa bstan pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi 'am lnga dang lhan cig 'jug pa bstan pa'o //
translated: and the explanation of the mental consciousness operating simultaneously with two, three, four, or five of the eye consciousnesses, etc.

original: 'di ni dang po yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the first explanation of the mental consciousness operating simultaneously with the eye consciousness.

original: dmigs pa gcig la mthun par gyur pa'i phyir ro //🔽gal te de'i tshe rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi 'am lnga char 'jug pa na yang de'i dus su rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig kho na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug
analyzed: dmigs pa gcig la mthun par gyur pa'i phyir ro // gal te de'i tshe rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi 'am lnga char 'jug pa na yang de'i dus su rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig kho na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug
translated: Because they are in agreement with regard to the same object.🔽If at that time two, three, four, or five of the groups of consciousness operate, then at that time the conceptual mental consciousness alone operates simultaneously with the five groups of consciousness.

original: @240a * // pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: @240a * // pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the explanation of the mental consciousness operating simultaneously with two, three, four, or five of the eye consciousnesses, etc.

original: gnyis pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dag lhan cig 'jug pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dag lhan cig 'jug pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The second is the teaching that mental consciousness and eye consciousness, etc.🔽occur simultaneously.🔽The number of mental consciousnesses is not fixed, because they occur simultaneously with eye consciousness, etc.

original: dmigs par bya ba'i yul mang nyung gi rjes su yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / lhan cig 'jug pas grangs kyi mang nyung ni nges pa med do //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i yul mang nyung gi rjes su yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / lhan cig 'jug pas grangs kyi mang nyung ni nges pa med do //
translated: in accordance with the number of perceived objects.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes 'byung /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes 'byung /
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning speaks of a non-conceptual mental consciousness.

original: tshig nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las ni rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: tshig nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las ni rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The Sutra Definitely Elucidating the Noble Intention speaks of a conceptual mental consciousness.

original: dpe 'di dang mthun pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa zhes 'byung ba ni ma nor ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dpe 'di dang mthun pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa zhes 'byung ba ni ma nor ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: You should understand that the occurrence of the term conceptual is unmistaken, because it is consistent with this example.

original: blo gros yangs pa dper na chu'i klung chen po 'bab pa la gal te rlabs gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na rlabs kyang gcig kho na 'byung zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa dpe smos nas rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa dper na chu'i klung chen po 'bab pa la gal te rlabs gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na rlabs kyang gcig kho na 'byung zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa dpe smos nas rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the second part, the explanation by means of an example.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste //
translated: This is also divided into two parts:

original: chu'i rlabs mang nyung gi dpe dang / me long gi gzugs brnyan mang nyung gi dpe'o //
analyzed: chu'i rlabs mang nyung gi dpe dang / me long gi gzugs brnyan mang nyung gi dpe'o //
translated: the example of the many waves in the water, and the example of the many reflections in a mirror.

original: dpe snga phyi gnyis bye brag tu gyur pa yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: dpe snga phyi gnyis bye brag tu gyur pa yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: The two examples, the former and the latter, are different, and the explanations are also different.

original: kha cig na re dpe rnam pa gnyis gsungs pa'i dgongs pa ni so so nas tha dad de /
analyzed: kha cig na re dpe rnam pa gnyis gsungs pa'i dgongs pa ni so so nas tha dad de /
translated: Some say that the intention of teaching the two examples is different.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las /
translated: In the commentary of the master Satyadvaya,

original: ji skad du chu rlabs 'byung ba ni rnam par shes pa drug po dag rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / skye 'gag mtshungs pa'i don gyi dpe bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du chu rlabs 'byung ba ni rnam par shes pa drug po dag rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / skye 'gag mtshungs pa'i don gyi dpe bstan pa'o //
translated: it says, “The arising of waves is an example of the meaning of the six consciousnesses and the fundamental consciousness arising and ceasing in the same way.

original: me long gi dkyil 'khor las gzugs brnyan sdang ba ni rnam par shes pa rnams 'byung ba rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid rnam par shes pa drug po dag tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i dper bstan pa'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o zhe'o //
analyzed: me long gi dkyil 'khor las gzugs brnyan sdang ba ni rnam par shes pa rnams 'byung ba rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid rnam par shes pa drug po dag tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i dper bstan pa'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o zhe'o //
translated: The consciousnesses are not the six consciousnesses, which are the nature of the fundamental consciousness, nor are they other than the six consciousnesses.

original: kha cig na re dpe rnam pa gnyis gsungs pa'i dgongs pa ni tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: kha cig na re dpe rnam pa gnyis gsungs pa'i dgongs pa ni tha dad pa med de /
translated: Some say: The two similes are not intended to be different.

original: gnyi ga yang rnam par shes pa rnams lhan cig tu 'jug pa'i dper bsten pa yin pas bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang rnam par bshad pa las ji skad du bstan pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang rnam par shes pa rnams lhan cig tu 'jug pa'i dper bsten pa yin pas bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang rnam par bshad pa las ji skad du bstan pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: Both are similes for the simultaneous engagement of consciousnesses, as explained in the Yogācāra Levels and the Explanation of the Intention.

original: 'dir @240b dpe rnam pa gnyis bshad pa yang bstan pa rnams las mi mthun te /
analyzed: 'dir @240b dpe rnam pa gnyis bshad pa yang bstan pa rnams las mi mthun te /
translated: Here the two similes are explained differently in the treatises.

original: la lar ni gnas dang gnas pa rnam pa gnyis kyi bye brag rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: la lar ni gnas dang gnas pa rnam pa gnyis kyi bye brag rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Some say: In order to demonstrate the distinction between the basis and the based,

original: dpe rnam pa gnyis gsungs pa yin bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du don dam pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pas 'jug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dpe rnam pa gnyis gsungs pa yin bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du don dam pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pas 'jug pa gang zhe na /
translated: The Yogācāra-bhūmi-śāstra says, “What is the entrance by the establishment of the ultimate?

original: mdor bsdu na rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, consciousness is twofold:

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //🔽de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gnas yin no //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o // de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gnas yin no //
translated: the store consciousness and the actual consciousnesses.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gnas pa yin te /
translated: The store consciousness is the host,🔽and the actual consciousnesses are the guests.

original: de yang rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bdun te /
translated: Moreover, there are seven of these:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar ro //
translated: from visual consciousness to mental consciousness.

original: dper na chu'i chu bo dang rlabs lta bu 'am me long dang gzugs brnyan lta bu yin te /
analyzed: dper na chu'i chu bo dang rlabs lta bu 'am me long dang gzugs brnyan lta bu yin te /
translated: They are like water and waves or a mirror and reflections.

original: de ltar na 'di ni don dam pa'i tshul gyis gnas dang gnas pa'i bye brag rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni don dam pa'i tshul gyis gnas dang gnas pa'i bye brag rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus this is the establishment of the host and the guest by the method of the ultimate.”

original: la lar ni brgyad pa dang bdun po dag lhan cig 'jug par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: la lar ni brgyad pa dang bdun po dag lhan cig 'jug par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin te /
translated: In some places, it is stated in order to teach that the eighth and the seventh consciousnesses operate together,

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / rnam par bshad pa las ji skad du bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / rnam par bshad pa las ji skad du bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: as is taught in the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra and the Vijñaptimātratāsiddhi Śāstra.

original: la la las ni brgyad pa dang bdun po dag tha dad pa med pa'i don rab tu bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: la la las ni brgyad pa dang bdun po dag tha dad pa med pa'i don rab tu bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin te /
translated: In some places, it is stated in order to teach that the eighth and the seventh consciousnesses are not different,

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag gi rang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par gcig gi mtshan nyid ces nges par brjod du yang mi rung ste /🔽gnas dang rkyen dang mtshungs par ldan pa tha dad pa'i phyir dang gzhan yang gcig 'gag pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag gi rang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par gcig gi mtshan nyid ces nges par brjod du yang mi rung ste / gnas dang rkyen dang mtshungs par ldan pa tha dad pa'i phyir dang gzhan yang gcig 'gag pa'i tshe /
translated: as is taught in the Vijñaptimātratāsiddhi Śāstra, which says, “The nature of the eight forms of consciousness is not such that they can be said to be absolutely different,

original: gzhan mi 'gag pa'i phyir dang / bsgo ba dang / bsgo bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid so so tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan mi 'gag pa'i phyir dang / bsgo ba dang / bsgo bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid so so tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their locations, conditions, and modes of activity are different, and because when one ceases, the others do not necessarily cease, and because the characteristics of the controller and the controlled are different.

original: nges par tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nges par tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are definitely not different,

original: mdo las rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag ni chu dang chu bo'i rlabs lta bur tha dad pa med par gsungs pa'i phyir dang / nges par tha dad par gyur na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: mdo las rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag ni chu dang chu bo'i rlabs lta bur tha dad pa med par gsungs pa'i phyir dang / nges par tha dad par gyur na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang /
translated: because a sutra declares that the eight consciousnesses are not different, like water and waves, and because if they were definitely different, they would not be by nature cause and effect,

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa ltar nges pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa @241a * //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa ltar nges pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa @241a * //
translated: and because, like illusions and so on, they have no real, substantial existence.

original: lta bu'o // sngar gong du bshad pa ltar rnam par shes pa'i bye brag tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyang kun rdzob la brten nas yid kyi de kho na'i don dam pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lta bu'o // sngar gong du bshad pa ltar rnam par shes pa'i bye brag tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyang kun rdzob la brten nas yid kyi de kho na'i don dam pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: As explained above, the characteristics of the different consciousnesses are based on the conventional, not on the ultimate reality of mind.

original: de kho na nyid kyi don dam pa la ni sems dang tha snyad chad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi don dam pa la ni sems dang tha snyad chad pa'i phyir /
translated: In ultimate reality, mind and conventionalities are severed.

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: The Arya Buddha-bhumi-vyakhya says:

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag kyang kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid kyi sa ni tha dad la /
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag kyang kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid kyi sa ni tha dad la /
translated: The eight consciousnesses, mind, mentation, and consciousness are different in terms of the relative,

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyis tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyis tha dad pa med de /
translated: but they are not different in terms of the ultimate,

original: mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: because there is neither a characteristic nor a basis of characteristics.

original: 'dir mdo sde'i dgongs pa la yang gong du bstan pa lta bu'i don yod par 'os so //
analyzed: 'dir mdo sde'i dgongs pa la yang gong du bstan pa lta bu'i don yod par 'os so //
translated: Here, it is appropriate that the intended meaning of the sūtras is as explained above.

original: yang na mdo sde las dpe rnam pa gnyis gsungs pa'i dgongs pa tha dad pas dpe snga ma ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i don gyi dper bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na mdo sde las dpe rnam pa gnyis gsungs pa'i dgongs pa tha dad pas dpe snga ma ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i don gyi dper bstan pa yin te /
translated: Alternatively, the intended meaning of the two examples stated in the sūtras is different. The first example illustrates the meaning of the simultaneity and the uninterrupted continuum of cause and effect.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du /
translated: As it says in the treatise Proof of Consciousness Only:

original: de la rgyun zhes bya bas ni chad pa dgag cing 'jug pa rtag pa ma yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la rgyun zhes bya bas ni chad pa dgag cing 'jug pa rtag pa ma yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: “In this context, ‘continuum’ refutes discontinuity and illustrates the impermanence of engagement.

original: chu bo'i rgyun bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i chos nyid de yin pas so zhes bstan pa lta bu ste /
