analyzed: chu bo'i rgyun bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i chos nyid de yin pas so zhes bstan pa lta bu ste /
translated: Because the nature of the phenomena of cause and effect is like that, as if it were a flowing river.

original: zhib tu de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This is taught in detail in the same text.

original: dpe phyi ma ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang / bdun pa mngon par 'grub pa dang / nye bar spyod pa zad mi shes pa'i don gyi dper bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dpe phyi ma ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang / bdun pa mngon par 'grub pa dang / nye bar spyod pa zad mi shes pa'i don gyi dper bstan pa yin no //
translated: The latter example illustrates the inexhaustible meaning of the simultaneous arising of the seven abhisambodhis and the enjoyment of the result.

original: snga ma la yang rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: snga ma la yang rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: The former is also taught in three parts.

original: rkyen gcig las rlabs gcig 'byung ba'i dpe dang rkyen mang po las rlabs mang po 'byung ba'i dpe dang / 'on kyang zhes bya ba man chad kyis rang gi rgyud rgyun mi 'chad par mi 'gyur ba'i dpe ste /
analyzed: rkyen gcig las rlabs gcig 'byung ba'i dpe dang rkyen mang po las rlabs mang po 'byung ba'i dpe dang / 'on kyang zhes bya ba man chad kyis rang gi rgyud rgyun mi 'chad par mi 'gyur ba'i dpe ste /
translated: The example of a single wave arising from a single condition, the example of many waves arising from many conditions, and the example of the continuity of one’s continuum not being interrupted by the words “however” and so on.

original: 'di ni dang po rkyen gcig las rlabs gcig 'byung ba'i dpe'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po rkyen gcig las rlabs gcig 'byung ba'i dpe'o //
translated: This is the first example, of a single wave arising from a single condition.

original: gal te rlabs gnyis sam /
analyzed: gal te rlabs gnyis sam /
translated: If two waves arise from two conditions,

original: gal te rlabs rab tu mang po dag 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na rlabs mang po dag 'byung ste zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rkyen mang po las rlabs mang po 'byung ba'i dpe'o //
analyzed: gal te rlabs rab tu mang po dag 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na rlabs mang po dag 'byung ste zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rkyen mang po las rlabs mang po 'byung ba'i dpe'o //
translated: If the conditions for the arising of many waves are present, then many waves arise. This is the second example, of the arising of many waves from many conditions.

original: 'on kyang chu'i klung de rang gi rgyun gyis rgyun chad par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on kyang chu'i klung de rang gi rgyun gyis rgyun chad par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: But the river of water is not interrupted by its own current.

original: yongs su zad par @241b mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gsum pa rang gi rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ba'i dpe'o //
analyzed: yongs su zad par @241b mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gsum pa rang gi rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ba'i dpe'o //
translated: It does not completely dry up. This is the third example, of the non-cessation of its own continuum.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par 'byung ste /
translated: The noble Lankavatara Sutra also says,

original: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: Therefore, in a verse:

original: ji ltar rgya mtshor rgyu rkyen gyis //
analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtshor rgyu rkyen gyis //
translated: Just as in the ocean, due to causes and conditions,

original: dpa' rlabs sna tshogs byung nas ni //
analyzed: dpa' rlabs sna tshogs byung nas ni //
translated: Various waves arise,

original: mngon du bya bar rab 'jug kyang //
analyzed: mngon du bya bar rab 'jug kyang //
translated: And although they manifest,

original: rgyun ni chad par 'gyur med ltar //
analyzed: rgyun ni chad par 'gyur med ltar //
translated: The continuum is not interrupted.

original: kun gzhi rgya mtsho de bzhin te //
analyzed: kun gzhi rgya mtsho de bzhin te //
translated: The ocean of the fundamental consciousness is like that.

original: yul gyi rlung ni rab bskyod pas //
analyzed: yul gyi rlung ni rab bskyod pas //
translated: Stirred by the wind of objects,

original: rnam shes dpa' rlabs rtag tu 'byung //
analyzed: rnam shes dpa' rlabs rtag tu 'byung //
translated: Consciousness always arises in waves.

original: bya ba dag ni nye bar 'jug / ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dag ni nye bar 'jug / ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Actions are engaged in.

original: gzhan yang dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu yongs su dag pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu yongs su dag pa la /
translated: Moreover, for example, in the case of a very pure mirror-surface,🔽if the condition for the arising of a single reflection is present, then only a single reflection arises.

original: gal te gzugs brnyan gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na gzugs brnyan yang gcig kho na 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa me long gi dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs brnyan mang nyung gi dpe zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: gal te gzugs brnyan gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na gzugs brnyan yang gcig kho na 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa me long gi dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs brnyan mang nyung gi dpe zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: This is the second example, called the example of the many or few reflections in a mirror-surface.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into three parts:

original: rkyen gcig las gzugs brnyan gcig 'byung ba'i dpe dang / rkyen mang po las gzugs brnyan mang po 'byung ba'i dpe dang / nye bar spyod pa zad mi shes pa'i dpe ste 'di ni dang po rkyen gcig las gzugs brnyan gcig 'byung ba'i dpe bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen gcig las gzugs brnyan gcig 'byung ba'i dpe dang / rkyen mang po las gzugs brnyan mang po 'byung ba'i dpe dang / nye bar spyod pa zad mi shes pa'i dpe ste 'di ni dang po rkyen gcig las gzugs brnyan gcig 'byung ba'i dpe bstan pa'o //
translated: the example of a single reflection arising from a single condition, the example of many reflections arising from many conditions, and the example of inexhaustible enjoyment. This is the first, the explanation of the example of a single reflection arising from a single condition.

original: gal te gzugs brnyan gnyis sam /
analyzed: gal te gzugs brnyan gnyis sam /
translated: If the condition for the arising of two reflections is present, then two reflections arise.

original: gal te rab tu mang po dag 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na gzugs brnyan mang po dag 'byung zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te rab tu mang po dag 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na gzugs brnyan mang po dag 'byung zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the conditions for the appearance of many images are present, many images will appear.

original: gnyis pa rkyen mang po las gzugs brnyan mang po 'byung ba'i dpes bstan pa'o //🔽me long gi dkyil 'khor de dag gzugs brnyan gyi dngos pos yongs su 'gyur pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gnyis pa rkyen mang po las gzugs brnyan mang po 'byung ba'i dpes bstan pa'o // me long gi dkyil 'khor de dag gzugs brnyan gyi dngos pos yongs su 'gyur pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The second example illustrates the appearance of many images from many conditions.🔽The mirror surfaces do not change into the entity of the images,

original: nye bar spyod pa zad par mngon par yang med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa zad par mngon par yang med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and the enjoyment of the images is not exhausted.

original: gsum pa nye bar spyod pa zad mi shes pa'i dpes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa nye bar spyod pa zad mi shes pa'i dpes bstan pa'o //
translated: The third example illustrates the inexhaustible enjoyment.🔽The mirror surfaces do not change into the entity of the images, and so on.

original: me long gi dkyil 'khor de gzugs brnyan gyi dngos por yongs su 'gyur ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las me long la gzugs brnyan 'byung ba ni rkyen la ltos pas me long nyid gzugs brnyan🔽gyi dngos por 'gyur ba @242a * //
analyzed: me long gi dkyil 'khor de gzugs brnyan gyi dngos por yongs su 'gyur ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las me long la gzugs brnyan 'byung ba ni rkyen la ltos pas me long nyid gzugs brnyan gyi dngos por 'gyur ba @242a * //
translated: In his commentary on the Four Hundred Stanzas, Master Sahajavajra explains that the appearance of images in a mirror is dependent on conditions.

original: ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ni ma yin no //
translated: The mirror itself does not change into the entity of the images.

original: rnam par shes pa drug po yul gyi rkyen la ltos nas skye ba yang rnam par shes pa drug po snga ma'i sa bon las rnam par shes pa drug po'i phyi ma'i skye ba'i rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid rnam par shes pa drug po dag
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug po yul gyi rkyen la ltos nas skye ba yang rnam par shes pa drug po snga ma'i sa bon las rnam par shes pa drug po'i phyi ma'i skye ba'i rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid rnam par shes pa drug po dag
translated: The arising of the six consciousnesses in dependence on the condition of objects is the arising of the later six consciousnesses from the seeds of the former six consciousnesses.🔽

original: gi dngos por gyur pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gi dngos por gyur pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The six consciousnesses arise in dependence on the condition of objects, but the six consciousnesses are not the entity of the consciousness that is the root of the arising of the later six consciousnesses from the seeds of the earlier six consciousnesses.

original: 'dir yongs su 'gyur ba rnam par shes pa yang don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan te /
analyzed: 'dir yongs su 'gyur ba rnam par shes pa yang don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan te /
translated: Here, the transformation of consciousness has two meanings.

original: dang po ni rgyur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni rgyur gyur pa ste /
translated: The first is as a cause,

original: sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gyur nas rnam par shes pa bdun po dag mngon par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gyur nas rnam par shes pa bdun po dag mngon par 'grub pa'o //
translated: because the transformation of the seed consciousness is the actualization of the seven consciousnesses.

original: gnyis pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa ste /
translated: The second is as a result,

original: mngon du spyod pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rang gi rgyu mtshan gyi rnam par ni snang la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun po dag tu ni ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du spyod pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rang gi rgyu mtshan gyi rnam par ni snang la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun po dag tu ni ma gyur pa'o //
translated: because the actual experience of the store consciousness appears as its own causal images, but not as the seven consciousnesses such as visual consciousness.

original: mdo 'di las ni 'bras bur gyur pa la ma dgongs nas de'i phyir me long gi dkyil 'khor de gzugs brnyan gyi dngos po yongs su gyur pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo 'di las ni 'bras bur gyur pa la ma dgongs nas de'i phyir me long gi dkyil 'khor de gzugs brnyan gyi dngos po yongs su gyur pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: In this sutra, the Buddha had in mind the transformation of the result, and therefore said that the mirror surface is not transformed into the entity of the reflection.

original: gzhan yang me long gi dkyil 'khor de gzugs brnyan ston pa la zad pa med par gsungs pa'i dgongs pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang me long gi dkyil 'khor de gzugs brnyan ston pa la zad pa med par gsungs pa'i dgongs pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the Buddha said that the mirror surface is inexhaustible in its ability to manifest reflections.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'bras bu bskyed pa la zad pa med par ston to //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'bras bu bskyed pa la zad pa med par ston to //
translated: This means that the container consciousness is inexhaustible in its ability to produce results.

original: ci'i phyir nyan thos kyi lung las chu bo'i rlabs nyi tshe'i dpe smos she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyan thos kyi lung las chu bo'i rlabs nyi tshe'i dpe smos she na /
translated: Why did the Buddha use the analogy of the waves in the Sravakabhumi?

original: smras pa / don de ni brda phrad par zad de /
analyzed: smras pa / don de ni brda phrad par zad de /
translated: We reply: This analogy is merely a conventional expression.

original: mdor bsdus pa'i phyir ma bstan to //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa'i phyir ma bstan to //
translated: It was not taught in detail.

original: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang tshig nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las dpe rnam pa gnyis tshang bar smos she na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang tshig nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las dpe rnam pa gnyis tshang bar smos she na /
translated: If that is so, why did the Buddha use both analogies in the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning and the Sutra Definitely Elucidating the Noble Truths?

original: rgya gar gyi dpe nyid las bye brag 'di yod pas so //
analyzed: rgya gar gyi dpe nyid las bye brag 'di yod pas so //
translated: This distinction is found in the Indian text itself.

original: de bzhin du blo gros yangs pa chu klung lta bu'i len pa'i rnam par shes pas gnas pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du blo gros yangs pa chu klung lta bu'i len pa'i rnam par shes pas gnas pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, O Vipula, the appropriating consciousness is like a river, and the other consciousnesses are like waves, because they are established by the action of the wind of objects.🔽If at that time the condition for the arising of one eye consciousness is present, then at that time only one eye consciousness arises.

original: gal te de'i tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na de'i dus su mig gi rnam par shes pa yang gcig kho na 'jug ces bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na de'i dus su mig gi rnam par shes pa yang gcig kho na 'jug ces bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //
translated: This is the third application of the example to the meaning.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts.

original: rkyen gcig la rnam par shes pa gcig 'jug pa dang / @242b rkyen mang po las rnam par shes pa mang po 'jug par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen gcig la rnam par shes pa gcig 'jug pa dang / @242b rkyen mang po las rnam par shes pa mang po 'jug par bstan pa ste /
translated: The first is the teaching that from one condition only one consciousness arises, and the second is the teaching that from many conditions many consciousnesses arise.

original: 'di ni dang po rkyen gcig las rnam par shes pa yang gcig kho na 'jug par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po rkyen gcig las rnam par shes pa yang gcig kho na 'jug par bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the first, the teaching that from one condition only one consciousness arises.

original: gal te de'i tshe rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga char gyi bar dag 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga char gyi bar dag 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na /
translated: If the conditions for the arising of the five collections of consciousness up to this point are present,🔽then at that time the five collections of consciousness will also engage.

original: de'i dus su rnam par shes pa'i tshogs kyang lnga char 'jug go zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rkyen mang po las rnam par shes pa yang mang por 'jug par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dus su rnam par shes pa'i tshogs kyang lnga char 'jug go zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rkyen mang po las rnam par shes pa yang mang por 'jug par bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the second presentation, which shows that many consciousnesses engage due to many conditions.

original: gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in the same way as above.

original: blo gros yangs pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos gnas pa shes pas /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos gnas pa shes pas /
translated: “O Viśālamati, in this way, bodhisattvas who know the abiding of phenomena

original: gnas dang rnam par gzhag pa byas pa'i phyir sems dang yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gnas dang rnam par gzhag pa byas pa'i phyir sems dang yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa yin mod kyi /
translated: are skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness because they have established the basis and the presentation.

original: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni de tsam gyis de dag la sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi gsang ba la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi 'dogs so zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa gsang ba la mkhas
analyzed: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni de tsam gyis de dag la sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi gsang ba la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi 'dogs so zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa gsang ba la mkhas
translated: However, the Tathagatas do not call those bodhisattvas skilled in the secret of mind, thought and consciousness who are satisfied with that.

original: pa rnam par 'byed cing sngar zhus pa rnam pa gnyis kyis lan ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: pa rnam par 'byed cing sngar zhus pa rnam pa gnyis kyis lan ston par mdzad do //
translated: This passage from here on is the second part of the answer to the two questions asked above, which analyzes the skill in the secret.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts:

original: zhus pa bzhin du yang dag par rnam par bshad pa dang blo gros yangs pa de tsam gyis zhes bya ba man chad kyis sngar zhus pa'i lan spyir gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhus pa bzhin du yang dag par rnam par bshad pa dang blo gros yangs pa de tsam gyis zhes bya ba man chad kyis sngar zhus pa'i lan spyir gsungs pa'o //
translated: The correct explanation according to the question and the general answer to the previous question from Vast Mind, it is not by that alone onwards.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: The first is also taught in two parts:

original: sa'i mdun rol ba rnams de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa ma yin par bstan pa dang sa la gnas pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sa'i mdun rol ba rnams de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa ma yin par bstan pa dang sa la gnas pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: Teaching that those on the lower stages are not predicted by the Tathagata and teaching that those on the stages are predicted by the Tathagata.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: de la chos gnas pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad yod par smras ba'i gzhung gis 'bras bu'i chos rgyu la gnas par shes pa'i phyir chos gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la chos gnas pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad yod par smras ba'i gzhung gis 'bras bu'i chos rgyu la gnas par shes pa'i phyir chos gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The knowledge of the basis of phenomena is so called because it is the knowledge that the result of phenomena abides in its cause, in accordance with the scriptures of the Vaibhasikas who say all exist.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
translated: Thus the great treatise on differentiation states:

original: ci'i phyir chos gnas pa shes pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir chos gnas pa shes pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the knowledge of the basis of phenomena?

original: smras pa / chos zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / chos zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yin la /
translated: It is said that phenomena are results and

original: gnas par zhes bya ba ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gnas par zhes bya ba ni rgyu yin no //
translated: the basis is their cause.

original: 'bras bu'i chos gnas pa'i rgyu shes pa ni chos gnas pa shes pa zhes bya ste /🔽'di ltar khams gsum pa'i 'bras bu rab @243a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos gnas pa'i rgyu shes pa ni chos gnas pa shes pa zhes bya ste / 'di ltar khams gsum pa'i 'bras bu rab @243a * //
translated: The knowledge that the result of phenomena abides in its cause is called the knowledge of the basis of phenomena.

original: dang 'bring dang tha ma gnas pa'i rgyu shes pa ni chos gnas pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang 'bring dang tha ma gnas pa'i rgyu shes pa ni chos gnas pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus the knowledge that the result of the three realms abides in its cause is called the knowledge of the basis of phenomena.

original: rgya cher bshad pa ni de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher bshad pa ni de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The extensive explanation is as stated in that text.

original: mdo sde pa dag ni chos rtag tu gnas par shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo sde pa dag ni chos rtag tu gnas par shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Sautrantikas say that it is called the knowledge of the basis of phenomena because it is the knowledge that phenomena always abide.

original: chos gnas pa shes pa zhes bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: chos gnas pa shes pa zhes bya'o zhes zer te /
translated: It is called knowledge of the enduring nature of phenomena.🔽Thus, the treatise Establishing Reality states:

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa las chos rnams kyi 'byung gnas shes pa ni chos gnas pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa las chos rnams kyi 'byung gnas shes pa ni chos gnas pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Knowledge of the enduring nature of phenomena is called knowledge of the enduring nature of phenomena because

original: ji ltar skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: it is like the statement, “The condition of birth is the condition of aging and death,” and “The condition of ignorance is the condition of compositional activity.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs kyang rung de bzhin gshegs pa mi bzhugs kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs kyang rung de bzhin gshegs pa mi bzhugs kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether the Tathagata exists or does not exist,

original: ngo bo nyid 'di ni rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir chos gnas pa shes pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid 'di ni rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir chos gnas pa shes pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: this nature always endures, and thus it is called knowledge of the enduring nature of phenomena.🔽Here, when applied to the teaching of the Mahayana, the treatise Explanation of the Commentary states:

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las chos gnas pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las chos gnas pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Knowledge of the enduring nature of phenomena is as follows:

original: mdo sde las brtsams nas chos kyi sgo mo rnam par gzhag pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo sde las brtsams nas chos kyi sgo mo rnam par gzhag pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is the presentation of the doors of doctrine that begins with the sutras.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang 'di dang don mthun par 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang 'di dang don mthun par 'byung ste /
translated: The Yogācāra Levels, which is consistent with this point, states:

original: de'i phyir de nyid las chos gnas pa shes pa ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las chos gnas pa shes pa ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: “How should one understand the knowledge of the abiding nature of phenomena?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gzhag pa dang / bstan pa bzhin du phyin ci ma log par shes par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gzhag pa dang / bstan pa bzhin du phyin ci ma log par shes par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: One should understand it without error in accordance with the way it is presented and taught by the Bhagavat.”

original: gzhan yang de nyid las /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las /
translated: Moreover, the same text states:

original: chos gnas pa shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos gnas pa shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the knowledge of the abiding nature of phenomena?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: ji ltar 'di na kha cig rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i gtam phyin ci ma log pa thos nas /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di na kha cig rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i gtam phyin ci ma log pa thos nas /
translated: Here, some, having heard unerringly the discourse that accords with dependent origination as it is in reality,

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs de so so'i skye bo'i sa la gnas bzhin du thos pa dang bsam pa dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sdug bsngal la yang dag par sdug bsngal bar kun 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs de so so'i skye bo'i sa la gnas bzhin du thos pa dang bsam pa dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sdug bsngal la yang dag par sdug bsngal bar kun 'byung ba dang /
translated: Through proper attention that arises from hearing, contemplation and meditation, they correctly understand suffering as suffering, its origin as origin,

original: 'gog pa dang / lam la yang dag par lam yin par shes rab kyis 'jug cing mos par byed de /🔽de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i chos rnams kyi shes pa gang yin pa 'di ni chos gnas pa shes pa @243b zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin te 'dir gsungs pa yang don gyis bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang / lam la yang dag par lam yin par shes rab kyis 'jug cing mos par byed de / de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i chos rnams kyi shes pa gang yin pa 'di ni chos gnas pa shes pa @243b zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin te 'dir gsungs pa yang don gyis bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang /
translated: cessation as cessation and the path as the path.🔽This knowledge of phenomena that abides as cause and effect is called knowledge of the enduring nature of phenomena.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa dang mthun no //
translated: This is stated here and it is also taught in the treatises and in the Levels of Yogic Deeds.

original: de ni 'di skad du sa'i mdun rol gyi byang chub sems dpa' dag chos gnas pa shes pa'i stobs kyis /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du sa'i mdun rol gyi byang chub sems dpa' dag chos gnas pa shes pa'i stobs kyis /
translated: This is to be explained as follows:

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i kun rdzob kyi bye brag khong du chud mod kyi /
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i kun rdzob kyi bye brag khong du chud mod kyi /
translated: Bodhisattvas on the level of earnest aspiration understand the conventional differences between mind, thought, and consciousness through the power of knowing the way things are.

original: 'on kyang da dung sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba'i don dam pa ma rtogs pas /
analyzed: 'on kyang da dung sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba'i don dam pa ma rtogs pas /
translated: However, they have not yet realized the ultimate secret of mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis de tsam gyis de dag la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi 'dogs so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //🔽blo gros yangs pa byang chub sems dpa' gang gis nang gi so so yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du len pa mi mthong /🔽len pa'i rnam par shes pa mi mthong la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis de tsam gyis de dag la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi 'dogs so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro // blo gros yangs pa byang chub sems dpa' gang gis nang gi so so yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du len pa mi mthong / len pa'i rnam par shes pa mi mthong la /
translated: Therefore, the Lord does not call them “wise bodhisattvas” simply because of that.

original: kun gzhi yang mi mthong /🔽kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong bsags pa yang mi mthong sems kyang mi mthong zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni /
analyzed: kun gzhi yang mi mthong /🔽kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong bsags pa yang mi mthong sems kyang mi mthong zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni /
translated: They do not see the all-base.🔽They do not see the all-base consciousness, nor do they see the accumulation or the mind.”🔽

original: gnyis pa sa la gnas pa yan chad de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa sa la gnas pa yan chad de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: The second is the prediction of the Tathagata for those who abide in the stages.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: zhus pa rnam pa gnyis kyi lan spyir gsungs pa dang / de ni zhes bya ba man chad kyis zhus pa rnam pa gnyis kyi lan so sor phye ste gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhus pa rnam pa gnyis kyi lan spyir gsungs pa dang / de ni zhes bya ba man chad kyis zhus pa rnam pa gnyis kyi lan so sor phye ste gsungs pa'o //
translated: the general response to the two questions, and the specific response to the two questions.

original: lan spyir gsungs pa yang don rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: lan spyir gsungs pa yang don rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: The general response also has two meanings:

original: dang po bstan pas brjod par bya ba'i don ni zhus pa snga ma'i lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po bstan pas brjod par bya ba'i don ni zhus pa snga ma'i lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: the first is the meaning to be expressed by the teaching, which is the response to the first question.

original: gnyis pa don la brten nas bstan pa gzhag pa ni zhus pa phyi ma'i lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa don la brten nas bstan pa gzhag pa ni zhus pa phyi ma'i lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: The second is the establishment of the teaching based on the meaning, which is the response to the second question.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: This is also taught in two parts:

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la brten nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa rnam par 'byed pa dang / khams bco brgyad la brten nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa rab tu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la brten nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa rnam par 'byed pa dang / khams bco brgyad la brten nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa rab tu bstan pa ste /
translated: Based on the foundation consciousness, one analyzes the way things really are, and based on the eighteen elements, one teaches the way things really are.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di bshad pa yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di bshad pa yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: The explanation of the words of this sūtra is also not the same for each.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las /🔽byang chub sems dpa' gal te gong du gsungs pa ltar rnam par shes pa dang / gzugs la @244a * //
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las / byang chub sems dpa' gal te gong du gsungs pa ltar rnam par shes pa dang / gzugs la @244a * //
translated: In the notes of the master Parahitabhadra,🔽it says:🔽“If bodhisattvas see consciousness, form, and so on,

original: sogs par mthong nas /
analyzed: sogs par mthong nas /
translated: as previously stated,

original: de ni kun rdzob tu shes pa yin pas bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag 'di sems dang yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba'i don shes pa zhes lung ston par mi mdzad la /
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob tu shes pa yin pas bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag 'di sems dang yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba'i don shes pa zhes lung ston par mi mdzad la /
translated: that is knowledge of the conventional, and therefore the Bhagavat does not prophesy that such a person knows the secret meaning of mind, mentality, and consciousness.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sngar gsungs pa ltar rnam par shes pa'i don mi mthong na ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sngar gsungs pa ltar rnam par shes pa'i don mi mthong na ni /
translated: If one does not see the object of consciousness as previously stated, the way things really are,

original: gdod bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag 'di sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba'i don shes pa zhes lung ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: gdod bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag 'di sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba'i don shes pa zhes lung ston par mdzad de /
translated: Then the Bhagavat prophesied that this person would know the secret of mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: 'dis ni yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa yod pa ma yin par shes na ni yang dag pa yin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa yod pa ma yin par shes na ni yang dag pa yin no zhes bstan te /
translated: This teaches that when one knows that unreal imagination exists, it is real.

original: 'di ltar rtsa ba'i gsang ba khong du chud na yang yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa'i yan lag kyang gdod gsal bar khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtsa ba'i gsang ba khong du chud na yang yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa'i yan lag kyang gdod gsal bar khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, when one comprehends the fundamental secret, one also comprehends the branches of unreal imagination.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las de la nang so so zhes bya ba la nang ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las de la nang so so zhes bya ba la nang ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, that same text says, “Regarding the inner, the individual, the inner is as follows.

original: de bzhin nyid chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Suchness is the essence of phenomena.

original: de'i phyir nang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nang zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the inner.

original: so so zhes bya ba ni brjod pa ni rjes su yang dag pa nyid rab tu ston pa ni so so zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: so so zhes bya ba ni brjod pa ni rjes su yang dag pa nyid rab tu ston pa ni so so zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The individual is the one who teaches the correct nature of expression.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what it says:

original: sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams don dam pa'i bden pa rtsa ba'i ye shes la brten cing nang gi so so la de bzhin nyid du rtogs pa'i dbang gis yul rnams la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du len pa'i las kyang mi mthong
analyzed: sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams don dam pa'i bden pa rtsa ba'i ye shes la brten cing nang gi so so la de bzhin nyid du rtogs pa'i dbang gis yul rnams la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du len pa'i las kyang mi mthong
translated: The bodhisattvas abiding on the levels, on the basis of the ultimate truth, the fundamental wisdom, and by virtue of their realization of suchness within themselves, do not see the act of appropriating objects as it really is.

original: la / len pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi mthong ngo zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: la / len pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi mthong ngo zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: And they do not see the essence of appropriation as it really is.

original: kun gzhi dang sems kyi las dang ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi dang sems kyi las dang ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The distinctions between the foundation consciousness and the mind and its activity should be understood in the same way.

original: gzhan yang nang gi so so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang nang gi so so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, “within themselves”

original: len pa la sogs pa chos rnams kyi bdag nyid la rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rigs pa yod de /
analyzed: len pa la sogs pa chos rnams kyi bdag nyid la rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rigs pa yod de /
translated: refers to the fact that the principles of the specific and general characteristics exist in the nature of phenomena such as appropriation.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul yin pa'i phyir ni nang zhes bya la /
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul yin pa'i phyir ni nang zhes bya la /
translated: The specific characteristic is called “within” because it is the object of the valid cognition of direct perception.

original: chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid so so nas rang gi bdag nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ni so so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid so so nas rang gi bdag nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ni so so zhes bya ste /
translated: Since the individual characteristics of phenomena are possessed by each of their own natures, they are called “individual.”

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las bdag nyid kyis nang gi myong ba gang yin pa de ni don shes pa @244b zhes bya zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las bdag nyid kyis nang gi myong ba gang yin pa de ni don shes pa @244b zhes bya zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore the treatise Abhidharma Compendium states, “That which is experienced by oneself is called the knowledge of objects.”

original: 'di ni mngon sum gyi tshad mas rang gi mtshan nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon sum gyi tshad mas rang gi mtshan nyid shes pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of individual characteristics by the valid knowledge of direct perception.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Moreover, the treatise Levels of Yogic Deeds states:

original: rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i tha snyad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i tha snyad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The conventional in dependence on consciousness is as follows:

original: gang des nang so so rang gis rig pa dang / rtogs pa dang / reg pa mngon sum du byas nas de la brten te gzhan dag la tha snyad du brjod pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang des nang so so rang gis rig pa dang / rtogs pa dang / reg pa mngon sum du byas nas de la brten te gzhan dag la tha snyad du brjod pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: That which is expressed conventionally to others in dependence on that which is individually realized, understood, and directly perceived by oneself is called the conventional of consciousness.

original: 'di dang sbyar te bshad na yang dag pa dang / rjes las thob pa gnyi ga mngon sum gyi tshad ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di dang sbyar te bshad na yang dag pa dang / rjes las thob pa gnyi ga mngon sum gyi tshad ma bzhin no //
translated: When explained in connection with this, both the correct and the subsequent obtainment are like the valid cognition of direct perception.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du len pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid khong du chud cing rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi mthong ba zhes bya'i rnam par rtog pa med pa la mi mthong ba zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du len pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid khong du chud cing rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi mthong ba zhes bya'i rnam par rtog pa med pa la mi mthong ba zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it comprehends the characteristic of taking things as they really are and is free from conceptualization, it is called not seeing. It is not that the absence of conceptualization is called not seeing.

original: mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /
translated: The eye, form, and eye consciousness are also not seen.

original: rna ba dang / sgra dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /🔽sna dang / dri dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sgra dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong / sna dang / dri dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /
translated: The ear, sound, and ear consciousness are also not seen.🔽The nose, smell, and nose consciousness are also not seen.

original: lce dang / ro dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /
analyzed: lce dang / ro dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /
translated: The tongue, taste, and tongue consciousness are also not seen.

original: lus dang / reg bya dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /
analyzed: lus dang / reg bya dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /
translated: The body, tactile objects, and body consciousness are also not seen.

original: yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa khams bco brgyad la brten nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa bstan te /
analyzed: yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa khams bco brgyad la brten nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa bstan te /
translated: Not seeing the mind, mental objects, or the mind consciousness is the second, the teaching of correct knowledge as it is in dependence on the eighteen elements.

original: khams bco brgyad mi dmigs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad mi dmigs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the wise bodhisattva is so called because he does not objectify the eighteen elements.

original: de ni don dam pa la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni don dam pa la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: He is called a bodhisattva skilled in the ultimate.🔽The Tathagata designates him as a bodhisattva skilled in the ultimate.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang de dag la don dam pa la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes 'dogs so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa sngar zhus pa rnam pa gnyis kyi lan so sor phye ste gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang de dag la don dam pa la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes 'dogs so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa sngar zhus pa rnam pa gnyis kyi lan so sor phye ste gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the second answer to the two questions asked above, the answer being given separately.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: These words of the Sutra are divided into two parts.

original: dang po de ni don dam pa la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni gong du sdang bstan pa'i bstan pas brjod par bya ba'i don smos nas zhus pa snga ma'i lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po de ni don dam pa la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni gong du sdang bstan pa'i bstan pas brjod par bya ba'i don smos nas zhus pa snga ma'i lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the answer to the former question, which was asked after the meaning of the teaching that had been given was stated.

original: gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pa yang @245a * //
analyzed: gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pa yang @245a * //
translated: The second is called a bodhisattva skilled in the ultimate.

original: de dag la don dam pa la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes 'dogs so zhes bya ba ni gong du sngar bstan pa'i bstan pa gzhag pa smos nas zhus pa phyi ma'i lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la don dam pa la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes 'dogs so zhes bya ba ni gong du sngar bstan pa'i bstan pa gzhag pa smos nas zhus pa phyi ma'i lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the answer to the latter question, which was asked after the teaching that had been given was stated.

original: blo gros yangs pa de tsam gyis na sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba thams cad la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bas na de bzhin gshegs pa de tsam gyis de dag la sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa de tsam gyis na sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba thams cad la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bas na de bzhin gshegs pa de tsam gyis de dag la sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba
translated: O Vipadprīdī, to that extent a bodhisattva is called skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: thams cad la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes 'dogs so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mjug bsdu zhing sngar zhus pa rnam pa gnyis kyi lan gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes 'dogs so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mjug bsdu zhing sngar zhus pa rnam pa gnyis kyi lan gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is the second part, the reply to the two questions asked above.

original: mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The sutra itself makes this clear.🔽Then the Lord, in order to teach this very meaning, spoke a verse.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: From here on is the second part, the brief teaching through verses.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: This is also taught in two parts:

original: tshigs su bcad pas ston par mdzad pa'i gleng bslang ba dang / tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa nyid de /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pas ston par mdzad pa'i gleng bslang ba dang / tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa nyid de /
translated: the introduction to the teaching through verses, and the brief teaching through verses.

original: 'di ni dang po tshigs su bcad pas ston par mdzad pa'i gleng bslang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po tshigs su bcad pas ston par mdzad pa'i gleng bslang ba'o //
translated: This is the first part, the introduction to the teaching through verses.

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
translated: The appropriating consciousness is deep and subtle,

original: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i klung ltar 'bab //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i klung ltar 'bab //
translated: with all the seeds like a flowing river.

original: bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
analyzed: bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
translated: It is not proper to think of it as a self,

original: byis pa rnams la ngas ni de ma bstan //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la ngas ni de ma bstan //
translated: so I have not taught it to the immature.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa nyid do //
translated: This is the second verse, which is a brief summary.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i rnam par bshad pa yang bstan bcos rnams las so so nas mi mthun te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i rnam par bshad pa yang bstan bcos rnams las so so nas mi mthun te /
translated: The commentaries on this verse differ from each other.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa las /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa las /
translated: In the commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna by the master Niḥsvabhāva,

original: zab pa ni 'jig rten gyi mkhas pa'i blos kyang gting dpag par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab pa ni 'jig rten gyi mkhas pa'i blos kyang gting dpag par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it says: “Profound” means that even the minds of worldly scholars find it difficult to fathom its depths.

original: phra ba ni nyan thos rnams kyis kyang shes par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra ba ni nyan thos rnams kyis kyang shes par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Subtle” means that even the hearers find it difficult to understand.

original: de'i phyir nyan thos la sogs pa la rnam par shes pa 'di ma bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan thos la sogs pa la rnam par shes pa 'di ma bstan te /
translated: Therefore, this consciousness has not been taught to the hearers and so forth,

original: shin tu phra ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa yongs su mi tshol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa yongs su mi tshol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not seek omniscience that is extremely subtle.

original: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i klung lta 'bab /
analyzed: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i klung lta 'bab /
translated: All seeds flow like a river.

original: ces bya ba ni skad @245b cig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas rgyun mi 'chad par chu bo'i klung ltar 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni skad @245b cig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas rgyun mi 'chad par chu bo'i klung ltar 'bab pa'o //
translated: This is the stream of consciousness, which flows like a river, uninterruptedly passing from one moment to the next.

original: byis pa rnams la ngas ni de ma bstan //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la ngas ni de ma bstan //
translated: I have not taught this to the immature.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba dang bcas pa rnams la rnam par ma phye ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba dang bcas pa rnams la rnam par ma phye ba ste /
translated: This is the unanalyzed teaching for those who have the view of self.

original: bdag tu rnam par rtog pa de dag gis de la 'khor ba'i mtha' ji srid pa de srid du rnam pa gcig pa 'gyur ba med pa bdag tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdag tu rnam par rtog pa de dag gis de la 'khor ba'i mtha' ji srid pa de srid du rnam pa gcig pa 'gyur ba med pa bdag tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because of the conception of self, they would grasp it as a self, and that would lead to their downfall for a long time.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: The commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu states:

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni ming gi rnam grangs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni ming gi rnam grangs bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase “appropriating consciousness” is a synonym.

original: zab cing phra ba zhes bya ba ni rtogs par dka' pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab cing phra ba zhes bya ba ni rtogs par dka' pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “profound and subtle” means that it is difficult to understand.

original: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i klung ltar 'bab //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i klung ltar 'bab //
translated: All the seeds flow like a river.

original: ces bya ba ni go rims bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir dang / sa bon thams cad skad cig gcig nas gcig tu chu bo'i klung ltar rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //🔽bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni go rims bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir dang / sa bon thams cad skad cig gcig nas gcig tu chu bo'i klung ltar rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa'i phyir ro // bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
translated: Because it is the cause of the arising of the body, it is the seed of the body.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig tu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pas 'dzin par 'gyur ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig tu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pas 'dzin par 'gyur ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because it is the cause of the arising of the body, it is the seed of the body.🔽Because it is the cause of the arising of the body, it is the seed of the body.🔽Because it is the cause of the arising of the body, it is the seed of the body.🔽Because it is the cause of the arising of the body, it is the seed of the body.🔽Because it is the cause of the arising of the body, it is the seed of the body.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i nang nas slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa las ni chos rnams kyi sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang / dbang po gzugs can len cing gnas byed pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i nang nas slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa las ni chos rnams kyi sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang / dbang po gzugs can len cing gnas byed pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba dang /
translated: Because it is the cause of the arising of the body, it is the seed of the body.🔽Because it is the cause of the arising of the body, it is the seed of the body.🔽Because it is the cause of the arising of the body, it is the seed of the body.🔽Because it is the cause of the arising of the body, it is the seed of the body.🔽Because it is the cause of the arising of the body, it is the seed of the body.🔽Because it is the cause of the arising of the body, it is the seed of the body.🔽Because it is the cause of the arising of the body, it is the seed of the body.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'di len pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'di len pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is the cause of the arising of the body, it is the seed of the body.🔽Because it is the cause of the arising of the body, it is the seed of the body.🔽Because it is the cause of the arising of the body, it is the seed of the body.

original: rigs med pa'i sems can dag gi gting dpag par mi nus pa'i phyir zab pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rigs med pa'i sems can dag gi gting dpag par mi nus pa'i phyir zab pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it is the cause of the arising of the body, it is the seed of the body.🔽Because it is the cause of the arising

original: zhi ba la phyogs pa'i rags can dag gis khong du chud par mi nus pa'i phyir shin tu phra ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhi ba la phyogs pa'i rags can dag gis khong du chud par mi nus pa'i phyir shin tu phra ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called “extremely subtle” because it cannot be comprehended by those who are inclined toward peace.

original: chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa'i sa bon yin pas rkyen gyis bskyod na rnam par shes pa'i rlabs rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa'i sa bon yin pas rkyen gyis bskyod na rnam par shes pa'i rlabs rnams 'byung ste /
translated: Since it is the true seed of all phenomena, when it is disturbed by conditions, waves of consciousness arise.

original: rtag par rgyun du chu bo'i klung bzhin du 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: rtag par rgyun du chu bo'i klung bzhin du 'bab pa'o //
translated: It flows like a river, continuously and forever.

original: byis pa dag ni zhi ba la phyogs pa ste /
analyzed: byis pa dag ni zhi ba la phyogs pa ste /
translated: Fools are inclined toward peace.

original: de dag gi 'di la rnam par rtog pas bdag tu 'dzin par gyur na ngan 'gro rnams su lhung zhing 'phags pa'i lam la sgrib par 'gyur bar dgongs pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par phye ste ma bstan to zhes 'byung ngo //🔽dgongs pa @246a * //
analyzed: de dag gi 'di la rnam par rtog pas bdag tu 'dzin par gyur na ngan 'gro rnams su lhung zhing 'phags pa'i lam la sgrib par 'gyur bar dgongs pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par phye ste ma bstan to zhes 'byung ngo // dgongs pa @246a * //
translated: If they were to grasp it as a self through conceptualization, the Transcendent Conqueror would think that they would fall into miserable realms and be obstructed from the noble path. Therefore, the Transcendent Conqueror did not teach it by analyzing it.

original: zab mo nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi le'u ste bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: zab mo nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi le'u ste bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is from the Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning, the fourth chapter on the characteristics of all phenomena.

original: // / bam po nyi shu gnyis pa /
analyzed: // / bam po nyi shu gnyis pa /
translated: CHAPTER FIVE🔽The Explanation of the Classifications of the Mahāyāna

original: le'u 'di rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: le'u 'di rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This chapter is also explained in two parts.

original: le'u nyid kyi ming rnam par bshad pa dang / mdo nyid kyi tshig gi don rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: le'u nyid kyi ming rnam par bshad pa dang / mdo nyid kyi tshig gi don rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the name of the chapter and the explanation of the meaning of the words of the sutra itself.

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi le'u zhes bya ba la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi le'u zhes bya ba la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: The chapter called The Characteristics of All Dharmas also has two explanations.

original: kha cig na re ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Some say that there are three natures,

original: gcig kho na ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gcig kho na ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: not just one, so it says all.

original: thams cad kyang rang gi ngo bo mtshan nyid 'dzin cing dpe lugs kyis sems can gyi shes pa bskyed pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang rang gi ngo bo mtshan nyid 'dzin cing dpe lugs kyis sems can gyi shes pa bskyed pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: All of them are called dharmas that hold their own characteristics and give rise to the consciousness of sentient beings by analogy.

original: mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /🔽ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste / ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: The characteristics are as follows.

original: yang na mtshan nyid ni dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: yang na mtshan nyid ni dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: Or the characteristics are the characteristics of shape.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: kun brtags la sogs pa ni chos thams cad kyi dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid yin pas mdor bsdu na ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum la thams cad ces bya ste /
analyzed: kun brtags la sogs pa ni chos thams cad kyi dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid yin pas mdor bsdu na ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum la thams cad ces bya ste /
translated: Since the imagined nature, etc., are the characteristics of the form of all things, in brief, all things are said to be the three natures.

original: 'di ni bdag po'i dbang du mdzad nas rnam par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag po'i dbang du mdzad nas rnam par bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation from the perspective of the dominant condition.

original: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid re rer gyur cing /🔽thams cad ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid re rer gyur cing / thams cad ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Thus, each is a nature and not all.

original: yang na kha cig na re de la chos thams cad ces bya ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na kha cig na re de la chos thams cad ces bya ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Or, some say: “All things” are, in brief, of two kinds:

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'o //
translated: conditioned and unconditioned, etc.

original: bsdus pa dang rgyas pa yang ma yin par ni lnga ste /
analyzed: bsdus pa dang rgyas pa yang ma yin par ni lnga ste /
translated: There are five that are neither included nor extensive:

original: sems dang sems las 'byung ba'i chos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las 'byung ba'i chos la sogs pa'o //
translated: mind, mental factors, etc.

original: rgyas par bya na chos brgyad de //
analyzed: rgyas par bya na chos brgyad de //
translated: If one wishes to be extensive, there are eight dharmas:

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad la sogs pa'o //
translated: the eight consciousnesses, etc.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum po 'di chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum po 'di chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since these three natures are the characteristics of the nature of all things,

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhe'o //
translated: It is the characteristic of all phenomena.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum las ngo bo nyid rnam pa snga ma gnyis ni thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum las ngo bo nyid rnam pa snga ma gnyis ni thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
translated: In accord with this explanation, the first two natures are said to be the characteristic of all phenomena, and the third is the basis of the characteristic.

original: ngo bo nyid gnyi ga yang chos thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gnyi ga yang chos thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first two natures are the characteristic of all phenomena because both natures are possessed by all phenomena.

original: phyi ma yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ces bya bas bdag po'i dbang du mdzad @246b nas bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi ma yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ces bya bas bdag po'i dbang du mdzad @246b nas bshad pa yin te /
translated: The third, the perfected nature, is the basis of the characteristic of all phenomena.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis of the characteristic because it is the characteristic of all phenomena.

original: de ltar bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod mod kyi /
translated: Although there are these two explanations,

original: bshad pa ni phyi ma bzang ste /
analyzed: bshad pa ni phyi ma bzang ste /
translated: the latter is the better explanation.

original: 'og nas mdo las gsungs pa dag dang rjes su mthun zhing 'gal ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'og nas mdo las gsungs pa dag dang rjes su mthun zhing 'gal ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is consistent with and does not contradict the sutra passages that will be cited below.

original: 'og nas mdo las kyang kun brtags dang / gzhan gyi dbang la thams cad ces gsungs shing yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la ni chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'og nas mdo las kyang kun brtags dang / gzhan gyi dbang la thams cad ces gsungs shing yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la ni chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The sutra itself says that all things are the imagined and the other-dependent, and it says that the reality of the perfected is the suchness of the sameness of all things.

original: le'u 'di las chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi rigs pa rgya cher ston par mdzad pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi le'u zhes bya'o //
analyzed: le'u 'di las chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi rigs pa rgya cher ston par mdzad pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi le'u zhes bya'o //
translated: This chapter is called “The Characteristics of All Dharmas” because it extensively teaches the logic of the characteristics of all dharmas.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' yon tan gyi tshal gyis zhus pa'i le'u zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' yon tan gyi tshal gyis zhus pa'i le'u zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In the Sutra Unraveling the Intention, this chapter is called “The Chapter Requested by the Noble Bodhisattva Guṇākara.”

original: rgya gar gyi dpe las tha dad pa 'di lta bu dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya gar gyi dpe las tha dad pa 'di lta bu dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there are such differences in the Indian texts.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' yon tan 'byung gnas kyis /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' yon tan 'byung gnas kyis /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Guṇākara

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: addressed the Bhagavat:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i ba'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes gsungs na zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa mdo'i tshig gi don yang dag par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i ba'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes gsungs na zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa mdo'i tshig gi don yang dag par bshad pa yin no //
translated: The passage beginning with “The Bhagavat has said: ‘The bodhisattva who is skilled in the characteristics of dharmas’” is the second, the correct explanation of the words of the sūtra.

original: yongs su brtag par bya ba'i yul la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yongs su brtag par bya ba'i yul la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The object of investigation is twofold:

original: don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i yul dang / yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi yul zhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i yul dang / yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi yul zhes bstan pa la /
translated: the object of ultimate and conventional truths and the object of the nature of existence and nonexistence.

original: de yan chad du don dam pa dang / kun rdzob kyi yul rnam pa gnyis bstan nas /
analyzed: de yan chad du don dam pa dang / kun rdzob kyi yul rnam pa gnyis bstan nas /
translated: Up to this point, the two kinds of objects of the ultimate and the conventional have been taught.

original: 'di man chad ni yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi yul ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi yul ston par mdzad de /
translated: From here on, the object of the nature of existence and nonexistence is presented.

original: de yang sngar ni yod pa ni ngo bo nyid ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: de yang sngar ni yod pa ni ngo bo nyid ston par mdzad de /
translated: Moreover, previously the nature of existence was presented.

original: de ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum po nyid do //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum po nyid do //
translated: That is the nature of the three kinds of natures.

original: de'i 'og tu ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid ston par mdzad de /
translated: After that, the nature of nonexistence is presented.

original: de ni ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum po dag nyid do //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum po dag nyid do //
translated: These are the three types of unreality.

original: le'u gnyis po dag las kyang yod pa la brten nas med pa 'jog par mdzad de /
analyzed: le'u gnyis po dag las kyang yod pa la brten nas med pa 'jog par mdzad de /
translated: In the two chapters, the non-existence is established on the basis of existence.

original: de yang yod pa'i ngo bo nyid rtsa ba yin pas sngar ston par mdzad la /🔽med @247a * //
analyzed: de yang yod pa'i ngo bo nyid rtsa ba yin pas sngar ston par mdzad la / med @247a * //
translated: Moreover, since the reality of existence is the root, it is taught first.🔽The reality of non-existence is taught later,

original: pa'i ngo bo nyid ni yan lag yin pa'i phyir phyis ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo nyid ni yan lag yin pa'i phyir phyis ston par mdzad de /
translated: because it is a branch.🔽For this reason, in the Thirty Verses composed by Master Vasubandhu,

original: rigs pa de'i phyir slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i tshig le 'ur byas pa sum cu pa las /🔽ngo bo nyid ni rnam gsum gyis //
analyzed: rigs pa de'i phyir slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i tshig le 'ur byas pa sum cu pa las / ngo bo nyid ni rnam gsum gyis //
translated: it says:🔽The three types of unreality

original: ngo bo nyid med rnam gsum la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med rnam gsum la /
translated: are in regard to the three types of reality.

original: dgongs nas chos rnams thams cad ni //🔽ngo bo nyid med bstan pa yin //
analyzed: dgongs nas chos rnams thams cad ni // ngo bo nyid med bstan pa yin //
translated: With this intention, all things

original: zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: are said to be unreal.

original: le'u 'di gcig kyang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: le'u 'di gcig kyang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This chapter is also divided into two parts:

original: byang chub sems dpas zhu ba gsol ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pas lan yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas zhu ba gsol ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pas lan yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
translated: the Bodhisattva’s request and the Tathāgata’s reply.

original: zhu ba gsol ba la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The request is also divided into two parts:

original: gang zhu ba bstan pa nyid smos pa dang / bstan pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhu ba gsol ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhu ba bstan pa nyid smos pa dang / bstan pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhu ba gsol ba ste /
translated: the statement of the request itself and the request for the teaching as it is.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: This statement of the sutra is also taught in two parts:

original: dus la brten nas zhu ba po dang lan gsungs pa'i rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: dus la brten nas zhu ba po dang lan gsungs pa'i rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: the differentiation of the questioner and the answerer in dependence on time and the differentiation of the question and the answer in dependence on the meaning.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba bstan pa'i mdo las yon tan gyi tshal zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar yon tan gyis gang zag yongs su smin par byed pa ji ltar shing mang po las tshal du gyur pa bzhin pas na dpe dang don gnyi ga
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba bstan pa'i mdo las yon tan gyi tshal zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar yon tan gyis gang zag yongs su smin par byed pa ji ltar shing mang po las tshal du gyur pa bzhin pas na dpe dang don gnyi ga
translated: The teaching of the sutra Unraveling the Intent states that “grove of qualities” means that just as a grove is formed from many trees, so a person is ripened by many qualities.

original: smos pa'i phyir yon tan gyi tshal zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: smos pa'i phyir yon tan gyi tshal zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is called a “grove of qualities” because both the example and the meaning are mentioned.

original: 'dir yon tan 'byung gnas zhes bya ba ni bskal ba dpag tu med pa nas yon tan gyi rgyu bsags pas 'di ni rgyu las ming du btags pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir yon tan 'byung gnas zhes bya ba ni bskal ba dpag tu med pa nas yon tan gyi rgyu bsags pas 'di ni rgyu las ming du btags pa ste /
translated: Here, “source of qualities” is a name imputed to the cause because the cause of qualities is accumulated for countless eons.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yon tan rnams kyi gzhi rnam pa gnyis bsags pa'i phyir yon tan 'byung gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yon tan rnams kyi gzhi rnam pa gnyis bsags pa'i phyir yon tan 'byung gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: The two kinds of accumulations of merit and knowledge are the basis of all good qualities, and so he is called the source of good qualities.

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni gang zhus ba'i bstan pa nyid smos pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni gang zhus ba'i bstan pa nyid smos pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is skilled in the characteristics of dharmas is the one who has asked the question, and he is referred to in the very next sentence.

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni brtag par bya ba'i chos bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni brtag par bya ba'i chos bstan pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of dharmas refers to the dharmas that are to be investigated.

original: mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i gang zag bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i gang zag bstan pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is skilled is the person who is to investigate.

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba ji tsam gyis na chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi lags /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba ji tsam gyis na chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi lags /
translated: To what extent is a bodhisattva skilled in the characteristics of dharmas called skilled in the characteristics of dharmas?

original: @247b de bzhin gshegs pa yang ji tsam gyis na de dag la chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes 'dogs lags /
analyzed: @247b de bzhin gshegs pa yang ji tsam gyis na de dag la chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes 'dogs lags /
translated: How much is it that the Tathāgata designates as the bodhisattva who is skilled in the characteristics of dharmas?

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bstan pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhu ba la gsol ba'o //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bstan pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhu ba la gsol ba'o //
translated: Having been asked this, he said: This is the second request for the teaching just as it is.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This statement of the sūtra is also divided into two parts:

original: gang zhu ba bstan pa nyid smos pa dang / ci tsam gyis na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhu ba nyid kyi tshig yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhu ba bstan pa nyid smos pa dang / ci tsam gyis na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhu ba nyid kyi tshig yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement of the request itself, and the statement of the request itself beginning with “How much is it that . . . ”

original: zhu ba gsol ba yang rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba yang rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: The request is also of two kinds:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs gang gdags pa zhu ba dang / gang la mkhas pa'i ming 'dogs pa zhu ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs gang gdags pa zhu ba dang / gang la mkhas pa'i ming 'dogs pa zhu ba'o //
translated: The request for the designation of the bodhisattva’s stage, and the request for the designation of the one who is skilled.

original: yang na snga ma ni rjod par byed pa'i don zhus pa'o //
analyzed: yang na snga ma ni rjod par byed pa'i don zhus pa'o //
translated: Or, the former is the request for the meaning that is expressed,

original: phyi ma ni rjod par byed pa'i bstan pa zhus pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma ni rjod par byed pa'i bstan pa zhus pa'o //
translated: and the latter is the request for the teaching that expresses it.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' yon tan 'byung gnas la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' yon tan 'byung gnas la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the Bodhisattva Gunakara.

original: gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas lan yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas lan yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
translated: From here on is the second, the Tathagata's true answer.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /🔽zhus pa las bsngags pa brjod nas bshad par gnas pa dang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te / zhus pa las bsngags pa brjod nas bshad par gnas pa dang 'di lta ste /
translated: This is also taught in two parts:🔽the praise of the questioner and the promise to explain, and from Thus have I heard...

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba man chad kyis zhus pa bzhin du lan yang dag par gsungs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba man chad kyis zhus pa bzhin du lan yang dag par gsungs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the true answer to the question.

original: dang po la yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: dang po la yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: The first is also divided into three parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan gsungs pa smos pa dang / zhu ba gsol pa'i phan yon gyi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / mnyan par bskul zhing bshad bar snang ba ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan gsungs pa smos pa dang / zhu ba gsol pa'i phan yon gyi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / mnyan par bskul zhing bshad bar snang ba ste /
