translated: the request for the question, the statement of the answer, the praise of the benefits of asking the question, and the exhortation to listen and the promise to explain.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas khyod de ltar skye bo tshad med pa la phan pa dang / bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mi dang / lha ma yin la sogs pa'i don dang / phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas khyod de ltar skye bo tshad med pa la phan pa dang / bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mi dang / lha ma yin la sogs pa'i don dang / phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir /
translated: You, O Fortunate One, are the source of qualities, and you have acted in this way for the benefit and happiness of countless beings, out of love for the world, for the sake of the benefit,🔽happiness, and welfare of gods, humans, and demigods.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'di ltar don zab mo 'dri ba ni legs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'di ltar don zab mo 'dri ba ni legs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: You who are a source of good qualities, in this way you have asked the Tathagata about this profound meaning for the benefit and happiness of countless beings, out of compassion for the world, and for the sake of gods, humans, asuras, and so on, for their benefit, happiness, and well-being.🔽Well done, well done!

original: gnyis pa zhu ba gsol pa'i phan yon gyi bsngags pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa zhu ba gsol pa'i phan yon gyi bsngags pa brjod pa'o //
translated: This is the second part, the praise of the benefits of requesting.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /🔽zhu ba gsol ba la phan yon che bar bsngags pa dang / don zab mo zhus pa'i legs @248a * //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste / zhu ba gsol ba la phan yon che bar bsngags pa dang / don zab mo zhus pa'i legs @248a * //
translated: This statement of the sutra is also divided into two parts:

original: ba'i bsngags pa ste /
analyzed: ba'i bsngags pa ste /
translated: the praise of the great benefits of requesting, and the praise of the excellence of requesting the profound meaning.

original: gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: As above, it should be understood.

original: khyod legs par nyon cig dang / ngas khyod la chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa mnyan par bskul zhing bshad par gnang ba'o //
analyzed: khyod legs par nyon cig dang / ngas khyod la chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa mnyan par bskul zhing bshad par gnang ba'o //
translated: Listen well, and I will explain to you the characteristics of phenomena. This is the third part, the exhortation to listen and the permission to explain.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:🔽The characteristics of phenomena are, in brief, of three kinds.

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum mo zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa bzhin du lan yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum mo zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa bzhin du lan yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the correct answer to the second question.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /🔽brtag par bya ba las brtsams nas /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste / brtag par bya ba las brtsams nas /
translated: This is also divided into two parts:🔽the first is from the beginning up to “the person who is to be examined”;

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed pa dang / gzhan yang yon tan 'byung gnas zhes bya ba man chad kyis brtags pa'i gang zag las brtsams nas mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed pa dang / gzhan yang yon tan 'byung gnas zhes bya ba man chad kyis brtags pa'i gang zag las brtsams nas mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: the second is from “the wise bodhisattva” on.

original: dang po la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: dang po la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The first part is also divided into two:

original: don bstan pa dang / dpes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don bstan pa dang / dpes bstan pa'o //
translated: the explanation of the meaning and the explanation by analogy.

original: don bstan pa la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: don bstan pa la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The explanation of the meaning is also divided into three:

original: sgo bstan nas bstan pa smos pa dang / grangs zhu zhing ming bkod pa dang / go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sgo bstan nas bstan pa smos pa dang / grangs zhu zhing ming bkod pa dang / go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
translated: the explanation of the door, the enumeration of the names, and the explanation of the order.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: mdor bsdus te gsungs pa'i bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis te dang po ni /
analyzed: mdor bsdus te gsungs pa'i bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis te dang po ni /
translated: The explanation of the brief statement is also twofold.

original: rgyas pa bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: rgyas pa bsdus pa ste /
translated: The first is the brief statement of the extensive.

original: bsdus pa ni chos thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsdus pa ni chos thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The brief statement is “all phenomena.”

original: rgyas pa ni chos yod mod kyi de yang mdor bsdu na ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni chos yod mod kyi de yang mdor bsdu na ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The extensive is “although phenomena exist, in brief they are the three natures.”

original: 'dir chos brgya la ltos nas /
analyzed: 'dir chos brgya la ltos nas /
translated: Here, with respect to the hundred dharmas,

original: de'i phyir mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: therefore it says “in brief.”

original: gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni /
translated: The second is

original: dgongs pa bsdus pas sdud pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa bsdus pas sdud pa zhes bya ste /
translated: called “the brief statement of the intention.”

original: de'i phyir / bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
translated: Therefore it says in the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “Thus,

original: shes bya'i mtshan nyid ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste zhes 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: shes bya'i mtshan nyid ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste zhes 'byung ba yin te /
translated: the characteristics of objects of knowledge are, in brief, threefold.”

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary by Master Niḥsvabhāva,

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: it says, “In brief, there are three types.”

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It says, “Thus,

original: chos thams cad ni mdor bsdu na yongs su shes par bya ba dang / yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba'i bye brag gi phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mdor bsdu na yongs su shes par bya ba dang / yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba'i bye brag gi phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: All dharmas are, in brief, to be fully understood, to be abandoned, and to be realized.🔽What are the three?

original: gsum gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs zhu zhing ming bkod pa @248b ste /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs zhu zhing ming bkod pa @248b ste /
translated: This is the second question, which lists the names.

original: 'di yang sngar ni grangs zhus pa de'i 'og tu ming bkod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang sngar ni grangs zhus pa de'i 'og tu ming bkod pa ste /
translated: This is also the question about the number, which is followed by the listing of the names.

original: 'di ni grangs zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni grangs zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the question about the number.🔽The imagined characteristic, the other-dependent characteristic, and the reality-as-it-is-characteristic.

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa ming bkod pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa ming bkod pa'o //
translated: This is the second listing of the names.

original: mtshan nyid gsum po de dag gi ming yang spyi dang bye brag yong de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum po de dag gi ming yang spyi dang bye brag yong de /
translated: The names of these three characteristics are general and specific.

original: de la mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ming ste /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ming ste /
translated: Among them, the three kinds of characteristics is the general name.

original: gsum pa ni grangs smos pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni grangs smos pa'o //
translated: The third is the mention of the number.

original: mtshan nyid ni bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The characteristic is the intrinsic nature of oneself.

original: yang mtshan nyid ni dbyings kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang mtshan nyid ni dbyings kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Again, definition is the definition of the realm.

original: rnam par bshad pa rnam pa drug las grangs dang bcas pa'i dbang du mdzad nas rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa rnam pa drug las grangs dang bcas pa'i dbang du mdzad nas rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: Among the six kinds of explanation, it is explained from the perspective of number.

original: zhib tu ni gzhan nas mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhib tu ni gzhan nas mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: In detail, it should be understood according to what appears in the teachings on the definitions elsewhere.

original: de la bye brag gi ming zhes bya ba yang dang po ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de la bye brag gi ming zhes bya ba yang dang po ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Among them, specific names are as follows: The first is the imagined characteristic.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
translated: In the treatise Compendium of the Great Vehicle,

original: ji ltar na kun brtags pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar na kun brtags pa yin la /
translated: it is asked, How is it imagined?

original: ci'i phyir na kun brtags pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na kun brtags pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called imagined?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa kun du rtog pa dpag tu med pa'i rnam pa can gyis phyin ci log 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir kun du brtags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa kun du rtog pa dpag tu med pa'i rnam pa can gyis phyin ci log 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir kun du brtags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called imagined because it arises from the error of the limitless aspects of imagination in the mental consciousness.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid yang dag par med pa la kun du rtog pa tsam du dmigs pas de'i phyir kun du brtags pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid yang dag par med pa la kun du rtog pa tsam du dmigs pas de'i phyir kun du brtags pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: Because it is observed as mere imagination in the absence of reality in its own characteristics, therefore it is called imagined.

original: 'dis ni dris pa rnam pa gnyis kyi lan cig car smos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni dris pa rnam pa gnyis kyi lan cig car smos pa yin no //
translated: This is the simultaneous answer to the two questions.

original: yang na go rims bzhin du dris tshig gnyis kyi lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na go rims bzhin du dris tshig gnyis kyi lan btab pa yin no //
translated: Or, it is the answer to the two questions in order.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Master Vasubandhu's commentary states:

original: dpag tu med pa'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having immeasurable aspects means

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: as follows:

original: spyod yul thams cad kyi rnam pa'i mtshan nyid do //🔽yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid la kun du rtog pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: spyod yul thams cad kyi rnam pa'i mtshan nyid do // yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid la kun du rtog pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The characteristic of all objects' aspects.🔽Imagination in the mental consciousness means

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid la kun du rtog pa zhes bya bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid la kun du rtog pa zhes bya bar bstan pa'o //
translated: it is taught that imagination is in the mental consciousness itself.🔽The characteristic of the arising of error means

original: phyin ci log 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: as follows:

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa phyin ci log gi dmigs par bya ba'i yul gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa phyin ci log gi dmigs par bya ba'i yul gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of the object that is the referent of unreal, inverted mental activity.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid yang dag par med pa zhes bya @249a * //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid yang dag par med pa zhes bya @249a * //
translated: The statement “the nonexistence of an intrinsic identity”

original: ba ni / de'i bdag nyid yang dag par med pa'o //
analyzed: ba ni / de'i bdag nyid yang dag par med pa'o //
translated: means the nonexistence of an intrinsic identity in reality.

original: kun du rtog pa tsam du dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni nor ba'i rnam par shes pas brtags pa nyi tshe yod par 'gyur ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa tsam du dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni nor ba'i rnam par shes pas brtags pa nyi tshe yod par 'gyur ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The statement “the referent that is mere imagination” means that it is only the object that is imagined by erroneous consciousness.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni /
translated: The master *Svabhāvatantra comments:

original: dpag tu med pa'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ni bdag dang / chos rnam pa sna tshogs mtha' yas pa yul du snang ba ste /🔽kha cig na re gzhan gyi dbang gi rgyu dang / rkyen gyi bdag dang / chos so zhes zer ba kha cig ni /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ni bdag dang / chos rnam pa sna tshogs mtha' yas pa yul du snang ba ste / kha cig na re gzhan gyi dbang gi rgyu dang / rkyen gyi bdag dang / chos so zhes zer ba kha cig ni /
translated: The statement “having an immeasurable aspect” means that the self and the various, infinite aspects of things appear as objects.🔽Some say that the self and things are the causes and conditions of the dependent nature.

original: kun brtags pa'i bdag dang chos so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i bdag dang chos so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the self and things are imagined.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa kun du rtog pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa kun du rtog pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The statement “the imagination of the mental consciousness” means that

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid la kun du rtog pa zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid la kun du rtog pa zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal is explained as the mind and mental factors.

original: phyin ci log 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyin ci log 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The characteristic of the occurrence of error is

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: as follows:

original: nor pa'i rnam par shes pa gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i don gyi rnam par 'byung ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: nor pa'i rnam par shes pa gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i don gyi rnam par 'byung ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of the occurrence of the consciousness that is mistaken with regard to the apprehended object and the apprehending subject is

original: kha cig na re /🔽kun du brtags pa'i yul gyi don gyi rnam pa las /
analyzed: kha cig na re / kun du brtags pa'i yul gyi don gyi rnam pa las /
translated: Some say that

original: phyin ci log nor pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i rgyu'o zhe'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log nor pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i rgyu'o zhe'o //
translated: the cause of the occurrence of the consciousness that is mistaken with regard to the apprehended object and the apprehending subject is the aspect of the object that is imagined.🔽Some say that the cause of the occurrence of the consciousness that is mistaken with regard to the apprehended object and the apprehending subject is the aspect of the object that is imagined.

original: kha cig ni kun du brtags pa dpag tu med pa'i rnam pa can dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyi lta ba dang / rgyu mtshan skyed pa'i rgyu'o zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni kun du brtags pa dpag tu med pa'i rnam pa can dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyi lta ba dang / rgyu mtshan skyed pa'i rgyu'o zhe'o //
translated: Some say that the cause of the generation of the view that has the characteristic of the other-dependent is the sign.

original: kun du brtags pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The imagined is explained as follows:

original: kun du rtog pa'i don gyi rnam pa nyid kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: kun du rtog pa'i don gyi rnam pa nyid kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The aspect of the object that is imagined is called the imagined reality.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni yang dag par med kyi /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni yang dag par med kyi /
translated: Its own nature does not exist in reality.

original: kun du brtags pa'i gzugs brnyan snang ba'i mtshan nyid kho na dmigs pa'i phyir kun du brtags pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i gzugs brnyan snang ba'i mtshan nyid kho na dmigs pa'i phyir kun du brtags pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is called imagined because it is the mere appearance of an imagined image, and because it is the object of the imagination.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni /
translated: The treatise Establishing Perception Only says:

original: kun du rtog pa'i phyir don gyi rnam pa nyid kun brtags zhes bya ste /🔽yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa la brtags pas phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa de dag thams cad la chos sam /
analyzed: kun du rtog pa'i phyir don gyi rnam pa nyid kun brtags zhes bya ste / yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa la brtags pas phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa de dag thams cad la chos sam /
translated: The form of an object is imagined because it is imagined.🔽Since it is imagined in unreal imagination, all those aggregates, elements, media, etc. are imagined in the specific natures of things or selves.

original: bdag gi ngo bo nyid du brtags pa'i bye brag la spyir kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //🔽kun du brtags pa de la yang //
analyzed: bdag gi ngo bo nyid du brtags pa'i bye brag la spyir kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o zhes 'byung ngo // kun du brtags pa de la yang //
translated: In general, it is called the imagined nature.

original: bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de //
analyzed: bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de //
translated: Imagined is also explained in two ways:

original: kha cig @249b na re rnam par shes pa brgyad dang sems las byung ba zag pa dang bcas pas bsdus pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa dag la rang gi ngo bo nyid du brtags pa'i phyir dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa lta bur snang ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: kha cig @249b na re rnam par shes pa brgyad dang sems las byung ba zag pa dang bcas pas bsdus pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa dag la rang gi ngo bo nyid du brtags pa'i phyir dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa lta bur snang ba'i phyir dang /
translated: Some say: The eight consciousnesses and contaminated mental factors are imaginary since they are imputed as the essential nature of false imagination, they appear as the apprehended object and apprehending subject and

original: kun gzhi la kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa brtags pa sa bon yod la dmigs par gyur pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: kun gzhi la kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa brtags pa sa bon yod la dmigs par gyur pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
translated: the root text explains that the imaginary nature imputed in the foundation consciousness exists as the seed of the apprehension of signs.

original: 'di ni slob dpon blo brtan gyis bshad pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni slob dpon blo brtan gyis bshad pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning explained by Sthiramati.

original: yang kha cig ni rnam par shes pa drug pa dang bdun pa'i sems kyi rnam pas bdag dang chos su 'dzin pa ni kun brtags pa yin pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig la kun du brtags pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: yang kha cig ni rnam par shes pa drug pa dang bdun pa'i sems kyi rnam pas bdag dang chos su 'dzin pa ni kun brtags pa yin pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig la kun du brtags pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: The apprehension of a self and phenomena by the sixth and seventh consciousnesses is imaginary because the root text explains that the imaginary nature exists only in the mental consciousness.

original: 'di ni slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa'i gzhung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa'i gzhung ngo //
translated: This is the explanation of the master Dharmapāla.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol pa'i mdo las ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyi mtshan nyid dang / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol pa'i mdo las ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyi mtshan nyid dang / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid ces 'byung ngo //
translated: The Sūtra Unraveling the Intention speaks of the characteristics of the unreal imagined, the characteristics of the cause and conditions dependent, and the characteristics of the ultimate consummate.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pas bsgyur ba'i bstan bcos rnam las ni rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / de kho na'i ngo bo nyid ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pas bsgyur ba'i bstan bcos rnam las ni rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / de kho na'i ngo bo nyid ces 'byung ngo //
translated: The treatise translated by the master Parahita states the characteristics of the imagined, the characteristics of the dependent, and the characteristics of the consummate.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: The noble Descent into Laṅkā Sūtra

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces 'byung pa ni lo ts'a ba dag gi bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces 'byung pa ni lo ts'a ba dag gi bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: speaks of the characteristics of the unreal, the characteristics of dependent origination, and the characteristics of the established.

original: 'dir kun brtags zhes bya ba yang brtags pa'i don dang sbyar na ni yongs su 'dzin pa gzung ngo /
analyzed: 'dir kun brtags zhes bya ba yang brtags pa'i don dang sbyar na ni yongs su 'dzin pa gzung ngo /
translated: Here, the term imagined is to be understood in terms of the meaning of imagination, which is to grasp.

original: kun brtags zhes brjod na ni bdag po'i dbang du byas te bshad pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags zhes brjod na ni bdag po'i dbang du byas te bshad pa'o //
translated: But if one says imagined, then it is explained in terms of the power of the other.

original: gal te brtags pa ngo bo nyid la ltos na ni las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te brtags pa ngo bo nyid la ltos na ni las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
translated: If one relies on the imagined nature, then it is explained in terms of the grasping of karma,

original: brtags pa nyid ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa nyid ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the imagined itself is the nature.

original: gnyis pa gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: gnyis pa gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba yang /
translated: The second, the other-dependent, is also so.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las gal te rnam par rig pa tsam don snang ba'i gnas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin na de ji ltar yin ci'i phyir na gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las gal te rnam par rig pa tsam don snang ba'i gnas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin na de ji ltar yin ci'i phyir na gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya zhe na /
translated: In the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna, it says, “If the other-dependent nature is the mere representation of consciousness appearing as objects, how is that so? Why is it called other-dependent?”

original: rang @250a * //
analyzed: rang @250a * //
translated: It is so

original: gi bag chags kyi sa bon las skye pa yin pas de lta bas na rkyen gzhan gyi dbang byed do //
analyzed: gi bag chags kyi sa bon las skye pa yin pas de lta bas na rkyen gzhan gyi dbang byed do //
translated: because it arises from the seeds of one’s own habitual tendencies, and therefore it is dependent on other conditions.

original: skyes nas kyang skad cig las lhag par bdag nyid gnas par mi nus pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: skyes nas kyang skad cig las lhag par bdag nyid gnas par mi nus pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because it cannot remain for a second moment after it has arisen, it is called “dependent.”

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las /
translated: Vasubandhu’s commentary explains:

original: rang gi rgyu dang rkyen las skyes la skyes nas kyang thang cig tsam du yang gnas par mi nus pas gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu dang rkyen las skyes la skyes nas kyang thang cig tsam du yang gnas par mi nus pas gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: It arises from its own causes and conditions, and because it cannot remain for a second moment after it has arisen, it is called “dependent.”

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In his commentary, Asvabhāva explains:

original: kun du brtags pa mngon par brjod pas yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon las skye ba dang / rang gi sa bon la brten nas gzhan dag skye ba'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ste //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa mngon par brjod pas yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon las skye ba dang / rang gi sa bon la brten nas gzhan dag skye ba'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ste //
translated: It is called “dependent” because it arises from the seed that is infused by the expression of imagination and because it arises from its own seed in dependence on other conditions.

original: 'dis ni de'i bdag nyid gzhan la brten nas skye bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni de'i bdag nyid gzhan la brten nas skye bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that it arises in dependence on another, which is its nature.

original: skyes nas kyang skad cig las lhag par bdag nyid gnas par mi nus zhes bya ba 'dis de'i bdag nyid gzhan la brten nas gnas par bstan te /
analyzed: skyes nas kyang skad cig las lhag par bdag nyid gnas par mi nus zhes bya ba 'dis de'i bdag nyid gzhan la brten nas gnas par bstan te /
translated: This shows that it remains in dependence on another entity.

original: rgyu 'di nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu 'di nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: For this very reason, it is called the dependent.

original: de la gnas pa zhes bya ba yang slob dpon mchog gi sdes bshad pa'i don dang sbyar na skyes nas skad cig phan chad logs shig tu gnas pa'i dus rnam pa gzhan la brten nas gnas pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de la gnas pa zhes bya ba yang slob dpon mchog gi sdes bshad pa'i don dang sbyar na skyes nas skad cig phan chad logs shig tu gnas pa'i dus rnam pa gzhan la brten nas gnas pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: With regard to that, “remaining” is explained as follows: having arisen, it remains in dependence on another entity, a different state, for a second moment and beyond.

original: slob dpon chos skyong gis bstan pa'i gzhung las ni skyes pa nyid ni skad cig tsam du yang bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir don gyi gnas pa zhes bshad do zhes ston te /
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong gis bstan pa'i gzhung las ni skyes pa nyid ni skad cig tsam du yang bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir don gyi gnas pa zhes bshad do zhes ston te /
translated: The master Dharmashri explains that the meaning of the treatise is that since it is active for just a moment, arising is called the “abiding of the object.”

original: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni rgyu la brten rkyen la ltos nas skye zhing 'phel zhing 'byung bas gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni rgyu la brten rkyen la ltos nas skye zhing 'phel zhing 'byung bas gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ste /
translated: Since compounded phenomena arise, increase, and occur in dependence on causes and in dependence on conditions, they are called dependent.

original: de'i phyir rab tu byed pa sum cu pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab tu byed pa sum cu pa las /
translated: Therefore, the Triṃśikā says,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid //🔽rnam rtog yin te rkyen las byung //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid // rnam rtog yin te rkyen las byung //
translated: The dependent nature

original: zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Is imagination, arising from conditions.

original: slob dpon chos skyong gis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong gis 'grel pa las /
translated: Ācārya Dharmāḥita’s commentary explains:

original: gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba ni rkyen las 'byung ba'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba ni rkyen las 'byung ba'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is called “dependent” because it arises from conditions.

original: gsum pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba yang bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
analyzed: gsum pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba yang bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
translated: The third, the nature of the perfected, is also taught in the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna:

original: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir mchog @250b gi don gyis yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir mchog @250b gi don gyis yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is called the nature of the perfected because it is the ultimate object, because it is not subject to change, because it is the object of purification, and because it is the supreme of all virtuous phenomena.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Ācārya Vasubandhu’s commentary explains:

original: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni brdzun pa'i dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni brdzun pa'i dngos po med pa ste /
translated: Because it does not change into something else, it is not a non-existent unreal thing.

original: brdzun pa med pa'i blon po bzhin no //
analyzed: brdzun pa med pa'i blon po bzhin no //
translated: It is like a non-existent minister who is not unreal.

original: mchog gi don gyi yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mchog gi don gyi yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is called the ultimate reality of the perfected.

original: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir dang / mchog gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir dang / mchog gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is called perfected because it is the object of pure knowledge and because it is the supreme nature.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel ba las ni yongs su rdzogs par grub cing de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel ba las ni yongs su rdzogs par grub cing de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In the commentary by Master Bhāviveka, it is said to be fully accomplished and the nature of reality.

original: mdor bsdus pas dpe ni ma bstan te /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas dpe ni ma bstan te /
translated: The analogy is not fully explained.

original: gzhan ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis bshad pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: gzhan ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis bshad pa dang mthun no //
translated: The other explanations are in agreement with Master Vasubandhu's explanation.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni stong pa nyid kyi bar du phye ba chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid yongs su rdzogs pa dang yongs su grub pa ni yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni stong pa nyid kyi bar du phye ba chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid yongs su rdzogs pa dang yongs su grub pa ni yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The treatise Establishing Knowledge-Only explains that the ultimate reality of phenomena, which is fully complete and fully established, is divided into emptinesses, and is called the “fully established nature.”

original: 'dis ni thams cad du brtags pa dang / bdag nyid brdzun pa ma yin par bstan cing rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / nam mkha' dang bdag la sogs pa las rnam par 'byed pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni thams cad du brtags pa dang / bdag nyid brdzun pa ma yin par bstan cing rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / nam mkha' dang bdag la sogs pa las rnam par 'byed pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: This shows that everything is not false, and distinguishes it from universals, particularities, space, self, and so on.

original: de la stong pa nyid gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid mdor bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid mdor bstan pa ste /
translated: The statement “it is divided into emptinesses” is a brief explanation of the essence of the ultimate reality.

original: don rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the “fully established nature” because it has three kinds of objects.

original: dang po ni yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The first is the fully complete.

original: 'dis ni kun du khyab pa'i don bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni kun du khyab pa'i don bstan te /
translated: This shows the meaning of its all-pervasiveness.

original: gzugs kyi thogs pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid las rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi thogs pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid las rnam par 'byed do //
translated: It is distinguished from the intrinsic identity of form, etc., as impeded, etc.

original: gnyis pa ni yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: The second is the perfected.

original: 'dis ni rtag pa'i don bstan te spyi'i mtshan nyid mi rtag pa la sogs pa las rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni rtag pa'i don bstan te spyi'i mtshan nyid mi rtag pa la sogs pa las rnam par 'byed do //
translated: This teaches the meaning of permanence, distinguishing it from the impermanence, etc., of the general characteristics.

original: de dag spyi'i mtshan nyid yin mod kyi rtag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag spyi'i mtshan nyid yin mod kyi rtag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although those are general characteristics, they are not permanent.

original: gsum pa ni chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: gsum pa ni chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: The third is the reality of things.

original: 'dis ni brdzun pa ma yin par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni brdzun pa ma yin par bstan te /
translated: This teaches the meaning of non-falseness,

original: nam mkha' dang mu stegs can gyi bdag la sogs pa las rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mu stegs can gyi bdag la sogs pa las rnam par 'byed do //
translated: distinguishing it from space, the self of the heterodox, etc.

original: de dag rtag tu khyab pa dang rtag par ston pa byed kyang brdzun pa yin @251a * //🔽pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rtag tu khyab pa dang rtag par ston pa byed kyang brdzun pa yin @251a * // pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although those are taught to be permanent and pervasive, they are false.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Moreover, in the treatise Establishing Perception-Only,

original: zag pa med pa'i 'dus pa'i phyin ci log dang gtan du bral ba nus pa khyad par can kun du khyab pa yang ming 'di thob pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i 'dus pa'i phyin ci log dang gtan du bral ba nus pa khyad par can kun du khyab pa yang ming 'di thob pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: and the uncontaminated, which is always free from error, and is the universal, special potency, also receives this name.

original: mdo 'di las ni dang por bstan pa yin gyi phyi ma ni ma yin no //🔽de la ming thob par rnam par bshad pa ni thams cad kyang las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: mdo 'di las ni dang por bstan pa yin gyi phyi ma ni ma yin no // de la ming thob par rnam par bshad pa ni thams cad kyang las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: This is the first explanation of the name, not the latter one.

original: kun brtags nas yongs su grub pa'i bar du kun kyang ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun brtags nas yongs su grub pa'i bar du kun kyang ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The explanation of the name as attainment is applicable to all, because all, from the imagined to the perfected, are realities.

original: chos rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni /🔽gnyis pa go rims bzhin du mtshan nyid gsum rnam par phye nas bshad pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni / gnyis pa go rims bzhin du mtshan nyid gsum rnam par phye nas bshad pa ste /
translated: What is the imagined reality of things?🔽From here on is the second explanation, the analysis of the three realities in order.

original: mtshan nyid gsum rnam par phye ste bshad pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du dbye'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum rnam par phye ste bshad pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du dbye'o //
translated: The analysis and explanation of the three realities is itself the threefold division.

original: mtshan nyid dang po yang zhus pa dang lan gyis bstan te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang po yang zhus pa dang lan gyis bstan te /
translated: The first characteristic is also taught by the question and the answer.

original: 'di ni dang po zhus pa'o //🔽'di lta ste chos thams cad la ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pas rang gi ngo bo nyid dang bye brag tu ji tsam du rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhus pa'o // 'di lta ste chos thams cad la ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pas rang gi ngo bo nyid dang bye brag tu ji tsam du rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the first question.🔽This is the second answer:

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad la yang dag par rang gi ngo bo nyid med kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad la yang dag par rang gi ngo bo nyid med kyang /
translated: Thus, although all phenomena are without a real intrinsic nature,

original: yang dag pa ma yin gyi sems kyi rjes su ming dang brdas bdag dang / chos kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin gyi sems kyi rjes su ming dang brdas bdag dang / chos kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: the intrinsic nature of the self and phenomena is established by names and signs that follow an unreal mind.

original: ji ltar kha cig bdag go zhes smra ba'am /
analyzed: ji ltar kha cig bdag go zhes smra ba'am /
translated: Thus, some say “self” or

original: yang na gzugs la sogs pa la bdag dang chos kyi rang bzhin ngo bo nyid ces 'dogs pa dang / kha cig brtags pa'i bdag go yang dag pa'i bdag go //
analyzed: yang na gzugs la sogs pa la bdag dang chos kyi rang bzhin ngo bo nyid ces 'dogs pa dang / kha cig brtags pa'i bdag go yang dag pa'i bdag go //
translated: some impute the nature of the self and phenomena to form and so on, saying “the imputed self,” “the real self,”

original: gzugs bstan du yod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs bstan du yod pa'o //
translated: “form is visible,”

original: bstan du med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag dang chos kyi bye brag tu brjod pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: bstan du med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag dang chos kyi bye brag tu brjod pa lta bu ste /
translated: The self and phenomena are described in terms of their nature and their particulars, as in it is undemonstrable and so on.

original: de ltar brdas rang gi ngo bo nyid dang / bye brag tu rnam par gzhag pas 'jig rten na sems can rnams rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar brdas rang gi ngo bo nyid dang / bye brag tu rnam par gzhag pas 'jig rten na sems can rnams rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in the world, sentient beings impute conventions in terms of the nature and particulars of phenomena.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /🔽yang dag pa ma yin pas phung po dang skye mched dang khams la sogs pa la bdag @251b dang chos kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid dang bye brag tu brtags pas na yang dag pa ma yin pa des na rang gi ngo bo nyid dam bye brag tu
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las / yang dag pa ma yin pas phung po dang skye mched dang khams la sogs pa la bdag @251b dang chos kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid dang bye brag tu brtags pas na yang dag pa ma yin pa des na rang gi ngo bo nyid dam bye brag tu
translated: The treatise Establishing Cognition-Only states:

original: brtags pa gang yin pa de ni mdor bsdu na kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: brtags pa gang yin pa de ni mdor bsdu na kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Since the aggregates, bases, and constituents and so on are imputed with the nature and particulars of the self and phenomena by that which is not real, that which is imputed as the nature or particulars of that which is not real is in brief called the imaginary nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid dang bye brag gi don rgya cher bshad pa ni theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid dang bye brag gi don rgya cher bshad pa ni theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation of the meaning of its own nature and its particulars should be understood according to the commentary on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle composed by the masters Vasubandhu and Nāgārjuna, and according to the Levels of Yogācāra.

original: chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa gzhan gyi dbang bstan to //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa gzhan gyi dbang bstan to //
translated: The second, the dependent nature, is taught by What is the dependent characteristic of phenomena? and so on.

original: 'di yang zhus pa dang lan gyis bstan te 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang zhus pa dang lan gyis bstan te 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba'o //
translated: This is also taught by question and answer. This is the question:

original: 'di lta ste chos thams cad kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'di lta ste chos thams cad kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid de /
translated: It is the dependent origination of all phenomena.

original: 'di yod pa'i phyir 'di yod la /
analyzed: 'di yod pa'i phyir 'di yod la /
translated: Because this exists, this occurs.

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba 'di lta ste /
translated: Because this arises, this arises.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas /
translated: For example, conditioned by ignorance, there are dispositions, and so on.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig pa 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig pa 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the second reply to the question.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye bas dang po ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye bas dang po ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: This statement of the sutra is divided into two parts. The first part teaches the nature of the general characteristic.

original: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, all the defilements of passion, action, and birth arise from dependent origination.

original: rkyen las skye ba'i phyir thams cad kyang gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen las skye ba'i phyir thams cad kyang gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya'o //
translated: And because they are born from conditions, all are called other-dependent.

original: gzhan gyi dbang de yang brjod na rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang de yang brjod na rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: And this other-dependence, when described, is twofold.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'o //
translated: It is the defilement and the purification.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise, the Establishment of Representation Only, says:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la kun kyang gzhan gyi dbang yin te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la kun kyang gzhan gyi dbang yin te /
translated: All, whether with or without impurity, are other-dependent.

original: rkyen mang po gzhan la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen mang po gzhan la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise in dependence on many other conditions.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa las rnam rtog yin te /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa las rnam rtog yin te /
translated: In the verse it says “conceptualization,”

original: rkyen las byung zhes bya bas ni re zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gzhan gyi dbang bstan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rkyen las byung zhes bya bas ni re zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gzhan gyi dbang bstan par rig par bya ste /
translated: and “arising from conditions” indicates the other-dependent that is the side of affliction.

original: mdo 'di las kyang de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan pa yin @252a * //
analyzed: mdo 'di las kyang de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan pa yin @252a * //
translated: In this sutra, affliction is taught in this way,

original: gyi rnam par byang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gyi rnam par byang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but purification is not.

original: de la 'di yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dngos po bstan nas /
analyzed: de la 'di yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dngos po bstan nas /
translated: Therein, the existence of this and so on indicates the basis,

original: rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
translated: and the explanation of the distinctions is as follows.

original: de la tshig snga ma gnyis bye brag yod pa yang thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ji skad du /
analyzed: de la tshig snga ma gnyis bye brag yod pa yang thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ji skad du /
translated: With regard to the first two phrases, although there are differences, the Treasury of Abhidharma says:

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig snga ma gnyis gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig snga ma gnyis gsungs she na /
translated: Why did the Bhagavat state the first two phrases?

original: smras pa / 'di yong ba'i phyir 'di yod la 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba rab tu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di yong ba'i phyir 'di yod la 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba rab tu bstan pa ste /
translated: Objection: This is taught in order to show that this exists because that exists and this arises because that arises.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rab nges pa nyid du shes pa'i phyir ma rig pa la brten nas ni 'du byed rnams yod par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rab nges pa nyid du shes pa'i phyir ma rig pa la brten nas ni 'du byed rnams yod par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: Since it is known that dependent origination is definite, formations exist in dependence on ignorance.

original: ma rig pa las gud na 'du byed rnams yod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: ma rig pa las gud na 'du byed rnams yod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: Since formations do not exist apart from ignorance.

original: gzhan yang yan lag rnams brgyud cing 'byung ba rab tu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang yan lag rnams brgyud cing 'byung ba rab tu bstan pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is taught that the members arise in sequence.

original: 'di ltar yan lag 'di yod pas yan lag de yod par 'gyur la yan lag de skyes pa'i dbang gis yan lag gzhan rnams kyang skye bar rab tu bstan pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar yan lag 'di yod pas yan lag de yod par 'gyur la yan lag de skyes pa'i dbang gis yan lag gzhan rnams kyang skye bar rab tu bstan pas so //
translated: Since this member exists, that member exists, and since that member arises, the other members arise.

original: gzhan yang mtha' gsum po dag tu skye ba rab tu bstan pa yin te /🔽sngon gyi mtha' la brten nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang mtha' gsum po dag tu skye ba rab tu bstan pa yin te / sngon gyi mtha' la brten nas /
translated: Moreover, it is taught that there is birth in the three times.🔽Since the present exists in dependence on the past,

original: da ltar mtha' yod par 'gyur ba yin pas /
analyzed: da ltar mtha' yod par 'gyur ba yin pas /
translated: the present exists.

original: da ltar gyi mtha' skyes pa'i dbang gis ni phyi ma'i mtha' skye bar rab tu bstan pas so //
analyzed: da ltar gyi mtha' skyes pa'i dbang gis ni phyi ma'i mtha' skye bar rab tu bstan pas so //
translated: The present limit is taught as the origination of the future limit by the power of birth.

original: gzhan yang nye bar brgyud pa'i rkyen gnyis rab tu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang nye bar brgyud pa'i rkyen gnyis rab tu bstan pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the two conditions of immediate succession are taught.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i de ma thag pa las 'du byed skye ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i de ma thag pa las 'du byed skye ba'am /
translated: Thus, the formations originate immediately after ignorance,

original: yang na phan tshun gyi stobs kyis 'du byed rnams skye bas so //
analyzed: yang na phan tshun gyi stobs kyis 'du byed rnams skye bas so //
translated: or the formations originate by the power of mutual dependence.

original: kha cig na re ma rig pa'i yan lag gi mjug thogs su 'du byed kyi yan lag 'byung ba ni de ma thag pa las skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re ma rig pa'i yan lag gi mjug thogs su 'du byed kyi yan lag 'byung ba ni de ma thag pa las skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Some say: The member of formations that occurs immediately after the member of ignorance is called origination from immediate succession.

original: 'du byed kyis ma rig pa skyes pa las lung du mi ston pa'i sems kyi 'og tu 'du byed kyi yan lag 'byung ba ni phan tshun stobs kyis 'du byed yan lag 'byung ba zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyis ma rig pa skyes pa las lung du mi ston pa'i sems kyi 'og tu 'du byed kyi yan lag 'byung ba ni phan tshun stobs kyis 'du byed yan lag 'byung ba zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: The member of formations that occurs after a neutral mind that arises from ignorance is called origination by the power of mutual dependence.

original: kha cig na re ma rig pa 'du byed la ltos pa ni de ma thag pa las skye ba zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re ma rig pa 'du byed la ltos pa ni de ma thag pa las skye ba zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Some say: The dependence of ignorance on the formations is called origination from immediate succession.

original: ma rig pa rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la ltos pa ni phan tshun gyi stobs kyis skye ba zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la ltos pa ni phan tshun gyi stobs kyis skye ba zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Ignorance in relation to consciousness, etc., is called “arising through mutual power.”

original: slob dpon gzhan kha cig @252b na re /
analyzed: slob dpon gzhan kha cig @252b na re /
translated: Some other masters say:

original: 'di ltar tshig gnyis po 'di ni rgyu med pa dang / rgyu rtag par smra ba gzhig pa'i ched du gsungs pa yin no zhes zer ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshig gnyis po 'di ni rgyu med pa dang / rgyu rtag par smra ba gzhig pa'i ched du gsungs pa yin no zhes zer ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: These two terms are stated in order to refute the theory of causelessness and the theory of a permanent cause.

original: so so nas rnam par gzhag pa dang gzhig pa yod pa dag ni bstan bcos de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: so so nas rnam par gzhag pa dang gzhig pa yod pa dag ni bstan bcos de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The existence of the establishment and refutation of each is like what appears in that treatise.

original: slob dpon rnams kyis tshig 'di gnyis bshad pa las 'byung ba tshig 'di gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / skye ba rab tu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon rnams kyis tshig 'di gnyis bshad pa las 'byung ba tshig 'di gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / skye ba rab tu bstan pa yin te /
translated: The masters explain that these two terms appear in the explanation of these two terms, and that these two terms are the teaching of the continuity of cause and effect and the teaching of arising.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa la brten nas 'du byed rnams rgyun mi 'chad de de ltar rgyun mi 'chad pa yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa la brten nas 'du byed rnams rgyun mi 'chad de de ltar rgyun mi 'chad pa yang /
translated: Thus, in dependence on ignorance, the formations are not interrupted. Thus, the continuity is not interrupted.

original: ma rig pa'i dbang gis skye ba'i phyir 'du byed rnams skye ba yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dbang gis skye ba'i phyir 'du byed rnams skye ba yin no //
translated: Because of the power of ignorance, the formations arise.

original: de bzhin du gcig gis gcig bskyed pa yang rgya cher bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gcig gis gcig bskyed pa yang rgya cher bshad par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, the mutual generation of the twelve members should be explained in detail.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang mthun pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang mthun pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive analysis should be understood according to the teaching in the treatise, the Correct System.🔽The treatise, the Levels of Yogic Deeds, also explains:

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang ci'i phyir 'di yod pa las 'di 'byung zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang ci'i phyir 'di yod pa las 'di 'byung zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called “when this exists, that comes to be”?

original: smras pa / rkyen ma spangs pa las de las gzhan pa skye ba'i don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / rkyen ma spangs pa las de las gzhan pa skye ba'i don gyi phyir ro //
translated: It is said: “Because it is the meaning of ‘arising from another’ when the condition is not abandoned.”

original: ci'i phyir 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called “because this has arisen, that arises”?

original: smras pa / rkyen mi rtag pa las de las gzhan pa skye ba'i don gyi phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: smras pa / rkyen mi rtag pa las de las gzhan pa skye ba'i don gyi phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said: “Because it is the meaning of ‘arising from another’ when the impermanent condition is abandoned.”🔽The treatise, the Compendium of Higher Knowledge, states:

original: bstan bcos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the characteristics?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: g-yo ba med pa las byung ba'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir dang / nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa las byung ba'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir dang / nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Because it arises from a cause that is not moving, because it arises from a cause that is impermanent, and because it arises from a cause that is capable, it has the characteristic of arising from a cause.

original: mtshan nyid de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di yod pas 'di 'byung 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di yod pas 'di 'byung 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba ste /
translated: Because it has this characteristic, the Lord has said, “When this exists, that comes to be; from the arising of this, that arises.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du'o //
translated: When ignorance exists, volitions come to be; and so on up to the arising of this great mass of nothing but suffering.”

original: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes bya bas ni g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las 'byung ba'i don bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes bya bas ni g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las 'byung ba'i don bstan pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “when this exists, that comes to be” indicates the meaning of arising from a cause that is not moving.

original: rkyen nyi tshe yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i chos yod par zad kyi 'bras bu 'byung bar bya ba'i rkyen g-yo ba ni ci yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rkyen nyi tshe yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i chos yod par zad kyi 'bras bu 'byung bar bya ba'i rkyen g-yo ba ni ci yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the effect exists only because its cause exists, and there is no moving cause whatsoever that brings the effect into existence.

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye @253a * //
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye @253a * //
translated: The phrase “from the arising of this, that arises” indicates the meaning of arising from a cause that is impermanent.

original: ba zhes pa ni mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i don bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ba zhes pa ni mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i don bstan pa yin te /
translated: The syllable ba indicates that the meaning of the sutra is that things arise from impermanent conditions.

original: chos gang yang ma byung ba'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gang yang ma byung ba'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established that any effect arises from a cause that has not arisen.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i don bstan te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i don bstan te /
translated: The phrase “conditioned by ignorance, there are the karmic predispositions” indicates that the meaning of the sutra is that things arise from conditions that have the capacity to produce effects.

original: chos rnams g-yo ba med cing mi rtag pa yin du zin kyang rkyen gang yang rung ba las 'bras bu thams cad mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos rnams g-yo ba med cing mi rtag pa yin du zin kyang rkyen gang yang rung ba las 'bras bu thams cad mi 'byung ste /
translated: Even though things are not permanent and are not moving, not all effects arise from any condition whatsoever.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: chos rnams kyi nus pa'i bye brag tha dad pas ji skad du /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi nus pa'i bye brag tha dad pas ji skad du /
translated: Because the capacities of things are distinct.

original: ma reg pa'i mthu'i phyir 'du byed rnams 'byung ba nas skye ba'i mthu'i phyir rga shi 'byung ba'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma reg pa'i mthu'i phyir 'du byed rnams 'byung ba nas skye ba'i mthu'i phyir rga shi 'byung ba'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: As it is said, “Because of the power of contact, the karmic predispositions arise. Because of the power of birth, aging and death arise.”

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' byams pas zhus pa'i bstan bcos las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' byams pas zhus pa'i bstan bcos las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive analysis should be understood according to the treatise requested by the noble bodhisattva Maitreya.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mdzod kyi bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mdzod kyi bstan bcos las /
translated: Therein, the statement “the great mass of suffering alone arises” is from the treatise on the Abhidharma Treasury.

original: de ltar 'ba' zhig ba zhes bya bas ni 'du byed tsam du zad kyi bdag dang bdag gi ni ci yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //🔽sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po zhes bya bas ni sdug bsngal bsags pa la thog ma dang tha ma med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'ba' zhig ba zhes bya bas ni 'du byed tsam du zad kyi bdag dang bdag gi ni ci yang med do zhes bstan pa'o // sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po zhes bya bas ni sdug bsngal bsags pa la thog ma dang tha ma med par bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase “alone” indicates that there are only formations, and that there is no self or anything that belongs to a self.🔽The phrase “great mass of suffering” indicates that there is no beginning or end to the accumulation of suffering.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po rnams skye bar bstan pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po rnams skye bar bstan pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The phrase “arises” indicates that the mass of suffering is produced.

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni gzhan yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i chos 'di dag la ni rtsa ba yang yod /🔽sdong bu yang yod /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni gzhan yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i chos 'di dag la ni rtsa ba yang yod / sdong bu yang yod /
translated: “These twelve factors of dependent origination have roots,🔽a trunk,🔽branches,

original: yal ga yang yod /🔽lo ma yang yod /
analyzed: yal ga yang yod / lo ma yang yod /
translated: leaves,

original: me tog kyang yod /
analyzed: me tog kyang yod /
translated: flowers,

original: 'bras bu yang yod pas shing ljon pa chen po ji lta ba bzhin no //🔽de la rtsa ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang yod pas shing ljon pa chen po ji lta ba bzhin no // de la rtsa ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: and fruits, like a great tree.

original: ma rig pa dang 'du byed do //🔽sdong bu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'du byed do // sdong bu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The roots are ignorance and formation.

original: ming dang gzugs so //🔽yal ga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs so // yal ga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The trunk is name and form.

original: skye mched drug go //🔽lo ma ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skye mched drug go // lo ma ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The branches are the six sense bases.

original: reg pa dang tshor ba'o //🔽me tog ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: reg pa dang tshor ba'o // me tog ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The leaves are contact and feeling.

original: srid pa dang len pa dang srid pa'o //🔽'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: srid pa dang len pa dang srid pa'o // 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The flowers are craving, grasping, and existence.

original: skye ba dang rga shi'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi'o //
translated: The fruits are birth, aging, and death.”

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan @253b lag bcu gnyis po'i chos kyi shing de yang kha cig la ni me tog dang 'bras bu chags pa yang yod /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan @253b lag bcu gnyis po'i chos kyi shing de yang kha cig la ni me tog dang 'bras bu chags pa yang yod /
translated: Some trees of the twelve factors of dependent origination have flowers and fruits,

original: kha cig la ni me tog dang 'bras bu med pa yang yod /
analyzed: kha cig la ni me tog dang 'bras bu med pa yang yod /
translated: some do not have flowers and fruits.

original: me tog dang 'bras bu yod pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: me tog dang 'bras bu yod pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those with flowers and fruits are

original: so so'i skye bo dang slob pa rnams so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang slob pa rnams so //
translated: ordinary beings and learners.

original: me tog kyang med 'bras bu yang med pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: me tog kyang med 'bras bu yang med pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those without flowers and fruits are

original: dgra bcom pa rnams so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: arhats.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang /🔽rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las gang ni sdug bsngal gyi myu gu lta bu yin /🔽gang ni sdug bsngal gyi myu gu yongs su bsrung ba lta bu yin /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las gang ni sdug bsngal gyi myu gu lta bu yin / gang ni sdug bsngal gyi myu gu yongs su bsrung ba lta bu yin /
translated: The Yogācāra Levels declares:🔽What is like a sprout of suffering in dependent origination?🔽What is like the protection of a sprout of suffering?

original: gang ni sdug bsngal gyi shing lta bu yin /
analyzed: gang ni sdug bsngal gyi shing lta bu yin /
translated: What is like a tree of suffering?

original: smras pa / ma rig pa dang 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa la sogs pa tshor ba la thug pa rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi myu gu lta bu yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / ma rig pa dang 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa la sogs pa tshor ba la thug pa rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi myu gu lta bu yin no //
translated: He says: The consciousnesses that begin with ignorance and the formations as conditions and end with feeling, which are like the sprout of suffering,

original: srid pa la sogs pa tshor ba'i rkyen las byung ba /
analyzed: srid pa la sogs pa tshor ba'i rkyen las byung ba /
translated: are produced from the condition of feeling, which begins with craving and ends with becoming.

original: srid pa las thug pa rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi myu gu yongs su srung ba lta bur blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa las thug pa rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi myu gu yongs su srung ba lta bur blta bar bya'o //
translated: The states that end with becoming, which are like the protection of the sprout of suffering,

original: skye ba dang rga shi ni sdug bsngal gyi shing lta bur blta bar bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi ni sdug bsngal gyi shing lta bur blta bar bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: should be seen as the tree of suffering, which begins with birth and ends with old age and death.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni rnam pa bcu gcig la brten nas gzhan gyi dbang ston te /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni rnam pa bcu gcig la brten nas gzhan gyi dbang ston te /
translated: The treatise called the Compendium of the Great Vehicle teaches the dependent on eleven aspects.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las de la gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /🔽gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pas sa bon gyur pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las de la gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste / gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pas sa bon gyur pa /
translated: Therefore, that very treatise says, The characteristic of the dependent is as follows:🔽It is the representations that are the seeds in the container consciousness,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pas bsdus pa'i rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pas bsdus pa'i rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: and are included in unreal imagination.

original: de yang gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are they?

original: lus dang lus can dang za ba po'i rnam par rig pa dang / des nye bar spyad pa'i rnam par rig pa dang / dus kyi rnam par rig pa dang / grangs kyi rnam par rig pa dang / yul gyi rnam par rig pa dang /
analyzed: lus dang lus can dang za ba po'i rnam par rig pa dang / des nye bar spyad pa'i rnam par rig pa dang / dus kyi rnam par rig pa dang / grangs kyi rnam par rig pa dang / yul gyi rnam par rig pa dang /
translated: They are the representations of body, embodied, and experiencer, the representations of their experience, the representations of time, the representations of number, the representations of place,

original: tha snyad kyi rnam par rig pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi bye brag gi rnam par rig pa dang / bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba'i rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi rnam par rig pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi bye brag gi rnam par rig pa dang / bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba'i rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: the representations of convention, the representations of the distinction between self and other, and the representations of good and bad destinies, death and rebirth.

original: de la lus dang lus can dang / zab po'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang / des nye bar spyad pa'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang / @254a * //
analyzed: de la lus dang lus can dang / zab po'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang / des nye bar spyad pa'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang / @254a * //
translated: Among them, the representations of body, embodied, and experiencer, the representations of their experience,

original: de'i nye bar spyad pa'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang / dus dang grangs dang yul dang / tha snyad kyis rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de dag ni mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyis bon las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i nye bar spyad pa'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang / dus dang grangs dang yul dang / tha snyad kyis rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de dag ni mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyis bon las byung ba'o //
translated: The representations of its enjoyments, the representations of time and number, the representations of place and convention, arise from the seed of the instinct for verbal expression.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi bye brag gi rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de ni bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags kyis bon las byung ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi bye brag gi rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de ni bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags kyis bon las byung ba'o //
translated: The representations of self and other arise from the seed of the instinct for the view of self.

original: bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de dag ni srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de dag ni srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The representations of good destiny, bad destiny, death, and birth arise from the seed of the instinct for the members of existence.

original: 'di ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ngo //
translated: This is the characteristic of the relative.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /🔽lus zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las / lus zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu,🔽it says:

original: mig la sogs pa'i khams lnga po dag go //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i khams lnga po dag go //
translated: “Body” means the five elements such as sight.

original: lus can zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lus can zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “Embodied” means

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: the afflicted mind.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: In his commentary, Master Svābhāvikaviṣṇu explains:

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po dag gi gnas yid kyi khams gang yin pa de ni lus can gyi rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po dag gi gnas yid kyi khams gang yin pa de ni lus can gyi rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The mind element, which is the basis of the five consciousnesses such as eye consciousness, is called the embodied cognition.

original: za ba po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: za ba po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “The experiencer” is

original: yid kyi khams so zhes bshad de /🔽slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas yid kyi khams gang yin pa de ni zab po'i rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yid kyi khams so zhes bshad de / slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas yid kyi khams gang yin pa de ni zab po'i rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: the mind element.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis des nye bar spyad par bya ba'i rnam par rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis des nye bar spyad par bya ba'i rnam par rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In his commentary, Master Svābhāvikaviṣṇu explains: The mind element, which is the basis of the mental consciousness, is called the experiencer’s cognition.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi skye mched drug go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi skye mched drug go //
translated: Master Vasubandhu explains: The cognition that is used is the six external bases such as form.

original: de'i nye bar spyod pa'i rnam par rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i nye bar spyod pa'i rnam par rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cognition of its use is🔽the six internal bases such as the eye.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams drug go //🔽dus kyi rnam par rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams drug go // dus kyi rnam par rig pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyun ma chad pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad de /

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /🔽dus kyi rnam par rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las / dus kyi rnam par rig pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dus gsum snang ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //

analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis grangs ni rnam par rig pa ni @254b 'di lta ste /

analyzed: bgrang ba'i ngo bo nyid do zhes 'byung ste /

analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis yul gyi rnam par rig pa ni /

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten no zhes bshad do //
