analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni grong dang kun dga' rab la sogs pa lta bur snang ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Master Bhāviveka’s commentary says, “It appears like a town, a pleasure grove, and so on.”

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis tha snyad kyi rnam par rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis tha snyad kyi rnam par rig pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: mthong ba dang thos pa dang bye brag byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad bzhi po dag go //

analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa de dag thams cad ni shes bya'i gnas las mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi bye brag gi rgyu byed do // bdag dang gzhan gyi bye brag gi rnam par rig pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: bye brag 'di nyid la brten pas sngar bshad pa'i bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags kyi bye brag gi rgyu byed do zhes bshad do /

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni lus la sogs pa rnam par rig pa la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i rgyun ma chad pas bdag dang bdag gi dang / gzhan dang gzhan gyi zhes 'dzin pa'i bye brag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni lus la sogs pa rnam par rig pa la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i rgyun ma chad pas bdag dang bdag gi dang / gzhan dang gzhan gyi zhes 'dzin pa'i bye brag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Vasubandhu explains:🔽The appearances of happy and miserable destinies,

analyzed: dbyig gnyen gyis bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i rnam par rig pa ni /
translated: death and birth,

analyzed: 'khor ba na 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi bye brag gang yin pa ste /
translated: are the various specific ways of going in saṃsāra.

analyzed: 'di yang sngar bshad pa'i srid pa'i yan lag gis yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon gyi bye brag go zhes bshad do //
translated: This is also a specific seed imbued with the links of existence explained above.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni /
translated: Master Bhāviveka’s commentary explains:

analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags kyi 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba lta bur snang ba'o zhes bshad de /
translated: It appears as if there is death and birth of gods, humans, hell beings, animals, and pretas.

original: rgya cher ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las bshad pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las bshad pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation should be understood according to the explanations in the commentaries composed by Vasubandhu and Asvabhāva.

original: rnam par rig pa 'di dag la bye brag yod pas /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa 'di dag la bye brag yod pas /
translated: Since there are distinctions among these consciousnesses,

original: yang slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel @255a * //
analyzed: yang slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel @255a * //
translated: the master Asvabhāva’s commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna says,

analyzed: pa las / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po dag gnas pa'i yid kyi khams ni lus can gyi rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o //

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas pa'i yid kyi khams gang yin pa de ni zab pa'i rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas pa'i yid kyi khams gang yin pa de ni zab pa'i rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The mind element that is the support of mental consciousness is called the consciousness that is profound.”

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: The master Asvabhāva’s commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna says,

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po dag gnas pa'i yid kyi khams zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po dag gnas pa'i yid kyi khams zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin te /
translated: “The mind element that is the support of the five consciousnesses such as visual consciousness is the foundation consciousness.

original: de nyid la lus can gyi rnam par rig pa zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la lus can gyi rnam par rig pa zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is the intention that this is called the consciousness that is embodied.”

analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas pa'i yid kyi khams zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de /

original: de nyid la zab po'i rnam par rig pa zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la zab po'i rnam par rig pa zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the term is that it is the basis of the mental consciousness.

analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis bshad pa ni 'di dang mi mthun pas nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni lus can gyi rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Vasubandhu explains that this is not the same as the above explanation, and that the afflicted mind is the consciousness that is embodied.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni zab po'i rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //🔽ci'i phyir de'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni zab po'i rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do // ci'i phyir de'i 'grel pa las /
translated: The storehouse consciousness is the consciousness that is deep.

original: lus can ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lus can ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Why is it that the Viniścayasaṃgraha passage says:🔽Embodied refers to

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
translated: the afflicted mind.

original: zab po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zab po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Deep refers to

original: yid kyi khams so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yid kyi khams so zhes 'byung ngo //

analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par rig pa 'di dag gi grangs la bye brag yod de /
translated: Moreover, there is a difference in the enumeration of these consciousnesses.

analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig dang / bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni bcu gcig go zhes 'byung /
translated: The Commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna says, “There is one type of non-concordant mental consciousness, and there are eleven types of mental consciousness that are established as cognition only.”

analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa nyid dang sbyar na ni nges pa med do //
translated: However, when it is applied to the Compendium of the Mahāyāna itself, there is no certainty.

original: gong du ni bcu gcig ces 'byung la 'og nas ni bcu gnyis zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gong du ni bcu gcig ces 'byung la 'og nas ni bcu gnyis zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Above, it says, “eleven,” and below, it says, “twelve.”

analyzed: 'di ltar bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i rnam par rig pa la gnyis su phye ba'i phyir te /

analyzed: 'di lta ste bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i rnam par rig pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: They are the cognition of happy and bad destinies and the cognition of death and rebirth.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la grangs tshad med pa'i phyir dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba myong ba la grangs tshad med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la grangs tshad med pa'i phyir dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba myong ba la grangs tshad med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore it says in that text, “Because the results of karma are immeasurable and because the experience of death and rebirth is immeasurable.”

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni /
translated: Master Bhāviveka’s commentary states:🔽“Happy rebirth, bad rebirth, death and rebirth,

original: bde 'gro dang ngan @255b 'gro dang 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan @255b 'gro dang 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba zhes 'byung ste /
translated: and return” are mentioned.

analyzed: phyir dang zhes bya ba bstan pa nyid kyis bcu gnyis su gyur par rig par bya'o //
translated: “And so on” indicates that there are twelve.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis ni /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis ni /
translated: Master Vasubandhu

analyzed: 'di'i 'grel pa ma mdzad pa'i phyir /
translated: did not write a commentary on this text,

analyzed: bcu gcig tu bshad kyang 'gal ba med do //

translated: The section beginning with “What is the thoroughly established nature of phenomena?” explains the third, the thoroughly established nature.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: zhus pa dang lan gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhus pa dang lan gsungs pa ste /

analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba'o // 'di lta ste /

analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa lan du gsungs pa'o //

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /

analyzed: ngo bo nyid yang dag par bstan pa dang / nus pa khyad par can bstan pa'o //
translated: The demonstration of the nature of reality and the demonstration of its special power.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /

analyzed: 'di ltar gong du thams cad du ro gcig pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Thus, it is said above that the reality of suchness is everywhere of one taste.

analyzed: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa dang sbyar na yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gnyis so zhes bshad de de'i phyir de nyid las yongs su grub pa 'di yang /
translated: When applied to the treatise, the Differentiation of the Middle and the Extremes, the fully present reality is explained as twofold. Therefore, that same text says:🔽This fully present reality,

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: in brief, is twofold,

analyzed: 'dus ma byas dang 'dus byas kyi bye brag yod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyis ni de bzhin nyid dang mya ngan las 'das pa bsdus te /

analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: because they are changeless, they are called fully present.

analyzed: 'dus byas kyis ni 'phags pa'i lam bsdus te /

analyzed: yul la phyin ci log med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //

analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las yongs su grub pa ni rnam pa bzhi'o zhes bshad de /
translated: The treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna explains that the consummate has four aspects.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: Therefore, that treatise also says, “How should the nature of the consummate be understood?

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnam pa bzhis bstan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnam pa bzhis bstan par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as being indicated by four dharmas of purification.🔽The four dharmas of purification are

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnam pa bzhi yang rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnam pa bzhi yang rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: the naturally pure,🔽suchness, emptiness, the perfect limit, the absence of signs, the ultimate, and the dharmadhātu.

original: de bzhin nyid dang stong pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / don dam pa dang / chos kyi dbyings so //🔽dri ma @256a * //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang stong pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / don dam pa dang / chos kyi dbyings so // dri ma @256a * //
translated: The purified that is free from stains is

analyzed: dang bral bas rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: the purified that is the abandonment of the two obscurations.🔽The purified that is the object of the two types of exalted wisdom is🔽the purified that is the object of the two types of exalted wisdom.

analyzed: de nyid sgrib pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'o de 'thob pa'i lam gyi rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The purification of the path to its attainment is as follows:

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: all the elements that contribute to enlightenment and the perfections, etc.

original: de skyed pa'i phyir dmigs pa rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de skyed pa'i phyir dmigs pa rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The purification of the objective supports that generate it is as follows:

original: theg pa chen po gya nom pa yang dag pa'i chos kyis bstan pa rnams te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po gya nom pa yang dag pa'i chos kyis bstan pa rnams te /
translated: the teachings of the Great Vehicle, which are the true Dharma.

original: 'di ltar de ni rnam par byang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni rnam par byang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not the imagined reality, because it is the cause of purification.

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the other-dependent reality, because it is the natural outcome of the extremely pure reality realm.

original: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad ma lus par bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad ma lus par bsdus pa yin no //
translated: All the elements of purification are included without exception in these four.

original: 'di la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'di la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two verses here.

original: byung brten sgyu ma la sogs bstan //
analyzed: byung brten sgyu ma la sogs bstan //
translated: The dependent is taught to be like an illusion, etc.

original: brtags la brten nas med pa bstan //🔽rnam par dag pa bzhir brten nas //
analyzed: brtags la brten nas med pa bstan // rnam par dag pa bzhir brten nas //
translated: The imagined is taught to be nonexistent in terms of the dependent.

original: yongs su grub pa bstan pa yin //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa bstan pa yin //
translated: The perfected is taught in terms of the four purities.

original: rang bzhin dang ni dri ma bral //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ni dri ma bral //
translated: The four characteristics are nature, freedom from defilement,

original: rnam dag lam dang dmigs pa ste //
analyzed: rnam dag lam dang dmigs pa ste //
translated: purity, and the path, and the object.

original: rnam dag chos ni thams cad kyang //🔽mtshan nyid bzhi po dag gis bsdus //
analyzed: rnam dag chos ni thams cad kyang // mtshan nyid bzhi po dag gis bsdus //
translated: All the pure dharmas

original: zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ste /
translated: are included in these four characteristics.

original: rgya cher ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This is extensively taught in the commentaries by Vasubandhu and Asvabhāva.

original: mdo 'di nyid las ni chos rnam pa gsum las brtsams nas ngo bo nyid gsum gyi don bstan to //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las ni chos rnam pa gsum las brtsams nas ngo bo nyid gsum gyi don bstan to //
translated: In this very sūtra, the meaning of the three natures is taught beginning with the three dharmas.

original: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni bden pa bzhi la brten nas ngo bo nyid gsum spyir ston to //
analyzed: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni bden pa bzhi la brten nas ngo bo nyid gsum spyir ston to //
translated: In the treatise Distinguishing the Middle from Extremes and Establishing Mere Representation, the three natures are generally taught based on the four truths.

original: bstan bcos mngon pa kun las btus pa las ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi chos rnam pa gsum la brten nas ngo bo nyid gsum spyir ston to //
analyzed: bstan bcos mngon pa kun las btus pa las ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi chos rnam pa gsum la brten nas ngo bo nyid gsum spyir ston to //
translated: The treatise Compendium of Abhidharma generally teaches the three natures in dependence on the three types of phenomena: aggregates, constituents, and sources.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las ni /
translated: The noble Perfection of Wisdom Sūtras

original: chos thams cad las brtsams nas ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum spyir ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: chos thams cad las brtsams nas ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum spyir ston par mdzad de /
translated: generally teach the three natures in terms of all phenomena.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Therefore Master Bhāviveka’s commentary says,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i @256b mdo las ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i @256b mdo las ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: “In the Perfection of Wisdom Sūtras, the Bhagavat said to the bodhisattva Maitreya:

original: gang gis rnam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po de dang de dag la kun du brtags pas gzugs so //
analyzed: gang gis rnam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po de dang de dag la kun du brtags pas gzugs so //
translated: ‘Whatever is imputed to this and that thing that has the character of an aspect is form,

original: tshor ba'o // 'du shes so //
analyzed: tshor ba'o // 'du shes so //
translated: feeling, discrimination,

original: 'du byed do //
analyzed: 'du byed do //
translated: compositional factors,

original: rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba'i bar du sems dang ming dang 'du shes la brten nas tha snyad 'dogs shing kun du brtags pas gzugs rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba'i bar du sems dang ming dang 'du shes la brten nas tha snyad 'dogs shing kun du brtags pas gzugs rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba nas /
translated: The intrinsic reality of form, up to the intrinsic reality of all buddhadharmas, are the imaginary form, up to the imaginary all buddhadharmas.🔽The intrinsic reality of form, up to the intrinsic reality of all buddhadharmas, are the imaginary form, up to the imaginary all buddhadharmas.🔽The intrinsic reality of form, up to the intrinsic reality of all buddhadharmas, are the imaginary form, up to the imaginary all buddhadharmas.🔽The intrinsic reality of form, up to the intrinsic reality of all buddhadharmas, are the imaginary form, up to the imaginary all buddhadharmas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i bar du btags pa gang yin pa 'di ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba nas kun brtags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba'i bar dag yin no //🔽gang gis rnam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po de dang de dag la rnam par rtog pa'i chos tsam mo zhes rnam par rtog pa la brten te /🔽rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid du rnam par gzhag nas spros pa bskyed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i bar du btags pa gang yin pa 'di ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba nas kun brtags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba'i bar dag yin no //🔽gang gis rnam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po de dang de dag la rnam par rtog pa'i chos tsam mo zhes rnam par rtog pa la brten te /🔽rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid du rnam par gzhag nas spros pa bskyed de /
translated: The intrinsic reality of form, up to the intrinsic reality of all buddhadharmas, are the imaginary form, up to the imaginary all buddhadharmas.🔽The intrinsic reality of form, up to the intrinsic reality of all buddhadharmas, are the imaginary form, up to the imaginary all buddhadharmas.🔽The intrinsic reality of form, up to the intrinsic reality of all buddhadharmas, are the imaginary form, up to the imaginary all buddhadharmas.🔽The intrinsic reality of form, up to the intrinsic reality of all buddhadharmas, are the imaginary form, up to the imaginary all buddhadharmas.🔽The intrinsic reality of form, up to the intrinsic reality of all buddhadharmas, are the imaginary form, up to the imaginary all buddhadharmas.🔽The intrinsic reality of form, up to the intrinsic reality of all buddhadharmas, are the imaginary form, up to the imaginary all buddhadharmas.

original: btags pa'i ming dang 'du shes kyi tha snyad btags nas 'di ni gzugs so zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: btags pa'i ming dang 'du shes kyi tha snyad btags nas 'di ni gzugs so zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The form that is imagined is that which is imagined by the conventional expressions of names and signs, such as “form” up to “all buddhadharmas.”

original: rnam par rtog pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes bya ba'i bar dag yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes bya ba'i bar dag yin no //
translated: The form that is conceptualized is that which is conceptualized by the conceptualization of the imagination, such as “form” up to “all buddhadharmas.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten du byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten du byung yang rung ste /
translated: Whether the Tathāgatas appear in the world or not,

original: chos nyid rnam par gzhag chos kyi dbyings rnam par gzhag nas kun du brtags pa des gzugs su btags pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs 'di dag ni //
analyzed: chos nyid rnam par gzhag chos kyi dbyings rnam par gzhag nas kun du brtags pa des gzugs su btags pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs 'di dag ni //
translated: the dharmadhātu is established, the reality realm is established, and the imagined form is designated by that imagination.

original: rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su 'di ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su 'di ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: These conceptualized forms are permanent, permanent time, eternal, eternal time, just this is thusness,

original: rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
translated: just this is the absence of intrinsic nature,🔽just this is the very limit of reality.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' nyid do zhes zer ba gang yin pa 'di ni chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' nyid do zhes zer ba gang yin pa 'di ni chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the form of reality.

original: kun brtags pa des sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces btags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun brtags pa des sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces btags pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all the qualities of the Buddha are designated by that imagination.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba 'di dag ni rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su zhes bya ba nas /🔽'di ni chos nyid kyi @257a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba 'di dag ni rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su zhes bya ba nas / 'di ni chos nyid kyi @257a * //
translated: These are called the imagined qualities of the Buddha, which are permanent, forever, eternal, and so on,🔽up to

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: This is called the qualities of the Buddha of reality.

original: rgya cher mdo las gsungs pa bzhin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rgya cher mdo las gsungs pa bzhin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: As it is extensively taught in the sutra.

original: de bzhin nyid 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rnams brtun pa'i brtson 'grus kyis rgyu dang rkyen byas pa'i phyir dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed cing legs par bsams pas rgyu dang rkyen byas pa'i phyir gdod de rtogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rnams brtun pa'i brtson 'grus kyis rgyu dang rkyen byas pa'i phyir dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed cing legs par bsams pas rgyu dang rkyen byas pa'i phyir gdod de rtogs so //
translated: Because bodhisattvas, through diligent effort, make causes and conditions, and through proper mental attention and good reflection, make causes and conditions, they eventually realize this suchness.

original: de rtogs nas gong nas gong du goms par byas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par gyur ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni gnyis pa nus pa khyad par can rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de rtogs nas gong nas gong du goms par byas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par gyur ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni gnyis pa nus pa khyad par can rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: Having realized that, by cultivating it more and more, it is perfected up to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. This shows the second, the special ability.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshogs kyi lam gyi gnas skabs na nan tan brtson 'grus bskyed pa dang / sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su phyin ci ma log par bsams pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis mthong ba'i lam gyi tshe gdod de rtogs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshogs kyi lam gyi gnas skabs na nan tan brtson 'grus bskyed pa dang / sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su phyin ci ma log par bsams pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis mthong ba'i lam gyi tshe gdod de rtogs la /
translated: Thus, on the stage of the path of accumulation, bodhisattvas generate the earnest effort of practice in suchness. On the stage of preparation, through the cause and condition of unmistaken reflection, they realize it at the time of the path of seeing.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la brten nas gong nas gong du goms par byas pas mthar phyin pa'i gnas skabs su gdod yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la brten nas gong nas gong du goms par byas pas mthar phyin pa'i gnas skabs su gdod yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: By relying on the path of meditation and cultivating it more and more, it is perfected at the time of culmination.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni nus pa rnam pa gsum ston te /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni nus pa rnam pa gsum ston te /
translated: In the Levels of Yogic Deeds, three types of ability are taught.

original: rnam par dag pa mngon du byed pa'i nus pa dang / 'ching ba gnyis rnam par dgrol ba'i nus pa dang / yon tan rab tu 'dren cing bskyed pa'i nus pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa mngon du byed pa'i nus pa dang / 'ching ba gnyis rnam par dgrol ba'i nus pa dang / yon tan rab tu 'dren cing bskyed pa'i nus pa ste /
translated: the potential to manifest complete purification, the potential to be liberated from the two bonds and the potential to induce and generate good qualities.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:

original: rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir dang / mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba thams cad las rnam par thar bar bya ba'i phyir dang / yon tan thams cad mngon par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir dang / mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba thams cad las rnam par thar bar bya ba'i phyir dang / yon tan thams cad mngon par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In order to purify, in order to be liberated from all bonds of signs and negative tendencies and in order to manifest all good qualities.

original: 'di dag go rims bzhin du mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam gsum dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di dag go rims bzhin du mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam gsum dang sbyar ro //
translated: These are respectively applied to the three paths of seeing and so on.

original: mtshan nyid gsum po 'di dag ngo bo nyid kyi yangs dog kyang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum po 'di dag ngo bo nyid kyi yangs dog kyang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: The three realities are also explained as having different natures.

original: re zhig slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i bshad pa dang sbyar na de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i bshad pa dang sbyar na de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: If we apply the explanation of the master Paramartha, the foundation consciousness is called the dependent nature.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun po dag ni kun du rtog @257b pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun po dag ni kun du rtog @257b pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The seven consciousnesses beginning with eye consciousness are called the imagined nature.

original: gzhan gyi dbang skye ba med pa dang / kun du rtog pa mtshan nyid med pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang skye ba med pa dang / kun du rtog pa mtshan nyid med pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The non-arising of the dependent and the characterlessness of the imagined are the perfected nature.

original: gzhan yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the eight consciousnesses beginning with eye consciousness are called the dependent nature.

original: de dag la rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa lta bur snang ba gang yin pa de ni kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de dag la rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa lta bur snang ba gang yin pa de ni kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The appearance of objects as signs to those consciousnesses is called the imagined nature.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skye ba med pa dang / kun du rtog pa mtshan nyid med pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skye ba med pa dang / kun du rtog pa mtshan nyid med pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The non-production of the other-dependent entity and the non-characteristic of imagination are the perfected entity.

original: gzhan yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag gis lta ba'i rnam pa dang / rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag gis lta ba'i rnam pa dang / rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the aspect of seeing and the aspect of the causal process of the eight consciousnesses such as the visual are called the other-dependent entity.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pas yul du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pas yul du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The apprehension of an unreal object is called the imagined entity.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skye ba med pa dang / kun du rtog pa'i mtshan nyid med pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skye ba med pa dang / kun du rtog pa'i mtshan nyid med pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad de /
translated: The non-production of the other-dependent entity and the non-characteristic of imagination are the perfected entity.

original: gong du bshad pa de las don rnam pa gnyis ni rigs pa dang sbyar na de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa de las don rnam pa gnyis ni rigs pa dang sbyar na de lta ma yin te /
translated: The two topics explained above are not so when applied to reason.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad dang / rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa rnams ni rkyen las skye bar mtshungs na ci'i phyir /🔽kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig la gzhan gyi dbang zhes bshad la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad dang / rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa rnams ni rkyen las skye bar mtshungs na ci'i phyir / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig la gzhan gyi dbang zhes bshad la /
translated: If the eight consciousnesses such as visual consciousness and the aspects of their causal signs are similar in being born from conditions, why is only the consciousness of the ālaya called the dependent?

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun la ni kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bshad /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun la ni kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bshad /
translated: Why are the seven consciousnesses such as visual consciousness explained as the imagined?

original: kun du rtog pa'i mtshan nyid med pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang skye ba med pa yang ngo bo nyid gnyis dang tha mi dad na ci'i phyir de dag la yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bshad /🔽'di la sogs pa'i skyon mang du yod de bshad kyis mi rdzogs so //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa'i mtshan nyid med pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang skye ba med pa yang ngo bo nyid gnyis dang tha mi dad na ci'i phyir de dag la yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bshad / 'di la sogs pa'i skyon mang du yod de bshad kyis mi rdzogs so //
translated: If the dependent that is not born and the imagined that does not have the characteristics of imagination are not different from the two natures, why are they explained as the perfected nature?🔽There are many such faults, but I will not elaborate.

original: de las gzhan pa'i bshad pa rnams ni mangs kyis dogs te 'dir ma brjod do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i bshad pa rnams ni mangs kyis dogs te 'dir ma brjod do //
translated: I will not mention other explanations here, fearing too many words.

original: 'dir bstan pa rnams las ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum bstan pa de yang mdor bsdu na sgo rnam pa gnyis yod de /🔽dang po ni /
analyzed: 'dir bstan pa rnams las ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum bstan pa de yang mdor bsdu na sgo rnam pa gnyis yod de / dang po ni /
translated: The three natures taught here are also summarized as two doors.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa la phyin ci ma log par yongs su 'dzin pa'i sgo ste /🔽'di ltar yang dag pa ma yin pas bdag dang chos yang dag par yod @258a * //🔽pa nyid du 'dzin pa de dag yod pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa la phyin ci ma log par yongs su 'dzin pa'i sgo ste / 'di ltar yang dag pa ma yin pas bdag dang chos yang dag par yod @258a * // pa nyid du 'dzin pa de dag yod pa ma yin yang /
translated: The first is the door of the non-erroneous comprehension of the thoroughly afflicted.🔽Thus, the apprehension of a self and phenomena as really and truly existent is explained as existent because it is established by an unreal mind,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sems kyis rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sems kyis rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa zhes bshad de /
translated: even though it does not exist.

original: de dag thams cad ni kun du brtags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni kun du brtags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: All of that is called the imaginary.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rkyen las skye ba thams cad ni gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rkyen las skye ba thams cad ni gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ste /
translated: All phenomena of the thoroughly afflicted that arise from conditions are called the dependent because

original: rgyu la brten cing rkyen la ltos nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la brten cing rkyen la ltos nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: they arise in dependence on causes and in reliance on conditions.

original: 'dus byas zag pa med pa la lam gyi bden pa dang / 'dus ma byas thams cad ni yongs su grub pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas zag pa med pa la lam gyi bden pa dang / 'dus ma byas thams cad ni yongs su grub pa zhes bya ste /
translated: All unconditioned phenomena are called the consummate nature.

original: rnam pa gnyis ka yang phyin ci ma log pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ka yang phyin ci ma log pa yin pa'i phyir ro // gnyis pa ni /
translated: Both of these are unmistaken.

original: rkyen las skye ba mi 'gyur bar yongs su 'dzin pa'i sgo ste /
analyzed: rkyen las skye ba mi 'gyur bar yongs su 'dzin pa'i sgo ste /
translated: The second is the door of grasping that does not change due to conditions.

original: 'di ltar yang dag pa ma yin pas bdag dang chos la sogs par 'dzin pa de dag ni sems kyi rjes su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag pa ma yin pas bdag dang chos la sogs par 'dzin pa de dag ni sems kyi rjes su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Since the grasping of self, phenomena, and so on is not real, it does not exist in the mind.

original: kun du brtags pa ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the imaginary nature.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'dus byas thams cad ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'dus byas thams cad ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: All contaminated conditioned phenomena are called the dependent nature.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ni 'gyur ba'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ni 'gyur ba'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The suchness that is the equality of all phenomena is called the consummate nature because it does not change.

original: sgo gong ma gnyis po 'di yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas 'phags pa'i gsung rab kha cig las snga ma bstan la /
analyzed: sgo gong ma gnyis po 'di yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas 'phags pa'i gsung rab kha cig las snga ma bstan la /
translated: Also, the two higher doors are explained differently in the teachings.

original: phyi ma ma yin pa yang yod de /🔽'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: phyi ma ma yin pa yang yod de / 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: Some scriptures of the noble Nāgārjuna teach the former but not the latter.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: The Descent into Laṅkā Sūtra says:

original: blo gros chen po yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid ni mi 'jig pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /🔽bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las kyang /
analyzed: blo gros chen po yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid ni mi 'jig pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste / bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las kyang /
translated: Mahāmati, because suchness and correct wisdom are indestructible, they are called the consummate nature.

original: 'di dang mthun par ston to //🔽'phags pa'i gsung rab kha cig las ni phyi ma bstan la /🔽snga ma ma yin pa yang yod de bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: 'di dang mthun par ston to // 'phags pa'i gsung rab kha cig las ni phyi ma bstan la / snga ma ma yin pa yang yod de bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: The treatise Differentiating the Middle and the Extremes also teaches in accordance with that.🔽Some scriptures of the noble Nāgārjuna teach the latter but not the former.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: The treatise Levels of Yogic Practice says:

original: ngo bo nyid gnyis pa du dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gnyis pa du dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: How many of the two natures are included?

original: smras pa / bzhis bsdus so //
analyzed: smras pa / bzhis bsdus so //
translated: It says: Four are included.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum pa du ngag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum pa du ngag gis bsdus she na /
translated: How are the three natures included in the three natures?

original: smras pa / gcig gis bsdus so zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig gis bsdus so zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is said that one includes the other.

original: bstan pa kha cig @258b las gnyis ka dang ldan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: bstan pa kha cig @258b las gnyis ka dang ldan pa yang yod de /
translated: Some scriptures say that both are included.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: In the treatise Establishing Cognition-Only,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: it is said:

original: rnam rtog yin te rkyen las byung //
analyzed: rnam rtog yin te rkyen las byung //
translated: “It is conceptual, arising from conditions.”

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: This is an example.

original: re zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gzhan gyi dbang bstan pa yin par bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gzhan gyi dbang bstan pa yin par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the explanation of the other-dependent in the aspect of affliction.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi gzhan gyi dbang ni yongs su grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi gzhan gyi dbang ni yongs su grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the other-dependent in the aspect of purification is the perfected.

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni /
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni /
translated: Or, all dharmas of mind and mental factors in the aspects of affliction and purification

original: kun kyang kun du rtog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kun kyang kun du rtog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: are called conceptual,

original: dmigs pa la sems gtod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa la sems gtod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they focus the mind on objects.

original: de nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gzhan gyi dbang thams cad ni 'dir bstan pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gis bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gzhan gyi dbang thams cad ni 'dir bstan pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gis bsdus pa yin te /
translated: Then all the other-dependent afflicted and pure phenomena are included in the dependent nature taught here.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las gzhan gyi dbang med na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las gzhan gyi dbang med na /
translated: Thus the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna says, “If there were no dependent nature,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba nyid 'grub par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba nyid 'grub par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
translated: afflicted and pure phenomena would not be established.”

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Ācārya Vasubandhu’s commentary says,

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun brtags su gyur ba'i tshe ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun brtags su gyur ba'i tshe ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur la /
translated: “Thus when the dependent nature becomes the imagined, it is afflicted.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i tshe ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i tshe ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur te /
translated: When it is free of conceptuality, it is pure.

original: cha gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid gcig tu mi 'grub po zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: cha gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid gcig tu mi 'grub po zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because it has two aspects, it is not established as a single nature.”

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par ston to //
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par ston to //
translated: Ācārya Nihsvabhāva also teaches in accordance with this.

original: mdo 'di las ni /
analyzed: mdo 'di las ni /
translated: This sūtra says,🔽“

original: phyi ma bstan gyi snga ma ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi ma bstan gyi snga ma ni ma yin te /
translated: The latter is taught, but not the former,

original: de bzhin nyid kho na la yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kho na la yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because suchness is said to be the consummate nature.

original: yang na snga ma bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na snga ma bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: Or else, the former is taught,

original: phyi ma ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi ma ni ma yin te /
translated: but not the latter,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kho na la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kho na la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because dependent origination is said to be the thoroughly afflicted phenomena.

original: yang na don gnyi ga dang yang ldan te bshad pa snga ma gnyis kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na don gnyi ga dang yang ldan te bshad pa snga ma gnyis kyi phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it has both meanings, because of the two previous explanations.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni /🔽ngo bo nyid gsum bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o /
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni / ngo bo nyid gsum bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o /
translated: Extensive analysis

original: // / bam po nyi shu gsum pa /
analyzed: // / bam po nyi shu gsum pa /
translated: should be understood according to the teaching of the three natures.

original: rigs kyi bu dper na skyes bu gang zag rab rib can gyi mig la rab rib @259a * //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dper na skyes bu gang zag rab rib can gyi mig la rab rib @259a * //
translated: Son of noble family, just as the eyes of a person with myodesopsia are affected by the fault of myodesopsia,

original: kyi skyon yod pa lta bur kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni /
analyzed: kyi skyon yod pa lta bur kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni /
translated: you should understand that the imagined nature is like that.

original: gnyis pa dpe smos nas bzlas te bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: gnyis pa dpe smos nas bzlas te bshad pa ston to //
translated: The second is the explanation by way of mentioning the example and repeating the question.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This also is divided into two parts:

original: rab rib dang mig yongs su dag pa'i spyod yul mtshan nyid gsum gyis dper bstan pa dang / rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba man chad kyis shel kha dog rnam par bzhir snang ba'i dper bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rab rib dang mig yongs su dag pa'i spyod yul mtshan nyid gsum gyis dper bstan pa dang / rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba man chad kyis shel kha dog rnam par bzhir snang ba'i dper bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching by way of the example of the three characteristics of the domain of the one with cataracts and the one with pure eyes, and the teaching by way of the example of the crystal appearing in four colors, beginning with “Son of noble family…”

original: dpe dang po gsum yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: dpe dang po gsum yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: The first three examples are also divided into three parts:

original: rab rib kyi skyon dang bcas pa'i dpe dang rab rib kyi mtshan ma sna tshogs kyi dpe dang / mig yongs su dag par rang bzhin gyi spyod yul la spyod pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: rab rib kyi skyon dang bcas pa'i dpe dang rab rib kyi mtshan ma sna tshogs kyi dpe dang / mig yongs su dag par rang bzhin gyi spyod yul la spyod pa'i dpe'o //
translated: the example of the one with the fault of cataracts, the example of the various signs of cataracts, and the example of the one with pure eyes who experiences the domain of the nature.

original: re re la yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: re re la yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: Each of these is taught by way of two parts:

original: dpe smos pa dang / dpe dang / don du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: dpe smos pa dang / dpe dang / don du sbyar ba'o //
translated: mentioning the example and applying the example to the meaning.

original: 'di ni dang po rab rib kyi skyon dang bcas pa'i dpe bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po rab rib kyi skyon dang bcas pa'i dpe bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the first, the teaching of the example of the one with the fault of cataracts.

original: dpe 'di'i don ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: dpe 'di'i don ni 'di skad du /
translated: The meaning of this example is as follows:

original: 'di ltar mig la rab rib yod pa'i dbang gis ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la rab rib yod pa'i dbang gis ni /
translated: In this way, due to the presence of eye disease,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / dus mtshungs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bskyed la /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / dus mtshungs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bskyed la /
translated: the eye consciousness and the mental consciousness that is simultaneous with it are produced.

original: rnam par shes pa 'di gnyis kyi dbang gis ni skad cig ma gnyis la rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas spu'i 'khor lo la sogs par shes so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di gnyis kyi dbang gis ni skad cig ma gnyis la rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas spu'i 'khor lo la sogs par shes so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Due to the power of these two consciousnesses, in two moments the conceptual mental consciousness perceives the circle of hair and so on.

original: spu'i 'khor lo de yang rnam pa gnyis te /🔽dang po ni /
analyzed: spu'i 'khor lo de yang rnam pa gnyis te / dang po ni /
translated: The circle of hair is also of two kinds.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas brtags pa yin gyi /🔽yang dag par na spu'i 'khor lor med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas brtags pa yin gyi / yang dag par na spu'i 'khor lor med pa ste /
translated: The first is imagined by the conceptual mental consciousness,

original: 'di nyid la /
analyzed: 'di nyid la /
translated: but in reality it does not exist as a circle of hair.

original: rab rib kyi skyon zhes bshad pas skyon 'dis kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dper bstan pa'o //🔽gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: rab rib kyi skyon zhes bshad pas skyon 'dis kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dper bstan pa'o // gnyis pa ni /
translated: This is explained as the fault of eye disease, and this is the example of the imagined nature.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas dang ltos pa nyid /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas dang ltos pa nyid /
translated: The second is the basis and the support of the conceptual mental consciousness.

original: spu'i 'khor lo'i mtshan nyid lta bur gyur pas /
analyzed: spu'i 'khor lo'i mtshan nyid lta bur gyur pas /
translated: The characteristic of the hair-circle is like that.

original: rab rib kyi mtshan ma sna tshogs la gzhan gyi dbang gi dper bstan te /
analyzed: rab rib kyi mtshan ma sna tshogs la gzhan gyi dbang gi dper bstan te /
translated: The various signs of eye disease are taught as examples of the dependent.

original: phyis 'og nas bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyis 'og nas bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Later, it should be understood as taught below.

original: 'dir ni / skyon la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dper bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir ni / skyon la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dper bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to teach the example of the imagined nature of faults,

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the characteristic of the imagined is also like that.

original: yang na rab rib kyi skyon zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na rab rib kyi skyon zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or, the so-called fault of eye disease

original: @259b rab rib nyid la skyon zhes bya ste /
analyzed: @259b rab rib nyid la skyon zhes bya ste /
translated: is the eye disease itself called a fault.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: That is to say,

original: 'di ltar brtags pa'i dbang gis gzhan gyi dbang bskyed pas /🔽ji ltar rab rib kyi dbang gis /
analyzed: 'di ltar brtags pa'i dbang gis gzhan gyi dbang bskyed pas / ji ltar rab rib kyi dbang gis /
translated: because the dependent is produced by the power of the imagined,

original: spu'i 'khor lo la sogs pa snang ba bzhin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: spu'i 'khor lo la sogs pa snang ba bzhin no zhes bstan te /
translated: just as the appearance of hair-circles and so on is due to the power of eye disease.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Therefore, in the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra it is said,

original: dper na / mig la rab rib la sogs pa'i skyon yod pa la ni /
analyzed: dper na / mig la rab rib la sogs pa'i skyon yod pa la ni /
translated: For example, for those with faults in the eyes such as cataracts,

original: skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa rab rib kyi mtshan ma mngon sum du dmigs kyi /
analyzed: skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa rab rib kyi mtshan ma mngon sum du dmigs kyi /
translated: The signs of blurred vision, such as the perception of floating hairs, are directly perceived.

original: gal te de'i skyon med na ni mi dmigs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: gal te de'i skyon med na ni mi dmigs pa bzhin te /
translated: If the eye were free of that fault, it would not perceive them, just as it does not perceive the hairs.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid tsam du zad kyi phyin ci log gis 'dzin pa ni med do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid tsam du zad kyi phyin ci log gis 'dzin pa ni med do zhes bshad do //
translated: It is said that the eye is reduced to its own nature alone, and there is no grasping of what is distorted.

original: ci'i phyir / gzhan gyi dbang mngon par zhen pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dpe bstan ce na smras pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir / gzhan gyi dbang mngon par zhen pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dpe bstan ce na smras pa /
translated: Why is the example of the dependent nature taught to be the nature of adherence?

original: nor ba med pa yongs su grub pa'i dper bstan pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //🔽rab rib dang bcas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pas /
analyzed: nor ba med pa yongs su grub pa'i dper bstan pa'i phyir nyes pa med do // rab rib dang bcas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pas /
translated: It is taught in order to show the example of the perfected nature, which is free from error.

original: spu'i 'khor lo mthong ngam zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: spu'i 'khor lo mthong ngam zhe na smras pa /
translated: Is the consciousness of the eye with blurred vision seen as the circle of hair?

original: rgya gar yul pa'i slob dpon dag gis bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: rgya gar yul pa'i slob dpon dag gis bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: The Indian masters explain this in two ways.

original: dang po slob dpon blo brtan gyi gzhung gis mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po dag kyang spu'i 'khor lo dang / zla ba gnyis pa la dmigs so zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dang po slob dpon blo brtan gyi gzhung gis mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po dag kyang spu'i 'khor lo dang / zla ba gnyis pa la dmigs so zhes bshad de /
translated: First, the treatise of Master Sthiramati explains that the five consciousnesses such as the eye consciousness also perceive the circle of hair and two moons.

original: de'i phyir chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
translated: Therefore, it is like the explanation in the Compendium of Abhidharma:

original: mig ser gyi nad kyis btab pa'i mig gi dbang po nyams pas sngon po la ser bor mthong ba lta bu'o zhes bshad pa bzhin no zhe'o //🔽gnyis pa ni slob dpon chos skyong gis mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yul yang dag pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig ser gyi nad kyis btab pa'i mig gi dbang po nyams pas sngon po la ser bor mthong ba lta bu'o zhes bshad pa bzhin no zhe'o // gnyis pa ni slob dpon chos skyong gis mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yul yang dag pa las 'byung ste /
translated: “The eye sense faculty damaged by jaundice sees blue as yellow.”

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
translated: The second is explained by the master Dharmapāla: The eye consciousness and so on arise from real objects because they are valid direct perception.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon gu na bh'a bas bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du bstan pa nyi shu pa'i brjed byang mdzad pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon gu na bh'a bas bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du bstan pa nyi shu pa'i brjed byang mdzad pa las /
translated: Therefore the master Guṇaprabha composed the Summary of the Twenty Verses on Representation Only:

original: bshad pa rnam pa gnyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: bshad pa rnam pa gnyis 'byung ste /
translated: “Two explanations occur.

original: de la kha cig na re rnam par shes pa lnga po dag ni yul yang dag pa kho na la dmigs te /
analyzed: de la kha cig na re rnam par shes pa lnga po dag ni yul yang dag pa kho na la dmigs te /
translated: Some say: The five consciousnesses focus on real objects alone.

original: de lta bas na chos mngon pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de lta bas na chos mngon pa'i mdo las /
translated: Therefore the Abhidharma Sūtra says:

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yang yul yang dag pa la mi dmigs par 'byung ba ni med do //🔽yid kyi rnam par shes pa la ni dmigs pa rnam pa @260a * //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yang yul yang dag pa la mi dmigs par 'byung ba ni med do // yid kyi rnam par shes pa la ni dmigs pa rnam pa @260a * //
translated: No visual consciousness, etc., arises without an object.

original: gnyis yod de /
analyzed: gnyis yod de /
translated: The mental consciousness has two kinds of objects:🔽real and unreal.

original: yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yul lo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa lnga po dag ni yul yang dag pa kho na la dmigs par rig par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yul lo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa lnga po dag ni yul yang dag pa kho na la dmigs par rig par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Thus, it is known that the five consciousnesses have only real objects.

original: kha cig na re rnam par shes pa lnga po dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa yang dmigs te /
analyzed: kha cig na re rnam par shes pa lnga po dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa yang dmigs te /
translated: Some say that the five consciousnesses have unreal objects,

original: de'i phyir mdo dag las nor ba'i mig gi dbang po dang / mig gi rnam par shes pas kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo dag las nor ba'i mig gi dbang po dang / mig gi rnam par shes pas kyang /
translated: because it is said in the scriptures that the eye sense-sphere and the eye consciousness,

original: nor ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'dren cing skyed par byed do //
analyzed: nor ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'dren cing skyed par byed do //
translated: even though they are not unreal, lead to and generate an unreal mental consciousness.

original: nor pa med pa'i mig gi dbang po dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa las kyang /
analyzed: nor pa med pa'i mig gi dbang po dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa las kyang /
translated: The eye sense-sphere and the eye consciousness,🔽even though they are not unreal, lead to and generate an unreal mental consciousness.

original: nor ba med pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'dren par byed do zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: nor ba med pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'dren par byed do zhes gsungs pas /
translated: It is the cause that generates the nonerroneous mental consciousness.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa lnga po dag zla ba gnyis pa dang / nam mkha' la me tog la sogs pa mthong ba yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa lnga po dag zla ba gnyis pa dang / nam mkha' la me tog la sogs pa mthong ba yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, the five consciousnesses are like the perception of a double moon and the perception of flowers in the sky, etc.

original: 'dir skyon la sogs pa bstan pa'i tshig 'di dag ni rnam pa gsum sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //🔽dper na rab rib can gyi gang zag de nyid la rab rib mang po'i mtshan ma skra'i 'khor lo 'am sbrang ma 'am /
analyzed: 'dir skyon la sogs pa bstan pa'i tshig 'di dag ni rnam pa gsum sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o // dper na rab rib can gyi gang zag de nyid la rab rib mang po'i mtshan ma skra'i 'khor lo 'am sbrang ma 'am /
translated: Here, the words “fault” and so on should be understood as the three kinds of faults explained above.

original: til gyi 'bru 'am /
analyzed: til gyi 'bru 'am /
translated: For example, for a person with eye disease, the signs of the disease appear as various things, such as a hair net, flies, sesame seeds,🔽or blue, yellow, red, white, and so on.🔽The dependent characteristic should be understood in the same way.

original: yang na sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po la sogs pa mtshan ma bye brag tu gyur ba snang ba lta bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gnyis pa rab rib kyi mtshan ma sna tshogs kyi dpe bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po la sogs pa mtshan ma bye brag tu gyur ba snang ba lta bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gnyis pa rab rib kyi mtshan ma sna tshogs kyi dpe bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the second example, of the various signs of eye disease.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyi dpe bstan pa yin pas de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyi dpe bstan pa yin pas de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: Since the example of the dependent nature has been taught, it should be understood in the same way.

original: 'di ltar rab rib can gyi gang zag la skra'i 'khor lo lta bu'i mtshan ma yang dag par yod pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar rab rib can gyi gang zag la skra'i 'khor lo lta bu'i mtshan ma yang dag par yod pa ma yin yang /
translated: Thus, although the sign of a circle of hair on the head of a person with myodesopsia does not exist in reality,

original: yang dag pa lta bur snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa lta bur snang ba'i phyir /
translated: it appears as if it does.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi dpe bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi dpe bstan te /
translated: Therefore, the example of the dependent nature is taught.

original: yod pa ma yin yang yod pa 'dra bar snang ba yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin yang yod pa 'dra bar snang ba yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It should be understood that although it does not exist, it appears as if it does.

original: dper na mig yongs su dag pa'i gang zag mig gi rab rib kyi skyon dang bral bar gyur bas mig yongs su dag pa de rang bzhin gyi spyod yul nor ba med pa la spyod pa lta bur ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin du
analyzed: dper na mig yongs su dag pa'i gang zag mig gi rab rib kyi skyon dang bral bar gyur bas mig yongs su dag pa de rang bzhin gyi spyod yul nor ba med pa la spyod pa lta bur ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin du
translated: For example, a person with completely clear eyes, free from the fault of myodesopsia, when their eyes are completely clear, experiences the natural range of objects without error. The completely existent nature should be understood in the same way.

original: rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa mig @260b yongs su dag pas rang bzhin gyi spyod yul la spyod pa'i dpe bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa mig @260b yongs su dag pas rang bzhin gyi spyod yul la spyod pa'i dpe bstan pa ste /
translated: “One should know” indicates the third example, the completely pure eye, which illustrates the enjoyment of the natural object.

original: ji ltar mig yongs su ngag pa des rang bzhin gyi spyod yul /
analyzed: ji ltar mig yongs su ngag pa des rang bzhin gyi spyod yul /
translated: Just as the completely pure eye enjoys the natural object,

original: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i gzugs rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i gzugs rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la spyod cing /
translated: the forms of blue, yellow, and so forth, which are naturally pure,🔽and just as the eye is free from the faults of myodesopsia, such as floaters,

original: spu'i 'khor lo la sogs pa rab rib kyi skyon med pa de bzhin du yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: spu'i 'khor lo la sogs pa rab rib kyi skyon med pa de bzhin du yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang de bzhin te /
translated: in the same way, the perfected nature is also like that.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag cing gzhan gyi dbang la 'dzin pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag cing gzhan gyi dbang la 'dzin pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the nature that is naturally pure and free from the apprehension of the dependent nature.

original: rigs kyi bu dper na shel yongs su dag pa la ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dper na shel yongs su dag pa la ni /
translated: Son of noble family, for example, a completely pure crystal

original: gal te tshon sngon po dang phrad par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te tshon sngon po dang phrad par gyur na /
translated: if it comes into contact with the color blue,

original: nor bu rin po che aanda rnyil dang mthon ka chen po lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che aanda rnyil dang mthon ka chen po lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: it will appear like a sapphire or a great lapis lazuli.

original: nor bu rin po che aanda rnyil dang mthon ka chen por log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed ces bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa shel kha dog rnam pa bzhir snang ba'i dpes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che aanda rnyil dang mthon ka chen por log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed ces bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa shel kha dog rnam pa bzhir snang ba'i dpes bstan pa'o //
translated: From here on is the second example, the crystal appearing as the four colors.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: This is also taught in two parts:

original: dpes bstan pa dang de bzhin du yon tan 'byung gnas zhes bya ba man chad kyis dpe dang don du sbyar ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dpes bstan pa dang de bzhin du yon tan 'byung gnas zhes bya ba man chad kyis dpe dang don du sbyar ba bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching through the example and the teaching of the application of the example and meaning from the source of good qualities up to the end.

original: dpes bstan pa yang dpe rnam pa bzhi yod pa nyid kyis rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: dpes bstan pa yang dpe rnam pa bzhi yod pa nyid kyis rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
translated: The teaching through the example is divided into four parts by the existence of four examples.

original: 'di ni dang po aanda rnyil dang mthon ka chen po dang mthun par gyur pa'i dpes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po aanda rnyil dang mthon ka chen po dang mthun par gyur pa'i dpes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the first teaching through the example, which is similar to sapphire and great lapis lazuli.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa lngar dbye zhing /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa lngar dbye zhing /
translated: This line of the sutra is also divided into five parts.

original: don rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pas don gyi ngo bo nyid gsum gyi dpe bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: don rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pas don gyi ngo bo nyid gsum gyi dpe bstan pa yin te /
translated: It is a teaching of the example of the three natures of the meaning, which has four parts.

original: de la rnam pa lngar dbye ba yang dang po yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi dper bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam pa lngar dbye ba yang dang po yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi dper bstan pa'o //
translated: The fivefold division of that is as follows: The first, called “pure,” is an example of the other-dependent.

original: gnyis pa tshon sngon po dang phrad par gyur na zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi dper bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa tshon sngon po dang phrad par gyur na zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi dper bstan pa ste /
translated: The second, “when it comes in contact with blue dye,” is an example of the latent propensities of verbalization.

original: 'dis ni gzhan gyi dbang mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags dang mthun par 'gyur bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan gyi dbang mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags dang mthun par 'gyur bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that the other-dependent is in conformity with the latent propensities of verbalization.

original: gsum pa nor bu rin po che aanda rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi dper bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa nor bu rin po che aanda rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi dper bstan pa yin te /
translated: The third, “a precious sapphire, a great lapis lazuli,” and so on, is an example of the other-dependent.

original: 'di ltar bdag dang chos su rnam par @261a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag dang chos su rnam par @261a * //
translated: Thus, the conceptualization of self and phenomena,

original: rtog pa dang mngon par brjod pa'i sa bon gyi stobs kyis nang gi rnam par shes pa la yod kyang phyi rol lta bur snang bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang mngon par brjod pa'i sa bon gyi stobs kyis nang gi rnam par shes pa la yod kyang phyi rol lta bur snang bar gyur pa'o //
translated: although existing in the internal consciousness, appears as if external, by the power of the seeds of verbalization.

original: bzhi pa nor bu rin po che aanda rnyil la sogs par 'dzin pas zhes bya bas ni log par 'dzin pa'i dbang gis yang dag pa nyid du yod par 'dzin par gyur pa'i dper bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa nor bu rin po che aanda rnyil la sogs par 'dzin pas zhes bya bas ni log par 'dzin pa'i dbang gis yang dag pa nyid du yod par 'dzin par gyur pa'i dper bstan pa'o //
translated: The fourth line, “because of grasping it as a sapphire, etc.,” teaches the example of the error of grasping it as really existent.

original: lnga pa sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed ces bya ba ni log par ston pa rnams bdag nyid kyis 'dzin pa gang yin pa des sems can rnams rmongs par byas nas yang dag pa'i shes pa bskyed pa'i dper bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pa sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed ces bya ba ni log par ston pa rnams bdag nyid kyis 'dzin pa gang yin pa des sems can rnams rmongs par byas nas yang dag pa'i shes pa bskyed pa'i dper bstan pa'o //
translated: The fifth line, “it causes sentient beings to be confused,” teaches the example of the confusion of sentient beings by the teachers of error, who themselves grasp it.

original: de la don rnam pa bzhi dang ldan par bstan pa ni 'og nas dpe dang don du sbyar ba'i skabs nas bshad pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: de la don rnam pa bzhi dang ldan par bstan pa ni 'og nas dpe dang don du sbyar ba'i skabs nas bshad pa dang sbyar na /
translated: The teaching of the four topics should be applied to the example and its meaning in the following passage:

original: dpe la rnam pa bzhi yod de dang po shel zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi dper bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dpe la rnam pa bzhi yod de dang po shel zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi dper bstan pa'o //
translated: There are four topics in the example: the first, “crystal,” teaches the example of the dependent.

original: gnyis pa tshon sngon po dang phrad par gyur na zhes bya ba ni sngon por brjod pa'i bag chags gzhan gyi dbang dang mthun par gyur pa'i dper bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa tshon sngon po dang phrad par gyur na zhes bya ba ni sngon por brjod pa'i bag chags gzhan gyi dbang dang mthun par gyur pa'i dper bstan pa'o //
translated: The second example, “when it comes in contact with blue”, illustrates the other-dependent pattern, which is in conformity with the habitual propensities for verbal expression of “blue”.

original: gsum pa log par 'dzin pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dzin pa po'i dper bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa log par 'dzin pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dzin pa po'i dper bstan pa'o //
translated: The third example, “even when it is grasped wrongly”, etc., illustrates the grasper.

original: bzhi pa ni des yongs su gzung ba gang yin pa de nyid sems kyi rjes su yod pa yin gyi don gyi tshul gyis yod pa ma yin pas yongs su grub pa'i dper bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni des yongs su gzung ba gang yin pa de nyid sems kyi rjes su yod pa yin gyi don gyi tshul gyis yod pa ma yin pas yongs su grub pa'i dper bstan pa yin no //
translated: The fourth example, “whatever is grasped by it exists only in the mind, not in the mode of the object”, illustrates the perfected.

original: de la don gyi rnam pa gsum gyi dper bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la don gyi rnam pa gsum gyi dper bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Therein, the illustration of the three patterns of the object is as follows:

original: tshon sngon po dang phrad par gyur pa na /
analyzed: tshon sngon po dang phrad par gyur pa na /
translated: “when it comes in contact with blue”, etc.

original: sems can rnams rmongs par byed ces bya ba'i bar gang yin pa des ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dper bstan to //
analyzed: sems can rnams rmongs par byed ces bya ba'i bar gang yin pa des ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dper bstan to //
translated: The passage up to “it causes sentient beings to be deluded” illustrates the imagined reality.

original: shel ni gzhan gyi dbang gi dper bstan to //
analyzed: shel ni gzhan gyi dbang gi dper bstan to //
translated: The crystal illustrates the other-dependent.

original: yang dag par aanda rnyil med pa ni yongs su grub pa'i dper bstan te /
analyzed: yang dag par aanda rnyil med pa ni yongs su grub pa'i dper bstan te /
translated: The perfectly pure sapphire is taught as an example of the perfected nature.

original: kha dog 'og ma gsum po dag kyang don 'di dang ldan pas de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kha dog 'og ma gsum po dag kyang don 'di dang ldan pas de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The three lower colors are also to be understood in the same way, since they have the same meaning.

original: de la shel yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la shel yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In this regard, the term “perfectly pure crystal”

original: rin po che'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rin po che'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: teaches the nature of the jewel.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
translated: The Sūtra Unraveling the Profound Intention says,

original: bee d'urya shin tu gsal ba zhes 'byung ba ni lo ts'a ba dag gis nor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bee d'urya shin tu gsal ba zhes 'byung ba ni lo ts'a ba dag gis nor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “perfectly clear vaidūrya,” but this is a mistake by the translators.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ri rab ri'i rgyal po ni rin po che sna bzhi @261b las mngon par grub pas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ri rab ri'i rgyal po ni rin po che sna bzhi @261b las mngon par grub pas 'di lta ste /
translated: The treatise Treasury of Abhidharma teaches, “Mount Meru, the king of mountains, is formed from four kinds of jewels:

original: gser dang dngul dang bee d'urya dang shel lo zhes bstan pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: gser dang dngul dang bee d'urya dang shel lo zhes bstan pa dang sbyar na /
translated: gold, silver, vaidūrya, and crystal.”

original: shel ni kha dog dmar po yin no //
analyzed: shel ni kha dog dmar po yin no //
translated: Crystal has a red color.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'og gi ngos ni rin po che me shel las mngon par grub pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'og gi ngos ni rin po che me shel las mngon par grub pa'o //
translated: Also, that same text says, “The lower side of the sun’s disk is formed from a jewel that is a fire crystal.”

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngos ni rin po che chu shel gyi kha dog sna tshogs dang ldan no //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngos ni rin po che chu shel gyi kha dog sna tshogs dang ldan no //
translated: The side of the moon's orb is of the color of various precious water crystals.

original: 'dir mdo 'di'i don ni re zhig kha dog dkar po dang sbyar nas kha dog bzhi zlas bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir mdo 'di'i don ni re zhig kha dog dkar po dang sbyar nas kha dog bzhi zlas bstan te /
translated: Here, the meaning of this sutra is that, for the time being, the four colors are indicated by the color white,

original: 'og nas mdo las dkar po zhes mi 'byung bas so //
analyzed: 'og nas mdo las dkar po zhes mi 'byung bas so //
translated: because the word white does not occur in the sutra below.

original: gal te tshon sngon po dang zhes bya bas ni gzugs kyi 'ching ba'i 'gyur pa bstan pa ste /
