analyzed: gal te tshon sngon po dang zhes bya bas ni gzugs kyi 'ching ba'i 'gyur pa bstan pa ste /
translated: If it is in contact with blue dye indicates the transformation of the bondage of form.

original: 'di ltar shel de tshon sngon po dang phrad par gyur na nor bu rin po che aanda rnyil dang mthon ka sngon po ltar snang bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar shel de tshon sngon po dang phrad par gyur na nor bu rin po che aanda rnyil dang mthon ka sngon po ltar snang bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Thus, when that crystal comes in contact with blue dye, it appears like a precious sapphire or blue beryl.

original: aanda rnyil ni lha'i dbang po'i kha dog sngon po'o //
analyzed: aanda rnyil ni lha'i dbang po'i kha dog sngon po'o //
translated: Sapphire is the blue color of the king of gods.

original: rin po che mthon ka chen po zhes bya ba ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu ste /
analyzed: rin po che mthon ka chen po zhes bya ba ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu ste /
translated: Great precious stone refers to the wish-fulfilling gem.

original: shel nyid la yid bzhin gyi nor bu zhes ston to //
analyzed: shel nyid la yid bzhin gyi nor bu zhes ston to //
translated: The crystal itself is indicated as the wish-fulfilling gem.

original: yang na aanda rnyil la sogs pa dang 'dra ba nyid nor bu yin no //
analyzed: yang na aanda rnyil la sogs pa dang 'dra ba nyid nor bu yin no //
translated: Or, the gem is similar to sapphire and so on.

original: log par 'dzin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyis btags pas yang dag par yod par 'dra bar snang zhing /
analyzed: log par 'dzin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyis btags pas yang dag par yod par 'dra bar snang zhing /
translated: “By false grasping” and so on are taught as examples of how worldly beings impute, and how the appearance of the self and phenomena as real exists in common.

original: gzhan dag la bsnyad de sems can rmongs par byed pa'i dper bstan pa'o //🔽de ni 'di skad du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bdag dang chos su 'dzin pa'i bag chags kyi stobs kyi dbang gis bdag dang chos lta bur gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan dag la bsnyad de sems can rmongs par byed pa'i dper bstan pa'o // de ni 'di skad du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bdag dang chos su 'dzin pa'i bag chags kyi stobs kyi dbang gis bdag dang chos lta bur gyur na /
translated: They are taught as examples of how the mind is deluded by explaining to others.

original: sems can rnams bdag dang chos yang dag pa nyid bzung bas sems can rnams rmongs par byed de ji ltar shel la yang dag par sngon po la sogs pa med pa bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la btags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa yang de
analyzed: sems can rnams bdag dang chos yang dag pa nyid bzung bas sems can rnams rmongs par byed de ji ltar shel la yang dag par sngon po la sogs pa med pa bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la btags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa yang de
translated: This is what is being taught: “If the foundation consciousness becomes like the self and phenomena by the power of the habitual propensities of grasping the self and phenomena, then sentient beings are deluded by grasping the self and phenomena as real. Just as there is no real blue color in a crystal, so the nature of the foundation consciousness, which is imputed, is also like that.

original: bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: It should be understood in that way.”

original: phyis 'og nas rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: phyis 'og nas rnam par 'byed do //
translated: This will be analyzed later.

original: gal te tshon dmar bo dang phrad par gyur na nor bu rin po che padma r'a ga lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing nor bu rin po che padma r'a ga lta bur log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do zhes bya ba
analyzed: gal te tshon dmar bo dang phrad par gyur na nor bu rin po che padma r'a ga lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing nor bu rin po che padma r'a ga lta bur log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do zhes bya ba
translated: If it comes into contact with red dye, it appears like a ruby, and sentient beings are confused by the misapprehension that it is a ruby.

original: ni gnyis pa tshon dmar po dang mthun par gyur pa'i dpes bstan pa ste snga ma @262a * //
analyzed: ni gnyis pa tshon dmar po dang mthun par gyur pa'i dpes bstan pa ste snga ma @262a * //
translated: This is the second example, which illustrates the conformity with red dye.

original: bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as before.

original: gal te tshon ljang gu dang phrad par gyur na ni nor bu rin po che margad lta bur snang bar gyur zhing /
analyzed: gal te tshon ljang gu dang phrad par gyur na ni nor bu rin po che margad lta bur snang bar gyur zhing /
translated: If it comes into contact with green dye, it appears like an emerald,🔽and sentient beings are confused by the misapprehension that it is an emerald.

original: nor bu rin po che margad du log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do zhes bya ba ni gsum pa tshon ljang gu dang mthun par gyur pa'i dpes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che margad du log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do zhes bya ba ni gsum pa tshon ljang gu dang mthun par gyur pa'i dpes bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the third example, which illustrates the conformity with green dye.

original: de la margad ces bya ba ni yul 'di ni ming med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la margad ces bya ba ni yul 'di ni ming med pa'i phyir //
translated: Here, emerald is a name for a country, because it is a place without a name.

original: ma bsgyur bar so na bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: ma bsgyur bar so na bzhag pa yin no //
translated: It is left as it is, without being changed.

original: kha cig na re 'di'i kha dog gsod pa'i rin po che zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di'i kha dog gsod pa'i rin po che zhes bya ste /
translated: Some say that this is the jewel that destroys color.

original: rin po che 'di'i dbang gis kha dog thams cad gsod cing nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: rin po che 'di'i dbang gis kha dog thams cad gsod cing nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Because of this jewel, all colors are destroyed and disappear.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni ljang gu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni ljang gu 'byung ngo //
translated: In the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning, it is said to be green.

original: gal te mtshon bya ser po dang phrad par gyur na ni gser lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing gser yang dag pa nyid du log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te mtshon bya ser po dang phrad par gyur na ni gser lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing gser yang dag pa nyid du log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it comes in contact with the color yellow, it appears as gold.

original: bzhi pa tshon ser po dang mthun par gyur pa'i dpes bstan pa'o //🔽dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / bye brag yod pa yang 'di las ni gser zhes 'byung la /
analyzed: bzhi pa tshon ser po dang mthun par gyur pa'i dpes bstan pa'o // dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / bye brag yod pa yang 'di las ni gser zhes 'byung la /
translated: This is the fourth example, which illustrates the way things are in accordance with the fourth color, yellow.🔽In the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning and in the Treasury of Abhidharma, it is called gold.

original: de las ni nor bu rin po che gser gyi kha dog tu gyur pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las ni nor bu rin po che gser gyi kha dog tu gyur pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In the Ornament of Abhidharma, it is called a precious jewel that has the color of gold.

original: dpe phyi ma rnam pa gsum yang snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dpe phyi ma rnam pa gsum yang snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The latter three examples should be understood in the same way as the former.

original: de bzhin du yon tan 'byung gnas ji ltar shel yongs su dag pa de la tshon dang 'brel ba yod pa lta bur gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad kyi bag chags kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya
analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan 'byung gnas ji ltar shel yongs su dag pa de la tshon dang 'brel ba yod pa lta bur gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad kyi bag chags kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya
translated: Thus, just as a pure crystal is associated with color, so the dependent characteristic is associated with the habitual tendency to designate the imaginary characteristic.

original: ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa dpe dang don du sbyar ba ston to //
analyzed: ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa dpe dang don du sbyar ba ston to //
translated: From here on is the second, showing the application of the example to the meaning.

original: 'di yang gong ma'i don rnam pa bzhi dang sbyar ba yin pas rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang gong ma'i don rnam pa bzhi dang sbyar ba yin pas rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into four parts, applying to the four topics above.

original: sa bon dang sbyar ba dang mtshan nyid kyi brtags pa dang sbyar ba dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang sbyar ba dang / yongs su grub pa dang sbyar ba dang / don rnam pa bzhi po 'di yang sngar gong du bstan pa'i dpe rnam pa lnga yod kyang don rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i phyir don rnam pa bzhis @262b gong ma'i dpe dang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: sa bon dang sbyar ba dang mtshan nyid kyi brtags pa dang sbyar ba dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang sbyar ba dang / yongs su grub pa dang sbyar ba dang / don rnam pa bzhi po 'di yang sngar gong du bstan pa'i dpe rnam pa lnga yod kyang don rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i phyir don rnam pa bzhis @262b gong ma'i dpe dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The four topics are applied to the five examples taught above because they have four topics in common with them.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: don rnam pa bzhi po de la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: don rnam pa bzhi po de la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two explanations of the four topics.

original: kha cig na re dang po gcig ni dmigs par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re dang po gcig ni dmigs par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Some say that the first is applied to the apprehension of the object,

original: de'i 'og ma gsum ni go rims bzhin du ngo bo nyid gsum dang sbyar ro zhe'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma gsum ni go rims bzhin du ngo bo nyid gsum dang sbyar ro zhe'o //
translated: and the latter three are applied to the three natures in order.

original: kha cig na re dang po gnyis ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dper bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re dang po gnyis ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dper bstan pa yin te /
translated: Some say that the first two are taught as examples of the imaginary nature,

original: 'di ltar sa bon gyi dbang gis btags pa snang bar gyur nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bon gyi dbang gis btags pa snang bar gyur nas /
translated: because, in dependence on the seed, the appearance of the designation arises.

original: btags pa nyid du mngon par grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: btags pa nyid du mngon par grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is established as a mere designation.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: shel la tshon dang 'brel ba yod pa'i don gyi phyir /
analyzed: shel la tshon dang 'brel ba yod pa'i don gyi phyir /
translated: because of the meaning of the connection of color with crystal,

original: shel la sngon po lta bur gzugs brnyan snang ba ltar de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang la yang dag pa ma yin pas btags pa'i sa bon gyi rgyu dang rkyen byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shel la sngon po lta bur gzugs brnyan snang ba ltar de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang la yang dag pa ma yin pas btags pa'i sa bon gyi rgyu dang rkyen byas pa'i phyir /
translated: just as the reflection of blue appears in the crystal, in the same way, because of the cause and conditions of the seeds of unreal imagination,

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa lta bu'i gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid snang ngo zhe'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa lta bu'i gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid snang ngo zhe'o //
translated: the dependent characteristic appears in the consciousness of the ground of all, like form, sound, and so on.

original: ji ltar shel yongs su dag pa de la aanda rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po dang / padma r'a ga dang / margad dang / gser la sogs pa'i log par 'dzin pa yod pa lta bur gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mtshungs pa'i mtshan nyid de /🔽btags pa rnam par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar shel yongs su dag pa de la aanda rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po dang / padma r'a ga dang / margad dang / gser la sogs pa'i log par 'dzin pa yod pa lta bur gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mtshungs pa'i mtshan nyid de / btags pa rnam par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the second similarity.

original: de dag la yang dag pa nyid du 'dzin te /
analyzed: de dag la yang dag pa nyid du 'dzin te /
translated: They apprehend those as real.

original: don de'i phyir gong ma gnyis ni don gyi rnam pa gsum las kun brtags pa dper bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don de'i phyir gong ma gnyis ni don gyi rnam pa gsum las kun brtags pa dper bstan pa yin no //
translated: For that reason, the first two identities are illustrated as examples of the imagined in relation to the three aspects of the object.🔽Just as there is a completely pure crystal jewel, so also the dependent identity should be understood as being like that.

original: ji ltar yongs su dag pa'i shel rin po che de lta bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa gzhan gyi dbang dang sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su dag pa'i shel rin po che de lta bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa gzhan gyi dbang dang sbyar ba ste /
translated: This is the third similarity, which is in relation to the dependent.

original: ji ltar shel yongs su dag pa sngon po la sogs pa lta bur snang ba de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang yang sa bon gyi dbang gis gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin du snang bar gyur ba'o //🔽ji ltar shel yongs su dag pa de nyid la yod pa'i aanda rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po dang / padma r'a ga dang / ma rgad dang gser yang dag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rtag pa rtag pa'i dus @263a * //
analyzed: ji ltar shel yongs su dag pa sngon po la sogs pa lta bur snang ba de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang yang sa bon gyi dbang gis gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin du snang bar gyur ba'o // ji ltar shel yongs su dag pa de nyid la yod pa'i aanda rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po dang / padma r'a ga dang / ma rgad dang gser yang dag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rtag pa rtag pa'i dus @263a * //
translated: Just as a clear crystal appears as blue, etc., in the same way, the other-dependent, by the power of the seed, appears as the characteristics of form, sound, etc.

original: dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su yongs su ma grub cing yang dag par rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa lta bur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bzhi ba yongs su grub pa dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su yongs su ma grub cing yang dag par rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa lta bur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bzhi ba yongs su grub pa dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: Just as the clear crystal itself, in the presence of lapis lazuli, sapphire, ruby, emerald, pure gold, etc., is not established as having the characteristics of those, and does not have a real intrinsic nature, etc., this is connected with the fourth, the perfected.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two aspects:

original: dpe snga ma bzlas te bstan pa dang / dpe dang don du sbyar ba nyid de 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: dpe snga ma bzlas te bstan pa dang / dpe dang don du sbyar ba nyid de 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: the repetition of the previous example, and the connection with the example and meaning itself. This is the first.

original: shel la sngon po la sogs pa yang dag par med pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: shel la sngon po la sogs pa yang dag par med pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: That which is not real blue, etc. in a crystal is also called the “perfected nature” and

original: yang dag par rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: is also called “devoid of a real, intrinsic essence.”

original: yang na yongs su ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na yongs su ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or else, “not perfected” means

original: sngon po la sogs pa dgag pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa dgag pa'o //
translated: the negation of blue, etc.

original: yang dag par rang gi ngo bo nyid med ces bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa med kyang /
analyzed: yang dag par rang gi ngo bo nyid med ces bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa med kyang /
translated: “Devoid of a real, intrinsic essence” means that although blue, etc. do not exist,

original: yang dag par shel gyi ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par shel gyi ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: it is taught that a crystal is not devoid of a real essence.🔽The imagined nature is not established in the dependent nature at any time, either in the eternal or the momentary, and it should be understood that the perfected nature is the dependent nature that is devoid of the imagined nature by way of a real, intrinsic essence.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su ma grub cing yang dag par rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dpe don dang sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su ma grub cing yang dag par rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dpe don dang sbyar ba ste /
translated: This is the second application of the example to the meaning.

original: gzhan gyi dbang la btags pa'i bdag la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la btags pa'i bdag la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The lack of reality of the self, etc. , which is imputed to the relative is called “lack of own-nature. ”

original: yang na gzhan gyi dbang la btags pa med kyang yang dag par rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyi dbang la btags pa med kyang yang dag par rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Or else, although the relative is not imputed, it is not really without own-nature.

original: rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “eternally, eternally” means

original: 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /🔽kha cig na re snga ma'i med pa la brten nas ni rtag pa rtag pa zhes gsungs so //🔽phyi ma phyi ma'i med pa la brten nas ni ther zug ther zug ces bya ba gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de / kha cig na re snga ma'i med pa la brten nas ni rtag pa rtag pa zhes gsungs so // phyi ma phyi ma'i med pa la brten nas ni ther zug ther zug ces bya ba gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: that there are two explanations of this.🔽Some say that “eternally, eternally” refers to the non-existence of the former,🔽and “constantly, constantly” refers to the non-existence of the latter.

original: kha cig na re yang dag par yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir ni rtag pa rtag pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: kha cig na re yang dag par yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir ni rtag pa rtag pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Others say that “eternally, eternally” is said in order to show that it is not really existent.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid med par bstan pa'i phyir ni ther zug ther zug ces bya ba gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid med par bstan pa'i phyir ni ther zug ther zug ces bya ba gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: The term “permanent” is used to show that they are not intrinsically real.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum po 'di dag dang de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun phan tshun ji ltar sdud ce na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum po 'di dag dang de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun phan tshun ji ltar sdud ce na /
translated: How are these three natures and the seven kinds of reality related to each other?🔽The treatise Establishing a Cognition-Only World explains:

original: smras pa / bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du ngo bo nyid gsum po @263b 'di dag dang de bzhin nyid bdun po dag phan tshun ji ltar sdud ce na /
analyzed: smras pa / bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du ngo bo nyid gsum po @263b 'di dag dang de bzhin nyid bdun po dag phan tshun ji ltar sdud ce na /
translated: How are these three natures and the seven kinds of reality related to each other?

original: de bzhin nyid bdun yang dang po 'jug pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid bdun yang dang po 'jug pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The seven kinds of reality are as follows:

original: 'dus byas kyi chos 'jug pa'i chos de kho na nyid do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos 'jug pa'i chos de kho na nyid do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The reality of engagement is the reality of the conditioned phenomena that are engaged.

original: de la 'dus byas kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la 'dus byas kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of conditioned phenomena.

original: dang po ni mtshan nyid bzhi po dag gis 'dus byas pa'i phyir 'dus byas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang po ni mtshan nyid bzhi po dag gis 'dus byas pa'i phyir 'dus byas zhes bya'o //
translated: The first is called conditioned because it is conditioned by the four characteristics.

original: gnyis pa ni nyon mongs pas byas pa'i phyir 'dus byas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nyon mongs pas byas pa'i phyir 'dus byas zhes bya ste /
translated: The second is called conditioned because it is conditioned by afflictions.

original: 'di ni nyon mongs pas byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nyon mongs pas byas pa'o //
translated: This is created by the afflictions.

original: gzhan yang de las de kho na'i mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de las de kho na'i mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, the suchness of that very thing is as follows:

original: bdag med pa nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: The suchness that is distinguished by selflessness.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi de bzhin nyid ni 'di lta ste /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos kyi rnam par rig pa'i de kho na nyid do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi de bzhin nyid ni 'di lta ste / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos kyi rnam par rig pa'i de kho na nyid do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The suchness of mere representation is as follows:🔽The suchness of the representation of phenomena that are afflicted and purified.

original: 'dir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rtog pa rnam par rig pa tsam du bsgom pa'i shes pa la de nyid du bzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rtog pa rnam par rig pa tsam du bsgom pa'i shes pa la de nyid du bzung ngo //
translated: Here, the knowledge that cultivates the mere representation of the concepts of affliction and purification is taken to be that suchness.

original: gzhan yang de la gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de la gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, the suchness of the basis of that is as follows:

original: sdug bsngal gyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: The suchness of suffering.

original: log par bsgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: log par bsgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The suchness of wrong practice is as follows:

original: kun 'byung ba'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the origin of suffering.

original: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The suchness of purification is as follows:

original: 'gog pa'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: This is the reality of cessation.

original: yang dag par bsgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The reality of perfect accomplishment is as follows:

original: lam gyi de kho na nyid do //🔽de kho na nyid bdun po 'di dag ni yongs su grub pas bsdus te /
analyzed: lam gyi de kho na nyid do // de kho na nyid bdun po 'di dag ni yongs su grub pas bsdus te /
translated: This is the reality of the path.

original: rtsa ba dang rjes las thob pa'i ye shes gnyis kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽mtshan nyid kyi rjes su bsdu na 'jug pa dang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba gsum ni ngo bo nyid snga ma gnyis kyis bsdus te /
analyzed: rtsa ba dang rjes las thob pa'i ye shes gnyis kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro // mtshan nyid kyi rjes su bsdu na 'jug pa dang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba gsum ni ngo bo nyid snga ma gnyis kyis bsdus te /
translated: These seven realities are subsumed by the consummate because they are the objects of the two kinds of gnosis, that obtained from the root and that obtained subsequently.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun nas nyon mongs par btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun nas nyon mongs par btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If they are subsumed according to their characteristics, the three of engagement, suffering and origin are subsumed by the former two natures because they are the imaginary and the dependent.

original: gzhan bzhi ni yongs su grub pas bsdus so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan bzhi ni yongs su grub pas bsdus so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The other four are subsumed by the consummate.🔽The treatise Distinguishing the Middle from Extremes says:

original: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las kyang bye brag gi de kho na nyid mdor bsdu na rnam pa bdun no //
analyzed: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las kyang bye brag gi de kho na nyid mdor bsdu na rnam pa bdun no //
translated: The reality of differentiation is summarized as sevenfold.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'jug pa'i de kho na dang / yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na dang / rnam par rig pa'i de kho na dang / gnas pa'i de kho na @264a * //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i de kho na dang / yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na dang / rnam par rig pa'i de kho na dang / gnas pa'i de kho na @264a * //
translated: the reality of engagement, the reality of correct signs, the reality of representation, the reality of abiding,

original: dang / log par sgrub pa'i de kho na dang / rnam par dag pa'i de kho na dang / yang dag par sgrub pa'i de kho na'o //
analyzed: dang / log par sgrub pa'i de kho na dang / rnam par dag pa'i de kho na dang / yang dag par sgrub pa'i de kho na'o //
translated: the reality of wrong practice, the reality of purification, and the reality of right practice.

original: de kho na nyid bdun po 'di dag rtsa ba'i de kho na nyid gsum po dag tu ji ltar bsdu bar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bdun po 'di dag rtsa ba'i de kho na nyid gsum po dag tu ji ltar bsdu bar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How are these seven realities subsumed in the three basic realities?

original: tshig le'ur byas pa las /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa las /
translated: In the Verses of Sravaka Levels it says:

original: 'jug pa dang ni gnas pa dang // log bsgrub dang po gnyis la brten //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ni gnas pa dang // log bsgrub dang po gnyis la brten //
translated: Engagement and abiding, wrong practice, based on the first two,

original: mtshan nyid rnam par rig pa dang // yang dag sgrub phyi ma la brten //🔽ces 'byung ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par rig pa dang // yang dag sgrub phyi ma la brten // ces 'byung ste /
translated: Signs, representation, and right practice, based on the latter two.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang 'di las 'byung ba bzhin du bsdu bar bshad pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang 'di las 'byung ba bzhin du bsdu bar bshad pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: This is explained in the Sravaka Levels and the Yogacarya Levels, and there is no contradiction.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum dang dngos po lnga po dag phan tshun bsdu ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum dang dngos po lnga po dag phan tshun bsdu ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are the three natures and the five things mutually included?

original: 'phags pa'i gsung rab dag las phan tshun bsdu bar bshad pa yang nges pa med de bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang sbyar na ni de las gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyis ni rgyu mtshan dang / ming dang rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gsung rab dag las phan tshun bsdu bar bshad pa yang nges pa med de bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang sbyar na ni de las gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyis ni rgyu mtshan dang / ming dang rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: In the scriptures of the noble ones, there is no definite explanation of their mutual inclusion. However, if we apply them to the Yogācārabhūmi, the dependent nature includes the reason, name, and conceptualization,

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes de dag bsdus so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes de dag bsdus so //
translated: and correct wisdom.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ni de bzhin nyid bsdus so //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ni de bzhin nyid bsdus so //
translated: The perfected nature includes suchness.

original: kun brtags pas ni dngos po lnga po gang yang ma bsdus so zhes bshad de /
analyzed: kun brtags pas ni dngos po lnga po gang yang ma bsdus so zhes bshad de /
translated: Imagination is not included in any of the five things.

original: de las zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos brjod par bya ba lta bur snang ba gang yin pa de ni rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos brjod par bya ba lta bur snang ba gang yin pa de ni rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
translated: In that text, the appearance of what is to be expressed by the defiled mind and mental factors is called the reason.

original: brjod pa 'dra bar snang ba gang yin pa de ni ming zhes gdags so //
analyzed: brjod pa 'dra bar snang ba gang yin pa de ni ming zhes gdags so //
translated: The appearance that resembles the expression is designated as the name.

original: snang bar byed pa'i sems la sogs pa la ni rnam par rtog pa zhes rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: snang bar byed pa'i sems la sogs pa la ni rnam par rtog pa zhes rnam par 'jog go //
translated: The mind that illuminates, etc. are posited as conceptual.

original: zag pa med pa'i sems la sogs pa spros pa dang bral ba'i phyir thams cad kyang yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o zhes bshad pas /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sems la sogs pa spros pa dang bral ba'i phyir thams cad kyang yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o zhes bshad pas /
translated: Since the uncontaminated mind, etc. are free from fabrication, all are called “realizing pristine wisdom.”

original: gzung 'dzin du mi ston cing bzhi po dag rkyen las skye bar ston pas thams cad kyang gzhan gyi dbang gis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin du mi ston cing bzhi po dag rkyen las skye bar ston pas thams cad kyang gzhan gyi dbang gis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Since it does not teach apprehended object and apprehending subject and teaches that the four are produced from conditions, all are included in the dependent.

original: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyis ni rgyu mtshan dang rnam par rtog pa bsdus so //
analyzed: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyis ni rgyu mtshan dang rnam par rtog pa bsdus so //
translated: The Treatise Differentiating the Middle and the Extremes explains that the dependent is included in the sign and conception.

original: kun du brtags pas ni ming kho na bsdus so //
analyzed: kun du brtags pas ni ming kho na bsdus so //
translated: The imagined is included in names alone.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de @264b bzhin nyid ni yongs su grub pas bsdu bar bshad de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de @264b bzhin nyid ni yongs su grub pas bsdu bar bshad de /
translated: Realizing pristine wisdom and suchness are included in the real.

original: de las zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
translated: The aspect of the causal-sign that is the cause of the defiled mind and mental factors is called the causal-sign.

original: gzhan ni rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The other is called imagination.

original: kun du brtags pa ni bdag nyid ci yang med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa rab tu bstan pa'i ched du btags pa tsam du ming zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa ni bdag nyid ci yang med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa rab tu bstan pa'i ched du btags pa tsam du ming zhes bya'o //
translated: Imagined is called a mere designation in order to demonstrate that it does not exist at all, because it has no nature of its own.

original: gnyis ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir yongs su grub pas bsdus so zhes ston pas so //
analyzed: gnyis ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir yongs su grub pas bsdus so zhes ston pas so //
translated: The other two are subsumed by the perfected because they are non-erroneous.

original: 'phags pa lang dkar gshegs pa'i mdo las /🔽gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyis ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang dkar gshegs pa'i mdo las / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyis ni /
translated: The noble Sūtra on Entering Lanka says,

original: rnam par rtog pa kho na bsdus so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa kho na bsdus so //
translated: The other-dependent nature is subsumed by imagination.

original: kun du brtags pas ni rgyu mtshan dang ming bsdus so //
analyzed: kun du brtags pas ni rgyu mtshan dang ming bsdus so //
translated: The imagined nature is subsumed by the causal-sign and name.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid ni yongs su grub pas bsdus par bshad de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid ni yongs su grub pas bsdus par bshad de /
translated: Correct pristine wisdom and suchness are explained as subsumed by the perfected.

original: de las sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu mtshan dang / lta ba'i rnam pa la sogs pa thams cad ni rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu mtshan dang / lta ba'i rnam pa la sogs pa thams cad ni rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: From that, all the reasons for mind and mental factors, and all the aspects of views, etc., are called “conceptualization.”

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i phyir kun du brtags pas brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba sems kyi rjes su rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de la ming dang / rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po gnyis zhes ston pas so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i phyir kun du brtags pas brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba sems kyi rjes su rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de la ming dang / rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po gnyis zhes ston pas so //
translated: Because they are the nature of unreal imagination, they are described as imagined, and the names and objects that are established in accordance with the mind are said to be the two things, names and reasons.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon dbyigs  gnyen gyis mdzad pa las ming ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon dbyigs  gnyen gyis mdzad pa las ming ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid du rtogs so //
translated: The commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna by master Vasubandhu explains: “Names are realized to be the dependent nature.

original: don ni kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs so zhes bshad de /
analyzed: don ni kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs so zhes bshad de /
translated: Objects are realized to be the imagined nature.”

original: de las zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu mtshan dang / lta ba'i rnam pa la sogs pa ming gi mthu'i dbang gis kun brtags mngon par 'grub pas na /
analyzed: de las zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu mtshan dang / lta ba'i rnam pa la sogs pa ming gi mthu'i dbang gis kun brtags mngon par 'grub pas na /
translated: The power of the name of the causal process of contaminated mind and mental factors, the aspect of the view, and so on, establishes the imaginary.

original: de'i phyir ming zhes bshad la /
analyzed: de'i phyir ming zhes bshad la /
translated: Therefore it is called name.

original: kun brtags kyi ming gi rjes su nan gyis brtags pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: kun brtags kyi ming gi rjes su nan gyis brtags pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: It is merely the intense investigation of the name of the imaginary,

original: ngo bo nyid yang dag par yod pa ma yin pas bsags pa tsam du don zhes bya'o zhes bstan pas so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yang dag par yod pa ma yin pas bsags pa tsam du don zhes bya'o zhes bstan pas so //
translated: but since it does not exist as a real entity, it is called the object that is merely an accumulation.

original: gong du bshad ma thag pa'i bstan pa bzhi po dag las dngos po lnga dang / ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum phan tshun bsdus pa bshad pa la tshig mi mthun pa 'dra yang don la ni 'gal ba med de /🔽slob dpon chos skyong @265a * //
analyzed: gong du bshad ma thag pa'i bstan pa bzhi po dag las dngos po lnga dang / ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum phan tshun bsdus pa bshad pa la tshig mi mthun pa 'dra yang don la ni 'gal ba med de / slob dpon chos skyong @265a * //
translated: From among the four teachings just explained, the five categories and the three kinds of nature are mutually inclusive.

original: gis ni bshad pa dang po mchog tu bzang ngo zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gis ni bshad pa dang po mchog tu bzang ngo zhes bshad de /
translated: The master Dharmashri explains that the first explanation is best.

original: 'dres pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Because it is not mixed.

original: gzhan bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: gzhan bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: The treatise Establishing a Direct Perception of Consciousness Only states:🔽The five characteristics taught in the scriptures of the noble ones🔽are included in the three natures.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.

original: 'phags pa'i gsung rab rnams las mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga'o zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gsung rab rnams las mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga'o zhes gsungs na /
translated: The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.

original: de dag dang ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum dang / phan tshun ji ltar bsdu zhe na brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa so so nas rang gi ngo bo nyid gsum dang ldan pas 'di lta ste /🔽yang dag pa ma yin pas brtags pa ni /🔽ngo bo nyid dang pos bsdus te /
analyzed: de dag dang ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum dang / phan tshun ji ltar bsdu zhe na brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa so so nas rang gi ngo bo nyid gsum dang ldan pas 'di lta ste / yang dag pa ma yin pas brtags pa ni / ngo bo nyid dang pos bsdus te /
translated: The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.

original: rgyu mtshan dang ming dang rnam par rtog pa ni ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang ming dang rnam par rtog pa ni ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.

original: brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du gtogs te /🔽de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i ye shes ni ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du gtogs te / de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i ye shes ni ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.

original: brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa ni yongs su grub par gtogs te /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa ni yongs su grub par gtogs te /
translated: The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.🔽The three natures are included in the two, the dependent and the real.

original: rjes las thob pa rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid lta bur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes las thob pa rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid lta bur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the subsequent attainment is characterized by expression.

original: mtshan nyid gnyis ni rgyu mtshan du gtogs pas ngo bo nyid dang po kho nas bsdus te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gnyis ni rgyu mtshan du gtogs pas ngo bo nyid dang po kho nas bsdus te /
translated: The two characteristics are included in the first nature alone, because they are included in the causal-sign.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa brtags pa'i don dang / ming ni nges par phan tshun 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa brtags pa'i don dang / ming ni nges par phan tshun 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the unreal imagination and the name are definitely mutually related.

original: des mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni gzhan dbang kho na yin te /
analyzed: des mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni gzhan dbang kho na yin te /
translated: That characteristic which is the adherence to that is the other-dependent alone,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rang gi ngo bo nyid byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rang gi ngo bo nyid byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the unreal imagination creates its own nature.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa kho na yin te /
translated: That characteristic which is the non-adherence to that is the perfectly established alone,

original: zag pa med pa'i shes pa la sogs pas rang gi ngo bo nyid byed pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes pa la sogs pas rang gi ngo bo nyid byed pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: because the uncontaminated wisdom and so forth create its own nature.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang ngo bo nyid gnyis ni brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang ngo bo nyid gnyis ni brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: The Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra also says, “The two natures are to be expressed.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rjod par byed pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rjod par byed pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The imagined nature is the expression.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba gnyi ga yang ngo bo nyid gsum du gtogs so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba gnyi ga yang ngo bo nyid gsum du gtogs so zhes bshad do //
translated: The Vyakhyayukti explains that both the expression and the expressed are included in the three natures.

original: zhib tu rnam par dbye ba ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i 'grel pa las byung bas de bzhin du rig par bya'o /
analyzed: zhib tu rnam par dbye ba ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i 'grel pa las byung bas de bzhin du rig par bya'o /
translated: The detailed analysis should be understood according to the Vimsakavrtti.

original: // / gzhan yang yon tan 'byung gnas mtshan ma dang ming @265b 'brel pas rkyen byas pa'i phyir ni kun brtags pa'i mchan nyid rab tu shes so zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa brtags pa'i sgo las brtsams nas mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rab tu
analyzed: // / gzhan yang yon tan 'byung gnas mtshan ma dang ming @265b 'brel pas rkyen byas pa'i phyir ni kun brtags pa'i mchan nyid rab tu shes so zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa brtags pa'i sgo las brtsams nas mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rab tu
translated: Moreover, from the words, “The wise bodhisattva should understand that the imagined nature is the sign that is the cause of the arising of the expression, because it is the condition for the connection of name and sign,” up to the words, “The dependent nature is the cause of the arising of the expression,” the text explains the second topic, the method of investigation, which is the method of investigation of the three natures.

original: bstan pa'o // 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: bstan pa'o // 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts.

original: tshig rkyang pas rgya cher rnam par bshad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig rkyang pas rgya cher rnam par bshad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The extensive explanation by way of prose and the brief indication by way of verse.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The first is also twofold:

original: mtshan nyid mdor rnam par phye nas gzhan dag la khong du chud par bya bar bskul ba dang / mtshan nyid gsum po snga ma nyid las brtsams nas rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i sgo yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mdor rnam par phye nas gzhan dag la khong du chud par bya bar bskul ba dang / mtshan nyid gsum po snga ma nyid las brtsams nas rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i sgo yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: The brief indication of the characteristics and the exhortation to understand them by others and the correct teaching of the door of yoga meditation on the three characteristics themselves.

original: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du ni rnam pa gnyis su phye nas bstan te /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du ni rnam pa gnyis su phye nas bstan te /
translated: In another enumeration of the explanation, it is taught as twofold:

original: rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i sgo nas bstan pa dang / 'di ltar yon tan 'byung gnas zhes bya ba man chad kyis snga ma'i rnal 'byor bzlas nas zhus pa snga ma'i lan gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i sgo nas bstan pa dang / 'di ltar yon tan 'byung gnas zhes bya ba man chad kyis snga ma'i rnal 'byor bzlas nas zhus pa snga ma'i lan gsungs pa'o //
translated: The teaching by way of yoga meditation and the teaching by way of the question and answer of the former yoga.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: The first is also divided into three:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gsum khong du chud pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba man chad kyis ngo bo nyid gsum shes pa'i dbang gis mtshan nyid gsum khong du chud par 'gyur ba bstan pa dang /🔽rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba man chad kyis mtshan nyid shes pa'i dbang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gsum khong du chud pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba man chad kyis ngo bo nyid gsum shes pa'i dbang gis mtshan nyid gsum khong du chud par 'gyur ba bstan pa dang / rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba man chad kyis mtshan nyid shes pa'i dbang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs nas /
translated: The explanation of the characteristic of the bodhisattvas’ comprehension of the three natures, and the explanation of the comprehension of the three natures through the power of knowing the three natures beginning with “Son of noble family,” and🔽the explanation of the comprehension of the three characteristics through the power of knowing the three natures beginning with “Son of noble family,” and

original: rnam par byang ba mngon du byed par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba mngon du byed par bstan pa'o //
translated: the explanation of the abandonment of affliction and the realization of purification through the power of knowing the three characteristics.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod mod kyi /
translated: Although there are these two explanations,

original: 'dir ni re zhig bshad pa phyi ma la brten nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni re zhig bshad pa phyi ma la brten nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: here the explanation is based on the latter explanation.

original: 'di ni dang po ngo bo nyid gsum shes par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ngo bo nyid gsum shes par bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the first explanation of the knowledge of the three natures.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because the three natures are different,

original: de las rnam pa gsum du dbye'o //
analyzed: de las rnam pa gsum du dbye'o //
translated: they are divided into three aspects.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di ltar brjod par bya ba'i mtshan dang / rjod par byed pa'i ming phan tshun 'brel pas rkyen byas pa'i phyir /🔽yang dag pa ma yin pas brtags pa'i mtshan nyid de kun brtags pa yin par rab tu shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: 'di ltar brjod par bya ba'i mtshan dang / rjod par byed pa'i ming phan tshun 'brel pas rkyen byas pa'i phyir / yang dag pa ma yin pas brtags pa'i mtshan nyid de kun brtags pa yin par rab tu shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Thus, the name that is the object of expression and the name that is the expression are mutually related and act as conditions.🔽Since they are not real, the characteristic that is imputed is thoroughly known to be an imaginary entity.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ci zhig la dmigs par @266a * //🔽blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ci zhig la dmigs par @266a * // blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: Thus, the Yogācāryabhūmi Śāstra says, “What is the imagined entity?

original: smras pa / mtshan ma dang ming 'brel pa la dmigs par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: smras pa / mtshan ma dang ming 'brel pa la dmigs par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It should be viewed as the object of observation that is the connection between a sign and a name.”

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa gsum bstan pa'i bstan bcos las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa gsum bstan pa'i bstan bcos las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The extensive differentiation should be understood in accordance with what appears in the treatise that teaches the three nonentities.

original: de nyid las kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid med pas ming la sogs pa'i chos lnga po dag gis ma bsdus so //
analyzed: de nyid las kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid med pas ming la sogs pa'i chos lnga po dag gis ma bsdus so //
translated: That very text says, “The imagined entity is not included in the five phenomena such as name and so on because it does not have its own characteristic.”

original: bdag nyid med na ji ltar rtog par byed ce na /
analyzed: bdag nyid med na ji ltar rtog par byed ce na /
translated: If there is no self, how can one imagine?

original: smras pa / ming kho nar zad kyi don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / ming kho nar zad kyi don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Reply: It is just a name, because there is no object.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽dper na 'jig rten pa rnams don las ming btags pas skye bo rnams ming la mngon par zhen nas /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / dper na 'jig rten pa rnams don las ming btags pas skye bo rnams ming la mngon par zhen nas /
translated: Why is that?

original: don gyi ngo bo nyid du rtogs pas ming ni don gyi ngo bo nyid do zhes zer ba lta bu dag ni phyin ci log yin pas ming du rnam par rtog pa tsam du zad de yang dag pa'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo nyid du rtogs pas ming ni don gyi ngo bo nyid do zhes zer ba lta bu dag ni phyin ci log yin pas ming du rnam par rtog pa tsam du zad de yang dag pa'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, worldly people, having imagined a name from an object, cling to the name, and because of that, they imagine the nature of the object. Therefore, they say, “The name is the nature of the object.” But that is mistaken, because it is just imagination in the name, since there is no true nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ming dang don de dag gi phan tshun gcig la gcig glo bur yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang don de dag gi phan tshun gcig la gcig glo bur yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the name and the object are mutually adventitious to each other.

original: de ltar ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How is that known?

original: don rnam pa gsum gyi phyir don 'di shes par 'gyur te ming gi blo mi skye ba dang / bdag nyid mang po 'gal ba'i skyon dang / bdag nyid sna tshogs 'gal pa'i skyon no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: don rnam pa gsum gyi phyir don 'di shes par 'gyur te ming gi blo mi skye ba dang / bdag nyid mang po 'gal ba'i skyon dang / bdag nyid sna tshogs 'gal pa'i skyon no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: This meaning is understood for three reasons: the non-arising of the idea of name, the fault of the contradiction of multiplicity in the self, and the fault of the contradiction of diversity in the self.

original: zhib tu de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the Madhyantavibhāga.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par ston to //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par ston to //
translated: The Mahāyānasaṃgraha also teaches in accordance with this.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen pas rkyen byas pa'i phyir ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen pas rkyen byas pa'i phyir ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa ste /
translated: The second explanation of the dependent characteristic is: “The dependent characteristic is fully understood because of the conception of the imagined characteristic as a condition.”

original: 'di ltar kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa nyid du rkyen byas pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skyes par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa nyid du rkyen byas pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skyes par gyur pa ste /
translated: Thus, the other-dependent reality is produced because the imagined reality acts as a condition for the adherence to the imagination of thatness.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /🔽gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la ngo bo nyid dang po nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la ngo bo nyid dang po nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the Vyakhyayukti states:

original: yongs su bsgo ba bskyed nas kun nas nyon mongs pa mngon par 'grub po zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: yongs su bsgo ba bskyed nas kun nas nyon mongs pa mngon par 'grub po zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Because of the adherence to the imagined reality as the first reality, the other-dependent reality is produced and the process of affliction is generated.

original: gzhan @266b yang de nyid las kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par zhen pa bskyed pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang yin par rab tu shes so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan @266b yang de nyid las kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par zhen pa bskyed pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang yin par rab tu shes so zhes bshad do //
translated: Moreover, the same text states: It is known as other-dependent because it generates the adherence to the imagined reality.

original: de ltar mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de ni rkyen las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de ni rkyen las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That adherence is produced from conditions.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i bstan bcos las gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid rgyu dang rkyen gang yin pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i bstan bcos las gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid rgyu dang rkyen gang yin pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What are the causes and conditions for the nature of other?

original: smras pa / kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir rab tu snang bar gyur pa yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir rab tu snang bar gyur pa yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: It is said: “It is the appearance due to the attachment to the nature of imagination.”

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyi gar gtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyi gar gtogs pa yin na /
translated: Since the dependent is included in both the afflictions and purification,

original: ci'i phyir mngon par zhen pas rkyen byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mngon par zhen pas rkyen byas pa'i phyir /
translated: why is it that due to the condition of attachment

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: one understands the nature of the dependent?

original: rgol ba 'di'i lan brda sprod pa ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du bstan pa dag nyid yin te /
analyzed: rgol ba 'di'i lan brda sprod pa ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du bstan pa dag nyid yin te /
translated: The response to this objection is taught in the Yogācārabhūmi:

original: de'i phyir de nyid las gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yang dag pa'i shes pas kyang bsdus pa yin na ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yang dag pa'i shes pas kyang bsdus pa yin na ni /
translated: Therefore, if the dependent nature is also included in correct knowledge,

original: des na gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhe na pa la brten nas shes par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhe na pa la brten nas shes par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa /
translated: Therefore, the dependent nature is known in dependence on the manifest clinging to the imagined nature.

original: de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / de ni kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'i phyogs kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid las bsams pa yin gyi /
analyzed: smras pa / de ni kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'i phyogs kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid las bsams pa yin gyi /
translated: That is conceived from the dependent nature that is the afflicted class.

original: rnam par byang par gyur pa'i phyogs las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par byang par gyur pa'i phyogs las ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not from the class that is the purified class.

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i phyogs ni mngon par zhen pa med pa la brten nas shes par 'gyur ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i phyogs ni mngon par zhen pa med pa la brten nas shes par 'gyur ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: It should be understood that the class that is the purified class is known in dependence on the absence of manifest clinging.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pas rkyen byas pa'i phyir ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni gsum pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa ste
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pas rkyen byas pa'i phyir ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni gsum pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa ste
translated: This is the third, the explanation of the thoroughly established character.

original: / 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba las yongs su grub pa skye ba'i phyir mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: / 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba las yongs su grub pa skye ba'i phyir mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus, the thoroughly established is generated from the absence of the manifest adherence to the dependent, and so the absence of manifest adherence is mentioned.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la dmigs pa gang yin pa @267a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la dmigs pa gang yin pa @267a * //
translated: Therefore, the Bodhisattvabhumi says, “That which is the object of the imagined nature

original: de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la gtan du ma grub par shes par bya'o zhes 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la gtan du ma grub par shes par bya'o zhes 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: should be understood as never established in the dependent nature.”

original: yang na mngon par zhen pa med pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: yang na mngon par zhen pa med pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yin te /
translated: Or else, the absence of manifest adherence is the noble path.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “non-attachment.”

original: de ni 'di skad du lam la rgyu nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du lam la rgyu nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being taught: “Because there is no attachment to the path as a cause, the perfected nature is attained.”

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo gzhan las kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa med pa las shes par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo gzhan las kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa med pa las shes par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Levels of Yogic Deeds says, “The Bhagavān said in another sūtra that the imputed nature should be understood as the absence of attachment.”

original: ngo bo nyid 'di ni yongs su dag pa thob pa la brten nas bshad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid 'di ni yongs su dag pa thob pa la brten nas bshad pa yin gyi /
translated: This nature is explained in terms of attaining purity.

original: mtshan nyid la brten nas bshad pa ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid la brten nas bshad pa ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is not explained in terms of characteristics.

original: de la mdo gzhan las zhes bya ba ni mdo 'di nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: de la mdo gzhan las zhes bya ba ni mdo 'di nyid la bya'o //
translated: In this passage, “in another sūtra” refers to this very sūtra.

original: yongs su dag pa thob pa las zhes bya ba ni nang gi de bzhin nyid kyi 'phags pa'i lam thob pa la brten nas mngon du byas pa'i don rab tu bstan pa'am /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa thob pa las zhes bya ba ni nang gi de bzhin nyid kyi 'phags pa'i lam thob pa la brten nas mngon du byas pa'i don rab tu bstan pa'am /
translated: The phrase having attained complete purity indicates that the reality of the internal is realized in dependence upon the attainment of the noble path.

original: yang na 'phags pa'i lam gyi stobs kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs nas rnam par byang ba de bzhin nyid thob pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'phags pa'i lam gyi stobs kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs nas rnam par byang ba de bzhin nyid thob pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, the phrase having attained complete purity means that the reality of purification is attained by the power of the noble path after the relinquishment of the afflicted entities.

original: 'thob par byed pa'i lam la brten nas mngon du byas pa'i don rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'thob par byed pa'i lam la brten nas mngon du byas pa'i don rab tu bstan pa'o //
