original: mtshan nyid la brten nas bshad pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba 'di ni btags pa'i mtshan nyid spangs pa la brten nas yongs su grub pa bstan pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid la brten nas bshad pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba 'di ni btags pa'i mtshan nyid spangs pa la brten nas yongs su grub pa bstan pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase having attained complete purity indicates that the reality of the internal is realized in dependence upon the attainment of the noble path.🔽 The phrase having attained complete purity means that the reality of purification is attained by the power of the noble path after the relinquishment of the afflicted entities.

original: bshad pa snga ma dang sbyar na mdo zhes bya ba ni mdo gzhan dag las khungs bstan pa'o //🔽kha cig na re mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bshad pa snga ma dang sbyar na mdo zhes bya ba ni mdo gzhan dag las khungs bstan pa'o //🔽kha cig na re mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase having attained complete purity indicates that the reality of the internal is realized in dependence upon the attainment of the noble path.🔽 The phrase having attained complete purity means that the reality of purification is attained by the power of the noble path after the relinquishment of the afflicted entities.🔽 The phrase having attained complete purity indicates that the reality of the internal is realized in dependence upon the attainment of the noble path.🔽 The phrase having attained complete purity means that the reality of purification is attained by the power of the noble path after the relinquishment of the afflicted entities.🔽 The phrase having attained complete purity indicates that the reality of the internal is realized in dependence upon the attainment of the noble path.🔽 The phrase having attained complete purity means that the reality of purification is attained by the power of the noble path after

original: mngon par zhen pa po gzhan gyi dbang dang mngon par zhen par bya ba kun du rtog pa med pa'i phyir mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa po gzhan gyi dbang dang mngon par zhen par bya ba kun du rtog pa med pa'i phyir mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: It is said to be non-apprehending because there is no other dependent that apprehends and no imagination that is apprehended.

original: bstan bcos sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa las yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ci'i phyir rgyus mngon par grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa las yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ci'i phyir rgyus mngon par grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In the treatise Teaching the Buddha-essence, it says, “Why does the thoroughly established nature come to be established by causes?”

original: smras pa / kun du rtog pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang shin tu mi dmigs pas rab tu phye bas so zhes 'byung ba ni lo ts'a ba dag gis nor te /
analyzed: smras pa / kun du rtog pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang shin tu mi dmigs pas rab tu phye bas so zhes 'byung ba ni lo ts'a ba dag gis nor te /
translated: The answer is, “It is distinguished by the non-apprehension of imagination and the dependent.” This is a mistake by the translators.

original: gzhan gyi @267b dbang rnam par 'jog pas bdag nyid kyis yod par 'dod pa'i gzhung bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi @267b dbang rnam par 'jog pas bdag nyid kyis yod par 'dod pa'i gzhung bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would contradict the treatises, such as the Yogācāra Levels, which posit the dependent and assert that it exists by way of its own identity.

original: rigs kyi bu gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na mtshan nyid med pa'i chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na mtshan nyid med pa'i chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba
translated: Son of noble family, if bodhisattvas know the imagined nature of the dependent nature of phenomena just as it is, then they will know all phenomena that lack characteristics just as they are.

original: bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba 'di man chad gnyis pa ngo bo nyid shes pa'i dbang gis mtshan nyid gsum khong du chud par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba 'di man chad gnyis pa ngo bo nyid shes pa'i dbang gis mtshan nyid gsum khong du chud par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: This passage from “just as it is” up to “they will know all phenomena that lack characteristics” teaches that by the power of knowing the nature, one will comprehend the three natures.

original: mtshan nyid gsum mi mthun pa nyid kyis de las gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum mi mthun pa nyid kyis de las gsum du dbye ste /
translated: The three natures are differentiated into three by their dissimilarity.

original: 'di ni dang po kun brtags khong du chud pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po kun brtags khong du chud pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: This is the first.

original: mtshan nyid med pa khong du chud par 'gyur par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa khong du chud par 'gyur par bstan pa'o //
translated: It teaches that by comprehending the imagined, one will comprehend the absence of characteristics.

original: 'dir gong du bshad pa ltar mtshan ma dang mi 'brel bas rkyen byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir gong du bshad pa ltar mtshan ma dang mi 'brel bas rkyen byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, as explained above, because it is conditioned by being connected with signs,

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du kun brtags ming dang / rgyu mtshan btags pa tsam du rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du kun brtags ming dang / rgyu mtshan btags pa tsam du rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
translated: The imaginary is posited as mere names and reasons, just as they are imagined to be in reality.

original: yang dag par rang gi ngo bo ni med do zhes shes pa des na brtags pa thams cad mtshan nyid med pa chos su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag par rang gi ngo bo ni med do zhes shes pa des na brtags pa thams cad mtshan nyid med pa chos su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: But their own nature does not exist. By knowing that, one knows all the imagined characteristics as they are in reality, as phenomena without characteristics.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: If the bodhisattvas know the dependent nature as it is in reality,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gzhan gyi dbang shes pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang shes par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gzhan gyi dbang shes pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang shes par bstan pa ste /
translated: they know all phenomena with afflicted characteristics as they are in reality. This teaches that knowing the second, the dependent nature, also means knowing the afflicted characteristics.

original: 'di ltar rgyu mtshan la brtags pa 'byung ba dag ni gzhan gyi dbang yin no zhes shes pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu mtshan la brtags pa 'byung ba dag ni gzhan gyi dbang yin no zhes shes pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad ni /
translated: Thus, it is known that the dependent is that which arises from causes and conditions.🔽

original: gzhan gyi dbang yin par rab tu shes par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang yin par rab tu shes par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Thus, by the mere understanding that the dependent is that which arises from reasons, one will fully understand that all afflictions are dependent.

original: de la snga ma ni spyir brtag pa'o //
analyzed: de la snga ma ni spyir brtag pa'o //
translated: The former is the general investigation.

original: de la phyi ma ni rnam par phye ste rnam par brtags pa yin pas /
analyzed: de la phyi ma ni rnam par phye ste rnam par brtags pa yin pas /
translated: The latter is the specific investigation.

original: snga phyi'i mtshan nyid gnyi ga yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //🔽gzhan yang snga ma ni rang gi ngo bo nyid las brtsams nas /
analyzed: snga phyi'i mtshan nyid gnyi ga yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o // gzhan yang snga ma ni rang gi ngo bo nyid las brtsams nas /
translated: Thus, the characteristics of the former and the latter should be understood as such.

original: gzhan gyi dbang @268a * //🔽brtag pa rnam par 'byed pa'o //🔽phyi ma ni bye brag las brtsams nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang @268a * // brtag pa rnam par 'byed pa'o // phyi ma ni bye brag las brtsams nas /
translated: Moreover, the former is the investigation of the dependent nature in terms of its essence.

original: gzhan gyi dbang brtag pa rnam par 'byed pa'o //🔽gzhan yang snga ma ni ji snyed pa yod pa nyid las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang brtag pa rnam par 'byed pa'o // gzhan yang snga ma ni ji snyed pa yod pa nyid las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The latter is the investigation of the dependent nature in terms of its distinctions.🔽Moreover, the former is in terms of the existence of things as they are.

original: phyi ma ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The latter is in terms of the existence of things as they are not.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na /
translated: If bodhisattvas know the perfectly real nature of the perfected nature just as it is,🔽they know all phenomena just as they are in terms of the nature of purification.

original: rnam pa byang pa'i mtshan nyid kyis chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni gsum pa yongs su grub pa'i shes pa nyid kyis rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes par 'gyur bar bstan pa ste
analyzed: rnam pa byang pa'i mtshan nyid kyis chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni gsum pa yongs su grub pa'i shes pa nyid kyis rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes par 'gyur bar bstan pa ste
translated: This is the third, showing that by the knowledge of the perfected nature itself, they come to know the nature of purification.

original: / 'di ltar kun brtags la mngon par zhen pa med pas rkyen byas pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i chos yongs su grub pa yang rab tu shes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: / 'di ltar kun brtags la mngon par zhen pa med pas rkyen byas pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i chos yongs su grub pa yang rab tu shes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, because they are not attached to the imagined, they also come to know the perfected nature of purified phenomena, which is the cause of the conditions.

original: rigs kyi bu gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na /
translated: Son of noble family, if bodhisattvas know the nature of the dependent nature just as it is,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spong ngo zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa shes pa'i dbang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs nas rnam par byang ba mngon du byed par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spong ngo zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa shes pa'i dbang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs nas rnam par byang ba mngon du byed par bstan pa'o //
translated: The passage from one abandons the phenomena characterized by thorough affliction up to here is the third, which teaches that one abandons thorough affliction through the power of knowledge and actualizes complete purification.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te mtshan nyid med pa shes pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos spong bar bstan pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par byang ba 'thob par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te mtshan nyid med pa shes pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos spong bar bstan pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par byang ba 'thob par bstan pa'o //
translated: This also has two parts: teaching the abandonment of afflicted phenomena through the knowledge of the absence of characteristics and teaching the attainment of complete purification through the abandonment of thorough affliction.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos de la yang bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos de la yang bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: There are also three explanations of that phenomenon without characteristics.

original: kha cig na re btags pa'i ngo bo nyid sems kyis su yod ces bshad par zad kyi yang dag par yod pa ma yin te mtshan nyid thams cad du med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re btags pa'i ngo bo nyid sems kyis su yod ces bshad par zad kyi yang dag par yod pa ma yin te mtshan nyid thams cad du med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Some say that it is explained as the imputed nature, which exists as the mind but does not exist in reality, because it is said to be without characteristics since it lacks all characteristics.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise, the Differentiation of the Middle and the Extremes, teaches:

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rang bzhin gyis med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rang bzhin gyis med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: “Because the imagined nature does not exist intrinsically, it is called ‘characterless.’”

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na mtshan nyid med pa'i chos khong du chud pa'i @268b phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spong🔽bar gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na mtshan nyid med pa'i chos khong du chud pa'i @268b phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spong🔽bar gsungs pa yin te /
translated: When applied to this explanation, the statement “because of comprehending the characterless dharma” means that because the dependent nature does not arise as a dharma characterized by the affliction of the dependent nature, it is said that “the dharma characterized by affliction is completely abandoned.”
